story:
Hello, my name is Joe Francisco. I am an amateur powerlifter by hobby and lifetime athlete by choice. I am a kinesiology major, slowly but surely closing on the light at the end of the tunnel of that degree. Why am I starting now at such a young age? Because there is no time like the present. Running my own gym and helping others to progress in their lives is my dream. Helping others is my true passion. This is my outlet, and my greatest opportunity to bring the sport and lifestyle of powerlifting to the masses.

This campaign will be funding, for the most part, the startup costs of opening the facility, which include some equipment cost and rent costs for the warehouse itself. In addition, it will get the legalities sorted out with insurance and regulations. 

Like I said previously, this is my true passion and calling in life. I want to start now, I want to help as many people as possible, and the sooner we can reach or preferably surpass our goal of only $1200, the sooner we can make this facility a reality. 

Now the part you guys are waiting to hear about… opening a gym can be pretty costly. However, a warehouse gym does not require a lot of cost in the energy department, as the roll up garage door will act as the main light source. My goal is to have 3 cage style racks. This will keep the gym capable of rotating lifters through stations without it getting clogged. With that said, 2 deadlift platforms means the total barbells needed is up to 5. What good are barbells without weight to put on them, eh? At the current going price about $2.00USD having the plates to keep up with that many lifting platforms would be about 2000 lbs in weight plates.

As the list of optimal equipment needed grows, I have decided on the following:

3 standard squat cages on amazon, averaging $350-400 before tax and shipping

http://www.amazon.com/Powerline-PPR200X-PowerLine-Power-Rack/dp/B000VLRVSC/ref=sr_1_2?ie=UTF8&qid=1393197433&sr=8-2&keywords=squat+cage

2 8x8 deadlift platforms, on average about $100 total for the plywood sheets needed 4 sheets per platform. 

2 bench press benches approx $290.00 before tax 

http://www.amazon.com/Valor-Athletics-Inc-BF-Olympic/dp/B0031Q5BTA/ref=pd_sbs_sg_5?ie=UTF8&refRID=1P3FCGH3TA11AA415QB3

5 olympic 7' bars. with center knurl. medium-aggressive knurl. 28.5mm width bar, brand is tentative, i would rather much high quality bars, like those from rogue, or even eleiko, but starting up money will be tight. 

http://www.amazon.com/Cap-Barbell-Pound-Solid-7-Feet/dp/B000RNSDKE/ref=sr_1_4?s=sporting-goods&ie=UTF8&qid=1393197889&sr=1-4&keywords=olympic+bar

Total cost comes out to ~$2750.00 at current market rates, prices subject to change with market value. Price for weight plates will vary with manufacture, brand new will run about $2.00/lbs and used can be for around $.50/lbs, we expect a total of about 2500 lbs needed to run all stations, but probably more. 


Contributing to this campaign will gain you some pretty awesome things! First off, we will begin to generate merchandise, and when we do, we will send you a super awesome t-shirt or tank with our name and logo! If you contribute $50.00 or more you will get the t-shirt or tank, along with membership to the gym for 3 full months and have the ability to attend any 1 of the classes or clinics of your choice! With a donation of $100.00 or more you will receive the same t-shirt and privileges, however the membership lasts 6 months, and you gain access to 2 classes or clinics. Keeping with the current trend, if you contribute $500.00 or more you will receive a super awesome Continental Standard: Power and Fitness t shirt or tank, however your membership to the gym will now last 2 years, you will have access to 3 classes or clinics, and you will receive free 1 on 1 personal coaching for 6 months. 

As a full time student we all know how difficult it is to find work, let alone time to get a workout in. For me, this fulfills both problems, but it will also help many of the people I compete with and go to school with by providing jobs to a college town that is bombarded by industrialism and very specific businesses. In 6 months to 1 year I will be able to overcome the hurdle of getting started and pushing the gym in a position to start flourishing as a business. 

We need as much popularity as possible. Yes donating money is nice, but not all of us can just give people money for things they only believe in from a distance. Please spread the word, if you are a powerlifter, or know any powerlifters in the area, or have any family that is an athlete that live in the area. Remember who we are, give us a shout out; send them the link to this campaign. We will also accept any and all donations of gym equipment you may have just laying around, and you will be compensated for your donation appropriately. Above all, if you see this, please share the crap out of it! Even if you have no interest in the idea, there may be plenty others that you know or maybe you don't know that would be! Thank you!

Update 2/20/2014: We have finally decided on a target date to open, we are going to target June of 2014. We of course need your help and support in order to make this happen, but I know this is possible! Youtube content is in the pipeline, and the final logo is being worked on for the first round of t-shirts. So please check us out, share us, and above all, if you can any donation will help! 

Update 2/23/2014: We have come up with a tentative list of equipment that will be needed. Of course this may not be final, and prices may change, however this will give more light to what we expect to need in order to operate at the capacity we would like to. I am working on finalizing the block scheduling for hours of operation, and will post that in the coming days!

story:
"Be a New Orleanian Wherever You Are," reads my favorite T-shirt. Given to me by a fellow Cajun visiting San Antonio after Hurricane Katrina, the little piece of home could not have proven more precious in the months and years to come. Every time I put it on, it reminds me of the city that raised me, the people who love me, and the food that I cannot wait to share with the rest of the world.

Shrimpfest is the first step in my ability to bring authentic Cajun cooking to Texas, a place that sometimes feels oddly far from the city I call home. Randall and I have been accepted with open arms as food vendors at this seaside event, and if we are able to raise the money here to purchase the food we need to make it happen, we will be the first Cajun booth to show a presence here. The event coordinator, Kristine, is genuinely excited at the prospect of our attendance and contribution to the festival. It is the first event at which I will showcase my true Cajun roots through the passion I have found for cooking as a means of telling a story. Unmistakeabaly authentic red beans and rice, scrumptious seafood gumbo, playful shrimp-stuffed andouille corndogs, and sinfully sweet beignets will all grace the menu at this event. Not only will it be a chance for me to express my Cajun creativity to the public, but it will also be the first of many steps in raising the capital we will need to open our very own restaurant in San Antonio. Le Rêve, as we have thought of naming it, truly would be a dream, an opportunity to bring elevated Cajun cuisine to a city that longs for it, a city full of other displaced New Orleanians just like myself (Kickstarter project #2 to come soon)!

We already know we can make some serious cash to put towards our restaurant dreams. At an event with over 4,000 in attendance last year, we will be the only vendors offering Cajun cuisine. Alongside the endless booths selling shrimp kabobs and fried shrimp baskets will be a couple with a real passion for food that excites and goes beyond the norm in every possible way, food that is carefully crafted by people who really know flavor! Based on statistics from last year's shrimp fest, we are expecting to serve at least 100-150 meals each day of the 2 day event. We are planning to price each of our menu items at an easy $5, putting our sales projections at around $1500 for the weekend. With our food costs only around $500, that is a serious profit! Check out the Shrimpfest page from 2012 here:http://www.seadriftchamber.com/site/2012-shrimpfest/.

Our Cajun fare will fit right into the feel of the event, alongside fishing tournaments for the young and the old, outdoor sporting events like volleyball and horseshoes, and the ever popular summer beauty pageants. There will be plenty of fun to be had in the sun for all in attendance, and we are looking for the opportunity to be one of the lucky food vendors gracing the event and just making people happy. Happiness is a warm gumbo, and that is what we are trying to bring to  Shrimpfest 2013.

We cannot wait to share our food and our joy with the people of Seadrift and, hopefully, in turn, the lovely people of San Antonio and beyond. We would love to share our unique journey with you and pledge to share all we can about the road we take to get there. Regular project updates will be made here, and we hope that you enjoy all of the rewards in store! Please join us on our culinary journey by aiding in our ability to purchase the product we need to feed all these hungry folks! And if you're in the neighborhood, by all means, come check us out! Laissez le bons temps rouler!

story:
The VooDoo Zip Line is Vegas' newest thrill ride being erected on the rooftop of the Rio All-Suite Hotel & Casino.

Two years ago our company had a dream to create one of the most unique amusement attractions in the world. The VooDoo Zip Line attraction is a 490+ foot tall, 1500+ foot long, zip line experience that flies over unparalleled views of the Las Vegas strip.

 

About The Zip Line

Created by New Capital Ventures, the VooDoo Zip Line will connect the two towers of the Rio Las Vegas. The thrill ride will begin on the patio of the VooDoo Rooftop, located on the 50th floor of the Masquerade Tower, and will hurl riders at speeds of up to 33 miles per hour to the adjoining 20-story Ipanema Tower. Guests will make a return trip back to the starting point traveling backwards. The feet-dangling, adrenaline rush will fling two riders at once, more than 490 feet above the ground. Offering one of the best views of the city, the VooDoo Zip Line will boast a 360-degree panorama of the famed Las Vegas Strip and scenic views of the surrounding mountain ranges. The heart-pumping adventure will cover one-third of a mile in one minute and 10 seconds.
 

 

What You Get

As a special thank you to our supporters, we have created exclusive pre-sale packages, unlimited weekend ride passes, and even an exclusive quantity of lifetime passes for the VooDoo Zip Line.

 

$25 Pre Sale Ride & Photo Package

A special rate offered to our early adopters, our presale ride rate grants you a pass to ride the VooDoo Zip Line with front-of-the-line access. You'll also receive a complimentary photo package. This package is a $55+ retail value and good for up to 1 year after the launch. (All rides are subject to periodic blackout dates, inclement weather and availability)

$50 Unlimited Ride Weekend Pass

With the VooDoo Zip Line weekend pass you simply show up at our attraction to activate your pass on any weekend and you will be able to ride free for the entire Friday, Saturday and Sunday period. The weekend pass will also grant you priority line access for the duration of the weekend. The weekend pass is valid for up to 1 year after launch. (All rides are subject to periodic blackout dates, inclement weather and availability)

$125 Lifetime Pass

As a special thank you to our early supporters, we are offering a lifetime pass to a select few as a true VIP status for the VooDoo Zip Line. This lifetime pass is valid for unlimited free rides on the VooDoo Zip Line for the life of the ride. Additionally, you will be given priority line access whenever you visit us at the VooDoo Zip Line. A lifetime pass certificate will be mailed to your home. Additionally, you will be presented with your very own VIP badge when you first visit our attraction. (All rides are subject to periodic blackout dates, inclement weather and availability)

$3000 New Year's Eve Midnight Ride & Bottle Service Package

For years, a local-known fact in Las Vegas has been that the VooDoo Rooftop is the absolute best place to watch the fireworks on New Year's Eve. With this special package you can ring in 2014 with a thrill as you and a guest fly on the VooDoo Zip Line as the ball drops and the fireworks explode! This once in a lifetime photo-op will capture your reaction in front of the world famous Las Vegas Strip with the New Year fireworks show as your backdrop. In addition to you and a guest receiving the thrill ride of a lifetime, you will also enjoy * VIP bottle service complete with your own VIP table at VooDoo Rooftop Nightclub.(Participants must be age 21 or over with a valid ID to redeem)

*There will be a variety of bottles available for you to select from. Please call (702) 777-6875 to inquire about the full menu. We'll be happy to work with the club to accomodate your preference on your special NYE night.

 

FAQs

What are your hours of operation?

12 Noon to 12 Midnight

What days are you open?

We are open 7 days a week

How many can ride at a time?

The VooDoo Zip Line will send riders flying in tandem, so you may ride alone or with a friend

How old do I have to be to ride the VooDoo Zip Line?

We allow riders of all ages from noon to 8:30 PM. After 8:30 PM, all riders must be 21 years of age or older.

How tall do I have to be to ride?

Riders must be 48″ tall or 42″ tall when accompanied by an adult

Is there a weight limit to ride this ride?

Yes, 450 lbs combined for both riders

Where can my friends and family go to watch me ride?

The VooDoo Rooftop sports the very best view in the entire city. Your entourage can cheer you on and watch from the patio on the 51st floor as you fly through the air

Is this campaign being used to help fund the project?

No, the VooDoo Zip Line is a fully funded project and the indiegogo campaign is strictly being used as an exclusive presale platform to help reach a larger audience.

How do I redeem my indiegogo purchase?

Simply present valid ID when you arrive at our attraction and your name and purchase will be logged in our database. Shortly after the completion of our IndieGogo campaign you will also be emailed a redemption code that you may use as backup verification

Why use indiegogo?

Quite simply, we love the site! After watching so many projects with the same entrepreneurial spirit that started our company have the ability to be launched through indiegogo.com, we felt at right home kicking off our very first exclusive offerings here. While the VooDoo Zip Line project is fully funded and ready to launch in matter of weeks, we felt indiegogo was the perfect site to reach the audience that we wanted to experience our ride. There are a ton of cool projects on the site, and being able to be a part of that melting pot made it a no-brainier for us to launch our initial campaign on indiegogo.com

Who We Are

This IndieGoGo campaign was created by New Capital Ventures, LLC. We are Las Vegas based start-up company comprised of entrepreneurs who had a vision to build a one-of-a-kind amusement ride experience in Las Vegas, Nevada. The founders of the VooDoo Zip Line project are Joe Shortal, Stan Checketts, and Jonathan Borchetta. The zip line is a project fully funded by its' owners, set to open this Fall 2013.

Stan Checketts

Prior to creating the VooDoo Zip Line for New Capital Ventures LLC, Stan founded S&S Worldwide, which grew to become the largest manufacturer of thrill rides in USA. To date, the S&S has safely thrilled over 1 Billion patrons in 28 counties worldwide, with customers including Disney, MGM, Six Flags & Cedar Fair. Stan’s engineering accomplishments include the World’s tallest thrill ride (Stratosphere, Las Vegas, NV) and the World’s fastest roller coaster (Guinness World Record in 2002). After dominating the amusement ride industry for well over a decade, Stan decided to use his expertise in precision engineering and manufacturing to develop this cutting edge zip line attraction.

Stan’s engineering accomplishments include the World’s tallest thrill ride (Stratosphere, Las Vegas, NV) and the World’s fastest roller coaster (Guinness World Record in 2002). After dominating the amusement ride industry for well over a decade, Stan decided to use his expertise in precision engineering and manufacturing to develop this cutting edge zip line attraction.

story:
/English translation below/

 

Dragi sadašnji i budući prijatelji Veselog Pijanca!
 

Za one koji nas ne znaju, mi smo Ivan i Jelena Krajačić; optimistični duo zaljubljenika u hranu i putovanja i ovo je naša priča:

"Veseli pijanac" je naš mali ali srcu dragi kulinarski projekt kojim želimo širiti i podržavati street food gastronomiju po raznim manifestacijama diljem Europe i šire, uz Vašu malu pomoć.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Ivan, poznatiji kao Krcko, rođen u Zagrebu 1982., profesionalni je kuhar sa iskustvom rada u brojim restoranima, od restorana tradicionalne kuhinje do onih moderne gastro ponude. Poznati je entuzijast kad je u pitanju hrana i poznati promicatelj hedonizma i uživanja u hrani. Kao i komplementarnim pićima ;)

Jelena, rođena u Splitu 1983.,  glavna je degustatorica i obožavateljica Krckovih delicija i omiljeni mu šegrt; niz godina zdušno ga ohrabruje u dijeljenju kuharskog umijeća i ljubavi prema hrani sa ostakom svijeta.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Već više od deset godina radimo i kuhamo po raznim svjetskim festivalima, koncertima, događanjima te raznovrsnim partyima, uvijek se trudeći podignuti razinu ponude i unijeti nešto novo u tradicionalne recepte i načine pripreme hrane.

 Vjerujemo da uz iskustvo koje imamo, znanje koje smo stekli, želju za stalnim usavršavanjem i veliku ljubav prema kuhanju, možemo usrećiti još puno ljudi! ;)

Budući da svaka ideja treba podršku i poticaj, tražimo od Vas dragih ljudi da nam pomognete da ostvarimo svoj san! 
San je na kotačima! :)
Želja nam je uz Vaše donacije skupiti dovoljno sredstava da kupimo mobilnu prikolicu sa ugrađenom kuhinjom- KITCHEN TRAILER kako bi mogli pokrenuti vlastiti brand balkanskog street food-a.

Postavili smo visoki cilj, sa željom da što profesionalnije možemo zadovoljiti želje naših kupaca a istovremeno u punom sjaju pokazati sve što možemo i znamo na području gastronomije.

Želja nam je širiti gastronomiju Balkana van naših granica a ujedno putem razmjenjivanja iskustava pridonjeti razvoju i raznolikosti street fooda na našim prostorima.

Nema ljepšeg od druženja i upoznavanja s ljudima različitih kultura i običaja a upravo putem hrane iskustva su uvijek iskrena i pozitivna.

Bili u mogućnosti graditi sa nama ovu ideju ili ne; nadamo se da ćemo Vas sresti u bližoj budućnosti i podijeliti svoj stol sa vama!

Zahvaljujemo što ste odvojili malo vremena za nas i pomogli ostvariti jedan veliki san!

Uzdravlje!

Vole vas Ivan i Jelena

 

 

 

Dear old and new Friends of Veseli Pijanac!

For those who do not know us, we are Ivan and Jelena Krajačić ; optimistic duo of food and travel lovers and this is our story:

 „Veseli pijanac“ /"Happy drinker" is our small but heartfelt culinary project with whom we want to spread and support street food gastronomy at various events throughout Europe and beyond, with Your little help.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Ivan, known as Krcko, born in Zagreb 1982., is a professional chef with experience in numerous restaurants, from traditional cuisine to modern gourmet cuisine. He is a well known enthusiast when it comes to food and a famous promoter of hedonism and food enjoyment. With complementary drinks;)


Jelena, born in Split 1983., main taster and a big fan of Krcko's delicacies and his favorite apprentice; for many years she has been encouraging him to share cooking art and love for food with the rest of the world.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 For over a decade we have been cooking at various world recognized festivals, concerts, events and various parties, always striving to raise the level of offerings and bring something new to traditional recipes and ways of preparing food.

 We believe that with the experience we have, the knowledge we have acquired, the desire for constant improvement, and the great love of cooking, we can make many more people happy! ;)

Since every idea needs support and encouragement, we ask You dear ones to help us realize our dream!

Our dream is on wheels :)

Our greatest wish is to raise enough funds, with the help of Your donations, to buy a  KITCHEN TRAILER and finally get our balkanic street food  business rolling! :)

We have set a high goal with the desire to fullfill the needs of our customers more professionally and at the same time to be able to show in full glory everything we can and know in the field of gastronomy.

Our desire is to spread the Balkan gastronomy  beyond our borders and at the same time through the exchange of experiences to contribute to the development and diversity of street food in our area.

 There is nothing better then to socialize and get to know people of different cultures and customs, and through food, experiences are always honest and positive.

 Being able to build this idea with us or not; we hope to meet you in the near future and share our table with you!

 Thank you for spending a little time on us and helping our big dream come true!

Cheers!

With love, Ivan and Jelena

story:
We are the Miami Valley Chili Company and we are seeking $7500 in operating capital to launch Clashmore Mike's Chili Parlor in the historic brewery district of Miamisburg, Ohio. We have identified a location which is fully furnished and equipped that will offer us a turn-key solution and allow us to begin operating quickly so that we can share our passion for a good bowl of chili and a cold craft beer with the good people of the Miami Valley.

We are : 

Brian Walusis (CMO) - card carrying member of the International Chili Society, former restaurant manager, caterer, and business analyst with previous experience in launching a successful small business. Host of a stop on the Columbus, Ohio Food Tour.  My wife Diana will contribute the feminine perspective to the venture.

Tim Upton (VP of Business Strategy) - brewer of beer, sausage grinder & small-scale farmer. 

Mark Walusis (VP of Operations) - recent college grad with a career focus on customer service and business ethics.

Adam Walusis (Marketing and Social Media) - writer and educator with experience in marketing

John Walusis (Technical Advisor) - award winning chili cook and business mentor

While iconic recipe as well as home-style chili honed to perfection is the focus of the business, we will also be serving house made small batch sausage, locally produced and loved for generations, Smales Pretzels, as well as local craft beers. We are passionate about providing a truly unique and satisfying dining experience at a modest price point and contributing to the culinary fabric of the Miami Valley. As "eat local" movements continue to gain traction, we will encourage this practice by sourcing locally whenever possible and supporting local farms and businesses, keeping money at home in the Miami Valley. Your contributions will not only help us begin our business on solid financial footing, but allow us to scale up our "in house" sausage making capabilities and outfit our draft beer taps. Not only will financial contributions go directly to funding the launch and initial operating budget, they will also earn you some cool perks.

Sincerely,

Brian, Mark, Tim, Adam, and John

story:
Zusammenfassung:

Als Mieter einer Genossenschaft bekam ich September 2014 die Information, dass diese Rauchmelder einbauen möchte, die weit mehr können als Rauch zu melden. Die Melder sind mit Sensoren und Mikrofonen ausgestattet, die es prinzipiell ermöglich, dass diverse Daten erfasst werden. Dazu gehören Bewegungsprofile oder sogar Stimmen, wenn die Melder entsprechend manipuliert werden (siehe auch http://www.opengeiger.de/BoesesErwachenRauchmelder.pdf).

Ich halte es für ein grosses Problem, dass die Datensammelwut mittlerweile in die eigene Wohnung getragen wird (http://www.theguardian.com/technology/2014/jan/...). Ferner ist es von aussen nicht erkennbar, ob Geräte entsprechend manipuliert wurden.

Die Genossenschaft sah das nicht so und verklagte mich den Einbau zu dulden. Da weder Amts- noch Landgericht Lust haben sich mit dem Fall zu befassen, habe ich Beschwerde beim Bundesverfassungsgericht eingelegt.

Diese Beschwerde kostet 1.261,40 €, da die Rechtsschutzversicherung diese Kosten nicht trägt.

Der Aufruf:

Ich bitte Euch um finanzielle Unterstützung bei meinem Anliegen, da die Kosten eine große Belastung darstellen. Ich denke es ist es wert, sich dieser Sache anzunehmen, hoffe aber auf Eure Unterstützung.

    Was passiert, wenn die Verfassungsbeschwerde erfolgreich ist?

    In diesem Fall trägt das Land NRW die Kosten des Verfahrens. Ich kann Euch dann leider (laut indiegogo) das Geld nicht zurückzahlen. Daher möchte ich in diesem Fall das Geld an den Kalker Kindermittagstisch (http://www.kalkerkindermittagstisch.de) zu spenden, deren Ziel es ist bedürftigen Kindern eine kostenlose und warme Mahlzeit zur Verfügung zu stellen.

story:
De quoi s'agit-il?

Une monnaie locale complémentaire (MLC) est un bon de soutien à l'économie locale, auquel on accorde la même valeur que l'Euro. Ce bon peut être utilisé dans une zone géographique définie par toutes les personnes, services, commerces, associations,... qui ont marqué leur accord.
Il y en a 13 000 dans le monde, désormais 5 en Belgique, et une soixantaine en France : FUTURE (ARTE) vous les fait découvrir. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mpE8UMMZa9w
C’est un outil de relocalisation de l'économie en favorisant la consommation locale et les circuits courts. Il vise au maintien et à la dynamisation de l'emploi local. Il cherche à renforcer les interactions entre citoyens et commerçants/producteurs d’une même région, et qui permet de conserver les "plus values" du territoire plutôt que les céder aux multinationales situées à Londres, New-York ou Hong-Kong.

L’objectif est de rendre à la monnaie son rôle principal : être un moyen d’échange qui circule, qui ne permet pas aux riches de s'enrichir plus, ni de spéculer. C’est une démarche citoyenne de réappropriation de la monnaie.
Elle contribue également à la diminution de la dépendance énergétique en réduisant le nombre de trajets et les kilomètres que parcourent les biens que l'on consomme.

Concrètement

Le nom de notre bon d’échange/monnaie locale est le Voltî (volontiers en wallon).

Il couvrira les communes de Ciney, Hamois, Havelange, Marche-en-Famenne, Nassogne, Rochefort et Somme-Leuze et leurs périphéries.

Les initiateurs de ce projet innovant et prometteur sont des citoyens de votre région, soucieux de relocaliser l’économie. Ils sont réunis dans le groupe «Monnaie locale – Le Voltî» développé au départ du petit théâtre de la Grande Vie de Forzée et soutenu par le Réseau Financité. 
Après une phase de maturation de près de deux ans, nous - initiateurs du projet - avons accéléré le pas à l'automne 2015 pour mobiliser les forces et co-construire le projet avec toutes les parties prenantes. Nous voilà aujourd'hui prêts à lancer le Voltî, enthousiastes à l'idée de faire notre part. Nous serons accompagnés de nombreux citoyens, professionnels et associations.

Des réunions publiques ont eu lieu dans différentes communes et ont connu un beau succès voire de l'enthousiasme de la part des personnes présentes ce qui nous a conforté dans le développement de notre projet. 

Le Voltî favorisera 

les commerçants engagés dans une démarche de progrès vers des pratiques durables et responsables et s'adresse à tous les citoyens soucieux de se réapproprier la monnaie remettant en cause leur mode de consommation. Le Voltî crée ainsi un cercle vertueux et développe l'économie de proximité. 

Dans un deuxième temps, les euros convertis en Voltî seront déposés sur des comptes épargne auprès de nos partenaires inscrits dans la finance éthique et solidaire. Nous luttons ainsi à notre échelle contre la spéculation (les banques traditionnelles n'ont pas cette masse monétaire à disposition) et une partie des dépôts pourra faire l'objet de micro-crédits dédicacés aux producteurs ou commerçants de la région via un organisme accrédité, moyennant une garantie sur le capital de la part de l'organisme prêteur.


Pourquoi une collecte de fonds?

Nous désirons mettre le Voltî en circulation à l'automne 2016, et pour cela nous devons mettre en œuvre l'impression des coupons-billets, dont le design a été assuré par des artistes locaux et la sécurité sera garantie par différents mécanismes de protection du billet (hologramme, encres non photocopiables, numéro de série,...)

Cette impression sécurisée est coûteuse et nous souhaitons faire appel aux citoyens pour les impliquer dans un projet qui bénéficiera à toute notre région, tout en préservant notre indépendance.

Souhaitez-vous avoir un aperçu de billets de monnaies locales des quatre coins du monde? Cliquez sur le lien ci-dessous:

http://peche-monnaie-locale.fr/billets/

Afin de connaître l'aspect qu'aura le Voltî chez nous, nous vous invitons à aller voir un prototype du billet dans la Galerie de photos.

Nous avons besoin de rassembler 5252€ afin de financer l'impression des premiers billets.
Voici un budget détaillé des différents postes:

  • 3500€ pour l'impression et la sécurisation des 12 500 premiers billets
  • 550€ pour la communication (flyers, autocollants, dossiers commerçants,...)
  • 465€ de frais de Indiegogo
  • 737€ de belles contreparties aux dons que vous nous ferez généreusement
Si nous dépassons le montant de la collecte, nous utiliserons vos dons pour imprimer davantage de billets. Nous estimons que l'impression de 30 à 40.000 Voltî seront nécessaires pour les premières années de fonctionnement.
Pour les professionnels, nous délivrons (sur demande) une facture pour les montants à partir de 50€, pour frais publicitaires.
Si en revanche vous n'avez pas d'argent pour soutenir ce beau projet, n'hésitez pas à partager cette page auprès de vos amis et de vos proches, afin de nous aider à nous faire connaître, et ainsi apporter votre aide à la réussite de ce financement participatif. 
Vous pouvez aussi rejoindre notre groupe de travail, il y a bien des manières de soutenir le projet, que ce soit de par vos compétences ou votre temps. Pour nous contacter: mlc.volti@gmail.com
Tout le groupe porteur du Voltî vous remercie pour votre intérêt!!!

FAQs


Le Voltî est-il légal ? 
Oui, comme n’importe quel monnaie, bon d’achat, chèque-repas ou éco-chèque. Mais le Voltî est seulement valable dans un réseau local clairement identifié, c’est-à-dire auprès des commerçants adhérents au projet sur les entités de Ciney, Hamois, Havelange, Marche en-Famenne, Nassogne, Somme-Leuze et Rochefort ainsi que dans la périphérie directe de cette zone. 
Est-ce que le Voltî va remplacer l’euro ? 
Non, l’euro continuera à circuler dans la région considérée. Mais chez les prestataires membres du réseau, vous pourrez payer en Voltî à la place des euros. 
Quelles différences avec l’euro ? 
Il y a plusieurs différences importantes:
  • Premièrement, le Voltî est confiné à une zone locale et à un réseau identifié de prestataires. 
  • Deuxièmement, c’est un système d'échange plus éthique parce que les prestataires s’engagent dans une démarche écologique, relocalisante, humaine et citoyenne. 
  • Troisièmement, c’est un système d'échange sans intérêt : personne n’aura intérêt à conserver des Voltî pour spéculer, mais au contraire, tout le monde aura intérêt à les faire circuler. 
Pourquoi utiliser un bout de papier qui a la même valeur que l'euro plutôt que l'euro lui-même ? 
Le Voltî n’a de valeur que localement. En restant nécessairement dans la région, il augmente sa richesse, alors que l’euro est conçu pour le grand marché, l’import-export, la spéculation sur les matières premières, etc. C’est avec nos épargnes en euros que nous finançons les délocalisations de nos industries et nos emplois. Plus de 85 % de la masse monétaire nourrit l’économie spéculative au détriment de l'économie réelle. Les commerçants qui reçoivent des Voltî chercheront à s'approvisionner et à s'achalander dans la région plutôt que sur les marchés internationaux.
Comment le Voltî fait-il pour relocaliser ? 
Pour les particuliers, le Voltî peut servir à relocaliser leurs échanges (préférer acheter local plutôt que de recourir aux zones commerciales et aux multinationales).
Pour les prestataires, le Voltî peut les inciter à relocaliser leur approvisionnement ; ils y ont même un intérêt direct : éviter le prélèvement (commission ou rédimage) lors de la reconversion vers l’euro. A titre dérogatoire, durant les premières années, le prélèvement sera nul sur les reconversions, pour instaurer la confiance – la mise en place de ce prélèvement sera décidé par l'assemblée générale).
Est-ce qu’il existe déjà des monnaies locales complémentaires ? 
Oui, partout dans le monde, et depuis très longtemps. Il y en a quelques unes en Belgique pour l’instant, plus d’une trentaine en Allemagne, plus d’une centaine aux Etats-Unis, en Amérique du Sud… et même en Suisse.
Est-ce que j’utilise déjà une monnaie complémentaire sans en avoir conscience ? 
Oui !! Les chèques-repas, les miles des compagnies aériennes ou les points offerts sur les cartes de fidélité des grandes surfaces s’assimilent à cette pratique… Mais ces monnaies ne sont pas locales, elles sont seulement utilisables dans certains commerces ou compagnies aériennes. 
Est-ce que le Voltî est juste une carte de fidélité ? 
Non, parce qu’avec vos Voltî, vous pourrez non seulement payer les commerçants mais aussi régler votre cotisation à une association locale, payer votre kiné, etc., pour autant que ces personnes adhèrent au projet. Et, s’ils le désirent, certains – pas tous – commerçants-prestataires pourront ajouter un « geste commercial » sous forme de ristourne… ou de Voltî, à l'instar des cartes de fidélité. 
Est-ce qu’on peut acheter n’importe où et n’importe quoi avec le Voltî ? 
Non, seulement chez les commerçants-prestataires qui adhéreront à l’association et à sa charte de valeurs. Ils seront référencés dans un guide, sur internet, et on les reconnaîtra grâce à un autocollant sur leur vitrine. Cette liste sera mise à jour régulièrement.
Si je suis un prestataire, qu’est-ce que je fais des Voltî que je reçois de mes clients ? 
Vous avez plusieurs options : 
  • vous pouvez payer en Voltî un de vos fournisseurs s’il les accepte (s’il ne les accepte pas, c’est l’occasion de lui proposer de se joindre au mouvement). 
  • vous pouvez, au lieu de rendre de la monnaie en euros, la rendre en Voltî à vos clients (moyennant leur accord, bien entendu). 
  • vous pourriez accorder une ristourne en Voltî à vos clients et avec l’accord de vos collaborateurs ou de vos jobistes, vous pourriez leur octroyer certains avantages extralégaux en Voltî. Bien entendu, en tant que particulier utilisateur de Voltî, vous pourriez aussi les dépenser chez un autre prestataire du réseau.
  • en dernier recours, vous pouvez reconvertir vos Voltî en euros.
Puis-je reconvertir mes Voltî en euros ? 
Les utilisateurs particuliers doivent dépenser leurs Voltî chez un prestataire.
Seuls les prestataires de biens et services adhérents à l'asbl et figurant à l’annuaire du Voltî ont la possibilité de reconvertir les Voltî détenus en euros avec application d'une commission de change.
Les prestataires de biens et services qui acceptent d'être comptoirs de change seront exonérés de la dite commission de change. Et à titre dérogatoire, cette commission ne sera pas appliquée au début du système, le temps d'instaurer la confiance dans le Voltî. L'assemblée générale décidera du taux (aux alentours de 2,5 %) et du moment à partir duquel cette commission sera réclamée.
Que deviennent les euros que j’échange contre des Voltî ? 
Les euros collectés par les conversions en Voltî seront placés : 
  • pour partie, dans une institution bancaire s’inscrivant dans le secteur de la finance solidaire et éthique de façon à permettre des retraits à vue ou très rapides (par exemple, pour répondre aux demandes de reconversion) ;
  • pour partie, auprès d’un organisme accrédité pour participer au financement de projets locaux répondant aux critères de la charte (par exemple, micro-crédits auprès de commerçants locaux). 
La somme des montants placés formera le fond de garantie. Il sera géré par l’asbl « Le Voltî ». 
Est-ce que le Voltî va augmenter mon pouvoir d’achat ? 
Pour les utilisateurs particuliers, oui si certains prestataires accordent des réductions du fait de la participation au système (à l'image des cartes de fidélité). 
Pour les prestataires, également : 
  • en recrutant de nouveaux clients particuliers qui choisiraient de se fournir localement en Voltî plutôt qu'en euros dans une grande surface ; 
  • en profitant de la publicité faite dans l'annuaire du Voltî qui sera diffusé et publié sur internet. C'est une visibilité supplémentaire ; 
  • en étant sollicités par d'autres prestataires de biens ou services qui choisiraient de se fournir localement plutôt que via leurs filières traditionnelles et plus éloignées, pour pouvoir écouler les Voltî dépensés chez eux.
Quel est l’intérêt pour un prestataire d’accepter le Voltî ? 
  • Parce que le Voltî va fonctionner comme un « label éthique », un signe de reconnaissance ; en allant chez tel prestataire, les usagers sauront que ce prestataire s’est engagé dans une démarche de relocalisation, de responsabilité écologique, d’attention à la dimension éthique de l’économie… 
  • De plus, l’économie en réseau est un excellent moyen de relocalisation d’une partie des échanges, ce qui ravive l’activité économique locale. 
  • Il est également toujours intéressant, pour un prestataire, de faire partie d’un réseau, local qui plus est. 
Qui va gérer le Voltî ? 
  • Une asbl gérera le projet du Voltî. Elle sera constituée de citoyens consommateurs (les utilisateurs) et de commerçants ou d’acteurs sociaux et culturels ou de pouvoirs publics (les prestataires). 
  • L’assemblée générale et le conseil d'administration seront composés de représentants de chacune de ces catégories d'acteurs.
Comment devenir utilisateur du Voltî ? 
  • Soit en adhérant à l’association (le montant de la cotisation est libre à partir d'1€) ou en convertissant des euros en Voltî dans un comptoir de change de votre commune. 
  • Soit en acceptant qu’un prestataire vous rende votre monnaie en Voltî : il ne vous restera plus qu’à lire l’annuaire des prestataires disponible sur internet et aller y dépenser vos Voltî! 
  • L'asbl étant en autofinancement et non subsidiée, toute contribution volontaire supplémentaire est la bienvenue pour permettre le bon fonctionnement de l'asbl.
Comment fait-on pour se procurer des Voltî ? 
En se rendant chez un prestataire qui a accepté de devenir comptoir de change. L'information se trouve dans le catalogue du Voltî. 
En quoi l'utilisation du Voltî est-elle une démarche citoyenne ? 
  • Parce que vous retrouvez une certaine maîtrise dans l’usage de la monnaie, en participant à une association qui s’est réappropriée le mécanisme monétaire. 
  • En utilisant une monnaie d’initiative citoyenne, vous participez à un mouvement qui crée une confiance nouvelle entre les acteurs d’un territoire. 
  • Parce que le Voltî s’intègre dans un mouvement de convergence avec d’autres démarches citoyennes existantes, comme Rochefort en transition, Ciney en Transition, Colibri-Famenne et leurs marchés fermiers, les GACs de la région,…
Quelles sont les garanties que les billets ne soient pas falsifiés ? 
Les bons d'échange seront sécurisés. Mais qui souhaitera falsifier un bon qui ne circule que localement ?
story_txt:
De quoi s'agit-il?
Une monnaie locale complémentaire (MLC) est un bon de soutien à l'économie locale, auquel on accorde la même valeur que l'Euro. Ce bon peut être utilisé dans une zone géographique définie par toutes les personnes, services, commerces, associations,... qui ont marqué leur accord.

Il y en a 13 000 dans le monde, désormais 5 en Belgique, et une soixantaine en France : FUTURE (ARTE) vous les fait découvrir. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mpE8UMMZa9w

C’est un outil de relocalisation de l'économie en favorisant la consommation locale et les circuits courts. Il vise au maintien et à la dynamisation de l'emploi local. Il cherche à renforcer les interactions entre citoyens et commerçants/producteurs d’une même région, et qui permet de conserver les "plus values" du territoire plutôt que les céder aux multinationales situées à Londres, New-York ou Hong-Kong.L’objectif est de rendre à la monnaie son rôle principal : être un moyen d’échange qui circule, qui ne permet pas aux riches de s'enrichir plus, ni de spéculer. C’est une démarche citoyenne de réappropriation de la monnaie.
Elle contribue également à la diminution de la dépendance énergétique en réduisant le nombre de trajets et les kilomètres que parcourent les biens que l'on consomme.ConcrètementLe nom de notre bon d’échange/monnaie locale est le Voltî (volontiers en wallon).Il couvrira les communes de Ciney, Hamois, Havelange, Marche-en-Famenne, Nassogne, Rochefort et Somme-Leuze et leurs périphéries.Les initiateurs de ce projet innovant et prometteur sont des citoyens de votre région, soucieux de relocaliser l’économie. Ils sont réunis dans le groupe «Monnaie locale – Le Voltî» développé au départ du petit théâtre de la Grande Vie de Forzée et soutenu par le Réseau Financité. 

Après une phase de maturation de près de deux ans, nous - initiateurs du projet - avons accéléré le pas à l'automne 2015 pour mobiliser les forces et co-construire le projet avec toutes les parties prenantes. Nous voilà aujourd'hui prêts à lancer le Voltî, enthousiastes à l'idée de faire notre part. Nous serons accompagnés de nombreux citoyens, professionnels et associations.


Des réunions publiques ont eu lieu dans différentes communes et ont connu un beau succès voire de l'enthousiasme de la part des personnes présentes ce qui nous a conforté dans le développement de notre projet. 


Le Voltî favorisera les commerçants engagés dans une démarche de progrès vers des pratiques durables et responsables et s'adresse à tous les citoyens soucieux de se réapproprier la monnaie remettant en cause leur mode de consommation. Le Voltî crée ainsi un cercle vertueux et développe l'économie de proximité. 


Dans un deuxième temps, les euros convertis en Voltî seront déposés sur des comptes épargne auprès de nos partenaires inscrits dans la finance éthique et solidaire. Nous luttons ainsi à notre échelle contre la spéculation (les banques traditionnelles n'ont pas cette masse monétaire à disposition) et une partie des dépôts pourra faire l'objet de micro-crédits dédicacés aux producteurs ou commerçants de la région via un organisme accrédité, moyennant une garantie sur le capital de la part de l'organisme prêteur.




Pourquoi une collecte de fonds?

Nous désirons mettre le Voltî en circulation à l'automne 2016, et pour cela nous devons mettre en œuvre l'impression des coupons-billets, dont le design a été assuré par des artistes locaux et la sécurité sera garantie par différents mécanismes de protection du billet (hologramme, encres non photocopiables, numéro de série,...)
Cette impression sécurisée est coûteuse et nous souhaitons faire appel aux citoyens pour les impliquer dans un projet qui bénéficiera à toute notre région, tout en préservant notre indépendance.
Souhaitez-vous avoir un aperçu de billets de monnaies locales des quatre coins du monde? Cliquez sur le lien ci-dessous:
http://peche-monnaie-locale.fr/billets/Afin de connaître l'aspect qu'aura le Voltî chez nous, nous vous invitons à aller voir un prototype du billet dans la Galerie de photos.


Nous avons besoin de rassembler 5252€ afin de financer l'impression des premiers billets.

Voici un budget détaillé des différents postes:



3500€ pour l'impression et la sécurisation des 12 500 premiers billets
550€ pour la communication (flyers, autocollants, dossiers commerçants,...)
465€ de frais de Indiegogo

737€ de belles contreparties aux dons que vous nous ferez généreusement


Si nous dépassons le montant de la collecte, nous utiliserons vos dons pour imprimer davantage de billets. Nous estimons que l'impression de 30 à 40.000 Voltî seront nécessaires pour les premières années de fonctionnement.

Pour les professionnels, nous délivrons (sur demande) une facture pour les montants à partir de 50€, pour frais publicitaires.

Si en revanche vous n'avez pas d'argent pour soutenir ce beau projet, n'hésitez pas à partager cette page auprès de vos amis et de vos proches, afin de nous aider à nous faire connaître, et ainsi apporter votre aide à la réussite de ce financement participatif. 
Vous pouvez aussi rejoindre notre groupe de travail, il y a bien des manières de soutenir le projet, que ce soit de par vos compétences ou votre temps. Pour nous contacter: mlc.volti@gmail.com
Tout le groupe porteur du Voltî vous remercie pour votre intérêt!!!


FAQs
Le Voltî est-il légal ? Oui, comme n’importe quel monnaie, bon d’achat, chèque-repas ou éco-chèque.
Mais le Voltî est seulement valable dans un réseau local clairement identifié, c’est-à-dire
auprès des commerçants adhérents au projet sur les entités de Ciney, Hamois, Havelange, Marche en-Famenne,
Nassogne, Somme-Leuze et Rochefort ainsi que dans la périphérie directe de cette
zone. Est-ce que le Voltî va remplacer l’euro ? Non, l’euro continuera à circuler dans la région considérée.
Mais chez les prestataires membres du réseau, vous pourrez payer en Voltî à la place des euros. Quelles différences avec l’euro ? Il y a plusieurs différences importantes:

Premièrement, le Voltî est confiné à une zone locale et à un réseau identifié de prestataires. 
Deuxièmement, c’est un système d'échange plus éthique parce que les prestataires
s’engagent dans une démarche écologique, relocalisante, humaine et citoyenne. 

Troisièmement, c’est un système d'échange sans intérêt : personne n’aura intérêt à
conserver des Voltî pour spéculer, mais au contraire, tout le monde aura intérêt à les faire
circuler. 



Pourquoi utiliser un bout de papier qui a la même valeur que l'euro plutôt que
l'euro lui-même ? 
Le Voltî n’a de valeur que localement. En restant nécessairement dans la région, il
augmente sa richesse, alors que l’euro est conçu pour le grand marché, l’import-export, la
spéculation sur les matières premières, etc. C’est avec nos épargnes en euros que nous finançons
les délocalisations de nos industries et nos emplois. Plus de 85 % de la masse monétaire nourrit
l’économie spéculative au détriment de l'économie réelle. Les commerçants qui reçoivent des Voltî chercheront à s'approvisionner et à s'achalander dans la région plutôt que sur les marchés internationaux.
Comment le Voltî fait-il pour relocaliser ? 
Pour les particuliers, le Voltî peut servir à relocaliser leurs échanges (préférer acheter local plutôt que de recourir aux zones commerciales et aux multinationales).Pour les prestataires, le Voltî peut les inciter à relocaliser leur approvisionnement ; ils y ont même un intérêt direct : éviter le prélèvement (commission ou rédimage) lors de la reconversion vers l’euro. A titre dérogatoire, durant les premières années, le prélèvement sera nul sur les reconversions, pour instaurer la confiance – la mise en place de ce prélèvement sera décidé par l'assemblée générale).


Est-ce qu’il existe déjà des monnaies locales complémentaires ? 

Oui, partout dans le monde, et depuis très longtemps. Il y en a quelques unes en Belgique pour
l’instant, plus d’une trentaine en Allemagne, plus d’une centaine aux Etats-Unis, en Amérique du
Sud… et même en Suisse.

Est-ce que j’utilise déjà une monnaie complémentaire sans en avoir conscience ? Oui !! Les chèques-repas, les miles des compagnies aériennes ou les points offerts sur les cartes de
fidélité des grandes surfaces s’assimilent à cette pratique…
Mais ces monnaies ne sont pas locales, elles sont seulement utilisables dans certains commerces
ou compagnies aériennes. 
Est-ce que le Voltî est juste une carte de fidélité ? Non, parce qu’avec vos Voltî, vous pourrez non seulement payer les commerçants mais aussi régler
votre cotisation à une association locale, payer votre kiné, etc., pour autant que ces personnes
adhèrent au projet.

commercial » sous forme de ristourne… ou de Voltî, à l'instar des cartes de fidélité.

valeurs. Ils seront référencés dans un guide, sur internet, et on les reconnaîtra grâce à un
autocollant sur leur vitrine.
Cette liste sera mise à jour régulièrement.
Si je suis un prestataire, qu’est-ce que je fais des Voltî que je reçois de mes clients ? Vous avez plusieurs options : 

vous pouvez payer en Voltî un de vos fournisseurs s’il les accepte (s’il ne les accepte pas,

vous pouvez, au lieu de rendre de la monnaie en euros, la rendre en Voltî à vos clients (moyennant leur accord, bien entendu).

en Voltî.

autre prestataire du réseau.

Voltî!

story:
Hi, I'm Mickey Phelps and I am a Le Cordon Bleu trained Chef who has studied under Julia Child and Jacques Pepin. I was recently the Executive Chef for nine years at a local catering company. I have worked in restaurants both here and in Europe and had the wonderful experience of opening a local restaurant in 2008.

Starting my own catering company is a dream that marries my life-long passion for food and sharing that food with people.

By leveraging my culinary skills I hope to develop creative new catering options in my local (Santa Cruz County) market. With my skills, industry insight, and a great market opportunity to purchase Sunny's Catering, I expect to be profitable immediately.
The funds are literally the only thing that stands between turning a dream into a reality. By helping that dream come true, you get some great local perks along the way.

I need $30,000 to finalize the purchase of Sunny's Catering (a local, well-known catering company). I will be purchasing Sunny's extensive catering equipment inventory, her large client list, and will have the exclusive use of a professional kitchen to do all of my catering. I will also take over several of Sunny's weekly catering jobs that are stable income. In addition, Sunny's current employees are available to work for me. I have started shadowing Sunny to learn her business, and have already done my first wedding. I currently have monthly caterings booked out till March of next year!

If you know my food, then helping me launch this company assures you a local caterer that you can count on for your next event. Even if you don't know my food, you will be helping a female-owned business move forward.

Like all small businesses, there are risks involved. I need to be able to keep the clients Sunny currently has, and build on that list. What I am discovering is that I have a following of my own and that is giving me the confidence to really show Sunny's clients what I am all about. I handled all the parts of the catering business in my previous job, so I have knowledge about how to run a catering company. 
With regard to building up new clients, I am partnering with Maria Cherem, who will handle all social marketing and publicity. In addition, she will support me on the business end. I believe we can work as a team to really grow the business. And, Maria is not afraid to jump in and help out where she can.

We realize that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Please share this link on your social networks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign!

Thank you for your time,

Mickey Phelps & Maria Cherem

story:
DriWater is the preferred method for watering plants and trees.  Saves water, time and money.                                       

 

What is DriWater?

DriWater is a 100% natural gel made from 98% pure water and 2% food grade ingredients. DriWater is NOT an absorbent polymer.  DriWater's unique gel gradually breaks down when in contact with the natural microorganisms found in soil.  As the gel slowly converts back to liquid, it moves down through the root zone of the plant, delivering moisture at a consistent rate.  No more cycles of being too wet or too dry.  DriWater time release water can water a plant for up to 90 days with less water than ever before.

Production

DriWater is produced in Santa Rosa, California.  We purchase all our materials used in the manufacturing process in the United States, creating jobs all around the country.  DriWater has a shelf life of 18 months. 

                        We are proudly made in the U.S.A.

DriWater has a complete line of products for all your indoor and outdoor watering needs.

 

 

The DriWater Mission

The planet earth has no more water today than it did millions of years ago and only two percent of it is fresh water. Human demand of fresh water is increasing in step with population growth.

The growing shortage of fresh water poses the biggest obstacle to protecting the environment and producing enough food for the burgeoning world population.

Our global mission is to provide solutions to these environmental and human challenges by:

  • Providing high quality water conserving products for worldwide irrigation applications.

  • Passionately working to change the way the world uses water through education, example and extraordinary effort.
  • Responsibly balancing the financial and human needs of our employees, customers and suppliers.

 

How do Homeowners use DriWater? 

People who grow houseplants represent the largest segment of the gardening community.  The biggest challenge-providing their plants with the proper amount of water on a consistent basis.  More plants die from over-or-under watering than any other cause.  DriWater time release water takes the guesswork out of watering. 

Vacations -You are finally ready for that well deserved vacation, you've saved up, packed and re-packed and planned everything down to the last detail.  Even though you hate to do it, we all do, you took the long walk to the neighbors house to ask the dreaded question, "Will you water my plants while I'm gone?"

 

Houseplants DriWater can be used year round for your indoor watering needs.   Remember that plant in the guest room that always looks half dead?  DriWater to the rescue.  No need to write a note to help remember to water.  Ficus trees as well as other finicky plant love the consistent moisture that DriWater delivers.  DriWater eliminates the need to drag the ladder out every week to water plants that are too high up to reach. 

 

Hanging Flower Baskets & Pots We plant beautiful flowers and water every day, spilling water all over and creating a mess.  Unfortunately we miss a day or two and we end up with dry stringy half dead flowers. The only way to fix the situation is to toss everything out and start over.  Next time you plant your hanging baskets or porch pots, add DriWater and cut your watering down to once or twice a week.  DriWater will keep moisture available to the water hungry flowers and hydrate them between waterings. DriWater acts as a supplement for Annual Flowers and Vegetables. Helps keep Grandma off that dangerous ladder too.

Vacation Homes Many of our customers have a vacation cabin or second home.  They find it difficult to add plants to an existing landscape with the limited time they are at the property.  When planting those new trees and shrubs, just add DriWater and the watering is taken care of, allowing new plantings to thrive while you are away.  Our newest product has added nutrients, insuring your plants get the healthy start they need to establish strong root systems.

Vegetable Gardens In our quest to live healthier lives, we have become more aware of what we put into our bodies.  Sales of organic foods have soared in the last 10 years.  More people are growing their own vegetables and enjoying the backyard harvest.  Using DriWater in your vegetable garden will give you more than significant water conservation. This year we watered our vegetable garden only 4 times throughout the entire growing season, saving thousand of gallons of water. Our garden provides over 3,000 pounds of vegetables that we donate to our local food mission.  Watering below the top of the soil has other benefits as well.  Less surface moisture means, less pests and less weeds, saving you hours of time and that sore back.

Trees & Shrubs  It's never been easier to give new plantings a healthy start.  Using DriWater insures that newly planted trees and shrubs will have water available during the critical first few months.  Studies show that plants watered properly develop healthier root systems, allowing for better growth.  DriWater is like insurance for your plants.

 

Do you think DriWater is only used during the summer months?

DriWater opened a new market years ago with Christmas Poinsettia watering.  We found that churches and homeowners alike had a real need for help.  Churches use volunteers to water and that wasn't working out too well for them.  They had problems with over-watering, under-watering and water ruining their beautiful old hardwood floors.  Homeowners are so busy during the holiday season and adding those few extra plants just became too much.  The Poinsettia's would dry out and no matter how much they watered after that, the plants would never recover.  The solution was to apply 2 DriWater Gel Pac's on top of the soil when they first purchased the Poinsettia's.  With DriWater's slow release, the plants only need to be watered once from Thanksgiving through the end of December.

 

 

 

The perfect holiday gift or stocking stuffer 

We all have one or two people in our lives who have absolutely everything and we cringe at the thought of trying to find a gift that they would actually use.  You know the ones, they live to work and when they vacation, they are off to exotic destinations.  They have said it a hundred times, if only I had the time, I would love to have live plants.  But with the long hours and constant work traveling, it's something I realized I had to give up. Wouldn't it be great to hand over a beautiful Poinsettia to them and say, "Don't water this, DriWater is on the job"  Give the Gift of Convenience this year.  DriWater will give them the beautiful plants they crave and no more black thumb comments.  Gifts can be ordered anytime and sent directly to your loved ones in time for the Holiday Poinsettia season.

 

Who is DriWater and what do we do now?

DriWater has been planting trees around the world for over 15 years.  We are committed to conserving the earths most precious resource:WATER  

The company's owners and our employees all have children and know the urgency of reversing some of the damage that has been done to the earth to guarantee a safe future for our children and their children.  We work with a vast variety of customers that include:

  • Government Agencies
  • Irrigation Distributors
  • Non-Profit Groups
  • Retail Stores
  • Churches
  • Homeowners
  • Landscape Contractors
  • Landscape Architects

Who are some of the Non-Profit group we work with?

 

Tree Musketeers-Has a vision in which children all over the world are planting trees and becoming leaders of social change.  With full knowledge that one person, no matter how small, can make a difference. They are united in action to ensure a healthy future for the Earth and themselves.

Canopy-protect and grow the urban forests in Palo Alto, East Palo Alto and neighboring communities. 

The Straw Project-Students and Teachers Restoring A Watershed.  This Watershed education program started in 1992 with 4th grade students.  They work with professional restoration designers and have restored miles of native habitat throughout the California Bay area.  The program increases the students knowledge of their local environment, while helping to reduce the impacts of environmental change.

Sacramento Tree Foundation-Started in 1992, their mission is building healthy, livable communities in the Sacramento region by growing the best urban forest in the nation.  They are on track to plant their 5 millionth tree.

Audubon-Their mission is to conserve and restore natural ecosystems, focusing on birds, other wildlife, and their habitats for the benefit of humanity and the earths biological diversity.

 Why Plant Trees?

  • Trees are invaluable life resources.  They give oxygen to people, animals and the planet, sustaining life on earth.
  • Trees help recharge ground water and sustain stream flow.
  • Suburban streets and parking lots cool off when trees shade them, reducing temperatures.
  • Trees instill community appreciation, add beauty and grace to any community setting, calming people's nerves and may even reduce crime.
  • In 50 years, one tree generates approximately $30,000 worth of oxygen, recycles $35,000 worth of water and removes $60,000 of air pollution.
  • Trees prevent or reduce soil erosion.
  • Trees planted along rivers, streams and lakes reduce water temperature and prevent or reduce bank erosion and silt.  Their root also provide hiding places for fish.
  • Trees add brilliant colors to fall landscapes.
  • Research shows that trees help reduce stress in the workplace and speed hospital patients' recovery.

Commerical users of DriWater

DriWater is beneficial for many commercial applications.  It has started to become the "go to" method for irrigation in areas where water is not accessible.  As the world experiences long droughts, water that was used inefficiently in the pastis no longer the norm.  Agencies are looking for ways to conserve the water we have while continuing to plant trees and shrubs.  This delicate balance required something new and inventive...DriWater

 

  • Bureau of Land Management BLM 
  • National Park Service
  • City and County Public Works Departments
  • US Army and Naval Stations 
  • Landscape Contractors
  • Vineyard Management Companies
  • Federal Highway Department
  • Resource Conservation Districts
  • Caltrans
  • California Conservation Corps  

 

·Eliminate hand or truck watering

·Eliminates temporary irrigation systems

·Less Maintenance and less cost

·Low water use, high survival rates

·Decrease transplant shock

 

What will your help do?

  • Create a new mold for a delivery system to increase water efficiency

  • Create jobs planting trees in our community

  • Encourage community involvement through recognized non-profits

  • Aid in the steps necessary to preserve our planet

  • Clean the air, indoors and outdoors by growing healthy plants and trees

  • Aid countries suffering from inefficient water usage

 

DriWater has created other delivery systems.  We never know what we could run into, but we are very familiar with the process.  We always expect minor challenges or delays but do not foresee any major challenges. Our plan is to keep you informed as we proceed, so will always be in the loop.

If we do not meet of our goal of $25,000, our plans are to continue toward our goal of the new delivery system, of course, every dollar helps. As we proceed toward this goal we will be sending out updates on design.  We want you to be a part of this and your opinion counts.

 

If you can not help today, that is ok with us.  Maybe you know someone who would be interested? Please feel free to forward this information to them, or better yet, share on your facebook page or send out a tweet.  Indiegogo has share tools to help you with this.  We appreciate all your help. 

You can also join our  Thunderclap

 

Frequently Asked Questions

 

What is DRiWATER®and how does it work?

DRiWATER®consists of 98% water and 2% food grade ingredients.  DRiWATER®is 100% natural and harmless to people and animals.  It is not a polyacrylamide polymer!  DRiWATER®begins to liquefy when it comes in direct contact with soil.The enzymes naturally found in soil gradually break down the food grade ingredients and  convert DRiWATER® back into liquid water.  The capillary activity in the soil then carries and maintains the  moisture throughout the root zone for up to 90 days.


Is it possible to over-water using DRiWATER®?

When applied per manufacturers recommended usage, DRiWATER will not over-water plants.  Each 90 -Day Quart carton or Tube and Gel Pac will deliver one ounce of water every three days.  When used to establish native plants outdoors, DRiWATER®is designed to deliver only enough moisture to keep the plant under an  adequate amount of stress, which causes the plant to seek its own moisture source to sustain itself.  When used as supplemental irrigation to aid in ornamental plant establishment in an existing irrigated area, DRiWATER®is designed to deliver enough water to keep the root mass moist between normal irrigation cycles.  If it rains, the enzymes activity is reduced and DRiWATER®almost stops providing moisture. 


Does DRiWATER®freeze?

DRiWATER®freezes when temperatures fall below 25 degrees Fahrenheit and will not be affected when it thaws out.  Bacteria in the soil become dormant at approximately 38 degrees and, at this point, DRiWATER®stops  liquefying.  When temperatures rise, the enzymes become active and the DRiWATER®begins to liquefy again.

 

When temperatures increase will DRiWATER® liquefy at a faster rate?

A little.  DRiWATER®is activated by microbial enzyme activity in the soil; it is not heat-activated like a common polymer.  In high temperatures, the enzymes in the soil continue to break DRiWATER®down at a consistent and steady release rate.  If the plant requires more moisture, additional DRiWATER®or supplemental irrigation should be used.


How can one Quart of DRiWATER®give a plant enough moisture when the  evapo-transpiration (ET) rate of the plant is greater than the liquefaction rate of  DRiWATER®?

In the first year of establishing an indigenous tree or shrub, developing a root system to sustain the plant is the main goal.  If a newly planted tree or shrub is given scheduled watering during its first year, it may encourage the plant to push growth (creating greater ET rates) that it is not yet able to support by the plants root mass.  When a plant is grown in the ground from seed, the root develops in proportion to support plant growth.  When plant materials are grown in containers and transplanted into the ground, it is important to encourage the roots to grow out and develop so they can draw enough moisture and nutrients from the soil to be self-supportive.  During the plants’ early establishment period, most of the moisture the plant is given will remain below the ground within the root mass and ET rates are lower than normal at this time.  Larger plants will require  additional units and high temperatures may require supplemental watering. 

Are there nutrients added to DRiWATER®?

Yes, DRiWATER® Plus and DRiWATER Thrive contain Zinc and Acetic acid to reduce transplant shock and enhance root development. Tests have shown an increase of up to 190% in root growth in 30 days with DRiWATER Plus. DRiWATER Thrive is targeted to maintain plants over time, providing continuous root stimulation. The original DRiWATER® formula of pure potable water and binder is also still available.

Can I fertilize while using DRiWATER®?

Yes, however, during the first year, when establishing indigenous plant materials, fertilizing with a high nitrogen-based fertilizer is generally not recommended.  When DRiWATER® comes in direct contact with  fertilizers, it will cause it to liquefy at a faster rate.  For this reason, when using fertilizers, it is important to check the DRiWATER® after 45 days. 

After DRiWATER® has finished liquefying what should be done with the Quart or the Tube?

The Quart Carton can be pulled out of the ground and recycled or left in the ground to degrade. It will take approximately 6 months to a year to degrade. After removing, simply brush surrounding dirt into the hole. If you are using a Tube, remove the Tube and use it again on another site or recycle it. When using the Tube over an extended period of time, DRiWATER® will leave a protective crust in the bottom of the Tube near the root zone until the time of reapplication.

Does DRiWATER® change the Ph of the soil? 

No, DRiWATER® has a Ph of 5.25 – 5.5 and there is insufficient material to affect the Ph of the soil.

 

How do roots develop when DRiWATER® is applied?

DRiWATER® creates a moisture pocket around the root mass and extends up to 15” under the plant.  The plant does not recognize DRiWATER® as the water source as the roots will grow down deep into the soil. 


When a plant needs more moisture, does DRiWATER® liquefy at a faster rate?

No. Liquefaction is the process of DRiWATER® changing from a solid gel back into liquid water. The liquefaction rates are predictable and are determined by the amount of DRiWATER® exposed to the soil. If a plant needs more moisture, it is necessary to apply more DRiWATER® or use supplemental irrigation.

story:
Support Uncle Bubba's Farm

Uncle Bubba's Farm is a new and small farm located near Utica, Mississippi. It is operated by me (Claire) and my husband Mark with our two children Chloe and Wayne. We believe that raising, growing, and eating healthy food will keep our body and environment healthy.

My husband has more than 30 years of experience in electronics engineering; commercial and residential architecture; fluid mechanics; solar electric and thermal engineering.

I’m from Philippines and grew-up spending time on grandparent’s farm. I have some knowledge of basic farming and simple living.

We need your support to build a farm where we want to live and where we can share with our neighbors, friends and our community to help them learn how to live sustainably and healthy. This will become a model farm to enables children, students, farmers alike to learn and get ideas to help them live a healthier life by raising and growing their own food, or starting their own small farm.


Why support build small-scale farm?

Small-scale farming is in danger of extinction due to large farm corporations that are controlling our food. These large corporations are degrading the fertility of our soils by using mono-crop.

Enables people to easy access on nutritious and high-quality produce, yet, affordable.

People within a community should know their farmers; see and learn how their food is grown and become closer to nature.

It helps preserve the traditional/sustainable way of farming; thus, promotes living sustainably and becoming more self-reliant.

Helps reduce waste, reduces pollution and takes better care of our Earth, the planet where we live.


Our goal is $100,000. In exchange with your support we will provide one or more of the following:

Nutritious food raised and grown on our farm

Farm tour/stay - after our tiny off the grid home construction is complete.

Have the privilege to fish at the lake for a specified period of time.

Share our knowledge/ideas for starting and maintaining a small farm for living sustainably.

Help you design and build an off the grid home solar electric and solar thermal system.

Share our knowledge and ideas learned through years of research and practical experience.


Your support enables the following below; it is in a priority order:

1.) Farm animals and their barns - each breed of chickens and other farm animals will have their own barn

2.) Planting materials; fruit trees and perennial vegetables

3.) Root cellar - for storing produce

4.) Bees and beekeeping materials

5.) Mushroom(s) building

6.) Earthworm barn - for making our own natural fertilizer

7.) Education center/small building - where we can teach and share our knowledge/ideas about growing their own food and living sustainably

8.) Off the grid tiny house - where visitor can stay, 1-2 adult and 1-2 children at a time

9.) Fishing boat - for visitors that like to fish

10. Smokehouse

11.) Other farm tools and materials


Every penny helps! We understand if you can't, however, please share this information with someone you know. We greatly appreciate it. Thank you very much!

- Mark and Claire Hutchins

Website: http://www.unclebubbasfarm.com

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/UncleBubbasFarm

story:
Welcoming Rhode Island

Native Americans and immigrants from many nations have settled in the Ocean State for hundreds of years. From an industrial mill area to an increasingly global hub, Rhode Island has a history of welcoming diverse waves of immigrants and refugees to its shores. 

As our state's demographics changes and the population ages, we need to ensure that our narrative changes so that the story of Rhode Island includes everyone who calls it home. 

Welcoming Rhode Island was launched in October 2011 by Dorcas International Institute of Rhode Island with the mission of bridging the divide between foreign-born newcomers and U.S.-born Rhode Islanders to build strong, vibrant and more cohesive communities across the state.

As an affiliate of Welcoming America, we've been working on it for two years, community by community, neighbor by neighbor, using a three-prong approach:

  •   Local Leadership Development
  •   Public Engagement
  •   Strategic Communications

Welcoming Rhode Island is guided by advisory committees made up of more than 75 leaders representing diverse backgrounds and sectors including business, community agencies, law enforcement, education, faith-based groups and local government.


What We Need & What You Get

To date, we've received support from private foundations, the Rhode Island Council for the Humanities, and our national desk Welcoming America. We've also generated earned income from the trainings and workshops we have provided to businesses, schools and state agencies. 

In order to keep Welcoming Rhode Island running , we need to fill a funding gap of $7,500. These funds will go toward general operating costs, as we try to be resourceful in keeping our program expenses low. 

In return for your support we have some great perks! For every $25 donation we will send you recipe cards with recipes that Rhode Island immigrants and refugees have shared from their home countries. And, for every $50 donation, you will receive your very own "Rhode Island Is Home" t-shirt!

 For a $1,000 you could have a private meet and greet with some of the immigrants and refugees featured in our local story bank!


The Impact

Every dollar we raise is more than just a dollar. It is a pledge to keep Rhode Island a welcoming place for everyone who calls "Little Rhody" home. 

By donating, you'll be helping to continue to the work we started that:

  • Encourages neighbors to exchange stories and profiles how new Rhode Islanders contribute to our economy and enhance our culture
  • Participates and partners with events and activities that highlight our diversity and strengthen community relationships

We've been successful thus far, with our network of Welcoming Ambassadors helping to:

  •  Collect winter coats for newly arrived refugees who have never seen snow
  •  Donating bicycles to help newcomers get around town
  •  Increase parent engagement in local schools
  •  Train employees on cultural competency in order to better serve our community

Earlier this year, we even received the prestigious Metcalf Award for Diversity in the Media for our bus ad campaign and local story bank and that showcases over 45 Rhode Islanders from 37 diverse countries around the world! 


Ways You Can Help

 There are two ways you can move Rhode Island forward today:

  • Invest in making Rhode Island a welcoming place by contributing now! Every dollar counts.
  • Spread the word! Tweet it, pin it, share it. Whatever social media you use, pay it forward!

Rhode Island is Home.
