story:
Hello, I'm John Young a 47 yr old inventor, married with 2 children. I have a totally new way to open boxes and cutting.

Finger Blade is the hands free way to work uninterrupted. Finger Blade straps to your index finger and has a support guard against paper, card board cuts. It has a self retracting blade for safety. It speeds up the process of cutting by allowing both hands to be free at all times. No more stopping to reach, look, or pick up a dropped cutter. And best of all, no one can walk off with it.
 
I work at a department store stocking shelves and got tired of stopping every time I need to cut the box open. So I went home and designed Finger Blade and took it to work the next day. It worked better than I had hoped and my coworkers were impressed with it. My supervisor said I should pursue it and get it on the market, because our company would buy them and replace the standard ones. The increase in productivity alone makes it worth it, not only that our company buys boxes of the standard cutters weekly to replace lost or dropped standard cutters.
 
 And Ive had the same one since April of last year, because it goes from your finger to pocket when not in use. So you have savings on replacing lost cutters, and an increase in productivity because you can use both hands to work, unlike the standard cutter where you hold it in one hand and work with the other, or set it down to later look for or put it in your pocket to reach for again and again. This is the merit and value of it.
 
I only have the prototype now and CADs and sell sheet but have had the interest of utility knife manufactures. I had an offer to license it to one of them but turned it down because they wanted 6 months to make design prototypes to test the market and after the 6 months they could have said no for any reason. Also during this 6 month time frame, I has to agree not to contact any other companies. I felt that that was too much time to have it tied up to be able to say no thank you later.. Hind sight is 20/20 they say. Maybe I should have taken the risk.
 
I have a Provisional Patent Application that is due to expire in July of this year. So I need your help to get a Non Provisional application and manufacture them and sell them. I have the connections to make the sales and have the interest of the largest U.S. department store chain.
$5.000 will go for the patent and the other $45.000 will be for manufacturing and storage, packaging, shipping. I have done the research and this figure can get my first run on manufacturing.
 
I come here to you, because in the past Ive been ripped off by Invention submission companies. I cant trust them and think its a shame they can prey on inventors hopes and dreams and continue to stay in business. By helping me you will be helping people get jobs they need.
 
UPDATE:
 
I have an attachment that turns it in to a safety knife, now it can be used at companies like Coca cola and the United States Post Office that don't allow exposed blades.
 
Thank you
John Young
story_txt:
Hello, I'm John Young a 47 yr old inventor, married with 2 children. I have a totally new way to open boxes and cutting.
Finger Blade is the hands free way to work uninterrupted. Finger Blade straps to your index finger and has a support guard against paper, card board cuts. It has a self retracting blade for safety. It speeds up the process of cutting by allowing both hands to be free at all times. No more stopping to reach, look, or pick up a dropped cutter. And best of all, no one can walk off with it.
 
I work at a department store stocking shelves and got tired of stopping every time I need to cut the box open. So I went home and designed Finger Blade and took it to work the next day. It worked better than I had hoped and my coworkers were impressed with it. My supervisor said I should pursue it and get it on the market, because our company would buy them and replace the standard ones. The increase in productivity alone makes it worth it, not only that our company buys boxes of the standard cutters weekly to replace lost or dropped standard cutters.
 
 And Ive had the same one since April of last year, because it goes from your finger to pocket when not in use. So you have savings on replacing lost cutters, and an increase in productivity because you can use both hands to work, unlike the standard cutter where you hold it in one hand and work with the other, or set it down to later look for or put it in your pocket to reach for again and again. This is the merit and value of it.
 
I only have the prototype now and CADs and sell sheet but have had the interest of utility knife manufactures. I had an offer to license it to one of them but turned it down because they wanted 6 months to make design prototypes to test the market and after the 6 months they could have said no for any reason. Also during this 6 month time frame, I has to agree not to contact any other companies. I felt that that was too much time to have it tied up to be able to say no thank you later.. Hind sight is 20/20 they say. Maybe I should have taken the risk.
 
I have a Provisional Patent Application that is due to expire in July of this year. So I need your help to get a Non Provisional application and manufacture them and sell them. I have the connections to make the sales and have the interest of the largest U.S. department store chain.
$5.000 will go for the patent and the other $45.000 will be for manufacturing and storage, packaging, shipping. I have done the research and this figure can get my first run on manufacturing.
 
I come here to you, because in the past Ive been ripped off by Invention submission companies. I cant trust them and think its a shame they can prey on inventors hopes and dreams and continue to stay in business. By helping me you will be helping people get jobs they need.
 
UPDATE:
 
I have an attachment that turns it in to a safety knife, now it can be used at companies like Coca cola and the United States Post Office that don't allow exposed blades.
 
Thank you
John Young

story:
The Mumpreneurs Networking Club

At The Mumpreneurs Networking Club we believe you should NEVER underestimate the power of a good gossip!

"A good gossip" is our URL, our campaign logo, hashtag and philosophy:spreading good news about great local businesses!

Update Thursday 14th November: 

Big Kiss and Virtual Hug to our 137 investors.

We now only have a few hours to go - we finish at  midnight tonight.

This is us when we started the campaign!! very chirpy and full of beans!!

 

and this is us after 45 days of crowd funding!!

    this is Nicky (yes she still wearing pink her pink jacket)

and this is Sara ( you cant see them but she is still wearing her pink DM's)  

Its seems the crowd funding madness has taken its toll on them both. MNC HQ has had a ball and is super super proud of the money we have raised and the investment we can make back into the business and as always we aim to create for our members as many business opportunities as possible.  

By the end of this year we will have had over 10,000 visits to our events and meetings, we have proved without a doubt that business networking works and is a crucial part of business growth.

We can now have fun planning what next??

PS if you see these ladies on the school run today can you please give them a random hug and feed them cake.

WE HAVE LOTS OF LAST DAY SPECIAL OFFERS - so take a cheeky peek

CLOSING DATE FOR ALL EVENT BOOKING Thursday 14th September - midnight

We are on a mission and loving it!

WHO WE ARE

We are The Mumpreneurs Networking Club, we run business networking events for mums in business and those that want to do business with mums in business across the South East (dads and non parents are all welcome). We have been connecting mumpreneurs across the since 2009:

 We have 17 groups across Sussex, Surrey, Hampshire, London, Essex and Kent, we average between 350 and 400 visitors a month to all our groups and by the end of 2013 we will have had a whooping 10,000 visitors to all our meetings and events (we have an official Stats Monitor and she knows her stuff). We have 2 Directors, a head office team of 7 and 17 Managers. Each Manager buys a licence to operate their group under The Mumpreneurs Networking Club brand. Members pay an annual membership fee and can attend as many meetings as they want.

·  Meetings are held at parent-friendly times: many of our members simply cannot attend breakfast or evening networking meetings and appreciate the ability to be taken seriously as a business owner AND take their children to school.

·  Joining The Mumpreneurs Networking Club helps our members grown their confidence and their networks, learn from each other and grow their businesses significantly.And have fun in the process.

·  We run events which have included a Ladies Lunch at Coutts Bank, 2 Business Mumpreneur Conferences, a large celebration for International Women's day with Oxfam (raising money on the process), and a very unique networking event at the Edinburgh Fringe. We are in partnership with Johnston Press, to bring you the Women of the Year Awards  and we are involved with lots of local events with Chamber of Commerce, local mayors and newspaper editors in the South East.

·  Our "good gossip" has resulted in regular media coverage for our members and managers:regional and national glossy magazines, including Vogue,You,Grazia and Red; newspaper coverage from local paper columns to The Guardian; numerous radio appearances,and even national television with appearances on The Vanessa Show, The Politics Show and BBC South East. Topped of most recently with 1 finalist, 1 highly commended and 2 winners at a Business Awards Ceremony on friday 27th September.

See what our members say about us: 

It's not just the fabulous business contacts I've made at MNC, I have made some wonderful friends too! Being a member of MNC has been second-to-none!' Jo Lecuyer - Kiddie Coupons Limited

'I have found more business through the MNC club in 6 months than with any other networking group I've belonged to.' Charlotte Briggs - Frog Hollow Catering

'Being a member of MNC has brought me new clients, new friends, business support, ideas and inspiration. Word of mouth and recommendation within the group works quickly and effectively.' Helen Reynolds - Style Step

WHY GETTING INVOLVED WITH THIS CAMPAIGN IS GOOD FOR YOUR BUSINESS 

Individual Investors: 

If you are not already a member, joining us will open doors for your business, expand your network of contact and clients and plug you in to the vibrant community of knowledgeable, supportive and motivated business owners - Have a look at our PERKS, you dont have to be a member to get involved.

If you are already a member, or joining is not right for you, take at look at our exciting PERKS listed on the right. Each one is designed to support your business either through our website, our social media channels or our groups and events. There is something for everyone, whatever your business needs or budget.

As well as benefitting from fun and innovative perks and boosting your business, investing in The Mumpreneurs Networking Club also give you the FEELGOOD factor! You will be helping women to run their own businesses and boost the economy at the same time. More groups means more exposure for your business too.

Corporate investors: 

Recent statistics show that the UK has over 300,000 mumpreneur owed business and they contribute on average 7.4 billion pounds to the UK economy every year.

'Mumpreneurs play a major role in the creation of jobs and boost the U.K economy. Business mums start up their own business so that at the same time they can spend quality bringing up their children and manage the daily childcare logistics.'  Maria Balta Lecturer in Strategy & Work Placement, Director at Brunel University 

' A great strength of the Mumpreneur identity is that it challenges assumptions about who should be an entrepreneur, its one of fastest growing business sectors in the UK' Carol Ekinsmyth University Lecturer in Geography and Entrepreneurship at  University of Portsmouth 

Associating your brand with this ambitious movement of business women not only ticks your corporate social responsibility box, but it is a fun and feel good way to add a bit of fizz to your company's image. Have a look at the PERKS and choose how you would like you message to be exposed to our growing and enthusiastic marketplace, boosting your business at the same time as helping ours.

Any queries with the perks call MNC HQ - 01273 681484

WHAT ARE WE SPENDING THE MONEY ON:

We’re using this crowdfunding campaign to help us GO NATIONAL! We’re looking for investment to expand our network of on-the-ground managers, reach a wider audience of mumpreneurs by improving our online presence and beefing up our back office so that we can handle the growth.

By investing in The Mumpreneurs Networking Club, by buying one of the our PERKS, you will be helping us to reach our goal for £50,000. We want to use this money in the follow ways:

HOW CAN YOU GET INVOLVED?

You may not be able to invest right now but there are lots of other ways you can help us. Spread the word for us: Scroll down to the bottom of this page and share details of our campaign on the Indiegogo sharing tools – you’ll recognise the icons…. they’re the usual suspects Facebook, Pintrest, Twitter, You Tube.

Download The Mumpreneurs Phone App – search on your app store for MNC/Mumpreneurs or scan the QR codes below

Help us to get the #agoodgossip campaign trending on Twitter!

Change your Facebook cover photo to the one below – you can download this from our website. The Facebook cover photos have been designed for business and personal  pages. 

Share our ‘I'm a supporter Badge’ below - you can download the badge from our website: 

Join our photo streaming online event and post up your business photos and tell us about your business - download the Spontly phone app, register, search MNC Crowd funding Campaign then  bookmark the event, check into the event and then get posting your photos. We want to see what the UK’s Mumpreneur community is up to!!

Tell your family and friends, your colleagues, your Facebook buddies, your long lost uncle once removed, the old lady across the road, the milkman, we don’t mind who you share our campaign with. We are on a mission and we don't hang about, we have 45 days to reach our goal!

At The Mumpreneurs Networking Club we believe you should NEVER underestimate the power of a good gossip!  So if you have a megaphone now is the time to use it.

All that remains to be said is: 

A BIG Thank you from Nicky and Sara

Our members send a virtual hug!

Our talented Managers say "See you all at a Networking Meeting very soon!"

MEET THE TEAM BEHIND THE CROWDFUNDING CAMPAIGN

We never do things by halves, so we have put together an expert dedicated team to help us reach our crowdfunding goal! We called in all our managers as well as techies, web designers, movie makers, photographers, business consultants, SEO whizzes and bloggers all from within our membership.

We are using new technology from Spontly with their live photostreaming service and and teaming up with MAD HQ who have helped us develop our MNC phone app and Brighton and Hove Chamber of Commerce who gave us our super snazzy scratch screen weblinks.

Here is our extremely talented Crowdfunding team!

story:
What is Envy?

Envy is an independent adult toy boutique specializing in safe, affordable and organic products. We will host events like workshops, seminars, lectures and socials, to serve the needs and desires of our diverse clientele. Our educational and social programming will promote a safe and welcoming space for women, men, trans and LGBTQ communities. Our store will be designed to encourage exploration of our product lines, socializing, and inquiry. Our hope is that, when you think of pleasure and sexual health in Chicago, Envy comes to mind first.

We plan to open our doors on the northwest side of Chicago in autumn of 2013.

Envy will feature traditional Chicago design elements like original wood floors, high ceilings, large windows, and vintage crown molding. While the standard adult bookstores are dark, dingy, and filled with merchandise in difficult-to-open plastic packs, Envy will feature bright colors, quirky decor, and floor models shoppers can see and handle before buying.

[store inspiration! what do you think?!]

So what is there to Envy?

Since my introduction to the adult toy industry, I've been passionate about providing high-quality products made from safe materials at affordable prices. Envy will ensure that customers are educated about the use, construction, and maintenance of items they are purchasing. 

Sounds simple enough, right? You might be surprised to hear that the government does not regulate the adult toy industry on healthfulness, safety and accountability. At Envy, we will provide you with a tailored, high quality and healthy selection of merchandise with just as many options, but without the damaging effects. 

At Envy, only products that are safe for the body will be sold. I refuse to sell my customers anything that I would not use myself. Adult toys should be all about adding more passion, excitement and fun to your sex life - not infections, disease or carcinogens! This project is not only about opening one singular store in Chicago, it's about allowing a space for education and awareness to people everywhere about something that's really important - our health and our bodies.

What is my goal?

To open Envy in 2013 and to spread my passion of providing sexual health and pleasure education to everyone who will listen. With this campaign, I will finance an education series, inventory to match Envy's passion, new technology and inviting design for the store.

Your support will help accomplish:

  • EDUCATIONAL EVENTS - The store will welcome speakers and educators from a variety of backgrounds, to educate clients on topics ranging from enhancing foreplay to queer sex and tantra. Envy will be a resource for our community on sexual health and sexual pleasure education.
  • INVENTORY - Safe, affordable and organic products. We will finance a collection of pure products - toys that are made out of pure materials like glass, silicone, stone, wood and others. Additionally, Envy will carry the luxury, high end toys and vibes that come with warranties and safety guarantees, but also well-constructed toys at a lower-price point made of safe materials. Those who cannot afford toys that cost hundreds of dollars should not have to sacrifice safety and health! YAY!
  • TECHNOLOGY - Everyone around the world should be able to benefit from Envy's passion for safe, affordable and organic adult toys. A bomb website and online store, the ability to take credit cards, and updated technology for the store will help make everything run smoothly and will help us spread our passion to as many people as possible.
  • DESIGN & ATMOSPHERE - Bright colors, bold design elements, big windows and an inviting library full of books on sexual health are all a part of our anticipated atmosphere; in addition to all of the amazing sexy merchandise!

Who am I?

My name is Crystal and I am here to change the adult toy industry! I have been managing retail stores for over four years in addition to master-level, magic customer service skills. I have always been a hard-worker-- from my first job at McDonald's to my post-collegiate entrepreneurial goals-- not only because I take pride in the work that I do, but because it was necessary growing up. 

Few adult stores are owned by women-- especially young women! I am excited to bring a fresh perspective to the industry and aim to be a sexual health and pleasure advocate for, and ally to, women, men, the trans community and the LGBTQ community. 

Want to talk more about Envy, the adult industry, or sexual health? Feel free to contact me on Facebook or by email and we can chat!

Risks and Challenges

My biggest challenges (other than the obvious - financing) are social misconceptions about sexuality. Our society is not known for being the most open-minded, accepting or straightforward about sexual pleasure and health. Given my background in retail, adult toys and small business ownership, I am adept at explaining my vision and putting people at ease with the concept behind Envy.

As I finish my college education, many of my peers discuss plans to go into professional programs like medical or law schools. While Envy might not be performing life-saving surgeries or winning battles in a courtroom, it will change the world by promoting sexual health, encouraging self-discovery, facilitating community building and igniting passion!

story:
Our Story: 

Community Warehouse, a nonprofit furniture bank in Portland, Oregon, has a simple mission: To help low-income people improve the quality of their lives by providing them with donated basic household furnishings. Our impact is grand.  In 2012, we helped 6,362 people create a home.  The need continues to grow and we stand ready to help.  Our greatest need is for a second large truck to pick up the donated furniture and deliver it to those in need.  We have one truck right now that is overloaded with requests.  We have found a second truck that meets our needs perfectly.  The challenge is to raise the $30,000 needed to purchase the truck.  Once purchased, we can help another 15 families a week. 

What we can do:

With this truck, we will be able to deliver furniture and household items to our client families, increase our donation collection capacity, and divert over 460 tons of useable goods from the landfills. Delivery service ensures that our clients do not have to coordinate their own transportation, a task that sometimes takes weeks or never happens, preventing these families and individuals from creating stable homes. This truck will increase our capacity to serve vulnerable populations including the elderly, those with disabilities, formerly homeless, victims of domestic violence and increasingly, the working poor.   

Why we do what we do:

"This afternoon I got to deliver a load of furniture & household goodies from your Eastside warehouse to a formerly homeless family I work with who just moved into their own place. Their four year old, who was dressed up like a fairy, 'helped' us carry her new bed up three flights of stairs and immediately collapsed onto it laughing when we set it up in her bedroom. On rainy days like this I am so grateful for the awesome work that the Community Warehouse does. I know of at least one cute kiddo who will sleep much better tonight thanks to all of you!" --Case Manager, 2012.

Sometimes having a bed or pillow or kitchen table, can make all the difference for our struggling neighbors. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

You can hold your own fundraising campaign, host a collection drive at your business, church, or school, volunteer, schedule a pick-up, shop in our stores or online, and simply spread the word! The possibilities are endless. Visit www.communitywarehouse.org for more information.

story:
Join us in introducing the most efficient way of finding the best hotel value

at a price you are willing to pay - "Your Choice @ Your Price"!


Your contributions will help us

(a)  Beta launch Travelsurf.com in USA & Canada, &

(b)  Introduce our mobile app. for travelers to negotiate best hotel deals right from their cell phones.

Note: 2% of your contributions will be used to help fund girls education & women empowerment initiatives.

ABOUT TRAVELSURF

Travelsurf has developed a pioneering, value-driven, opaque online hotel booking model called YC@YP (YOUR CHOICE @ YOUR PRICE). YC@YP is specifically designed for hotels to sell their surplus rooms and for traveler's to find best value for their money.

On Travelsurf.com, the "negotiable" price of the hotel room is hidden. Hotels list their surplus rooms, showcase their property and services while exposing only the best published rates. Travelers can book at the hotel's best published rate, or choose to negotiate a non-refundable lower rate from the hotel's surplus rooms.

They do this by creating a short list of hotels (after reviewing hotel details and understanding its value) and proceed to make dissimilar, binding offers for each of the hotel room on their short list. They also indicate their choice preference incase multiple hotels accept their offers. In case all offers are too low, travelers are provided a second chance to increase them. If the offers are still too low after the second attempt then each hotel on the list automatically
offer with its best dynamically customized package price - customized to the traveler's needs. Travelers may book any of the hotel's counter offers if they choose to do so. Travelsurf's ISP (Intelligent Support Program) uses self correcting internal algorithms to track and match the traveler's needs.

The entire process is conducted online and is fully automated without any wait times or delays. Since hotels provide highly discounted rates, all negotiated bookings are non-refundable, non-cancellable and non-changeable. Traveler's credit card is only charged if the negotiations result in a successful booking.

The model ensures the traveler has the opportunity to research hotels, compare them with other similar and not so similar hotels, and access the benefits of each one before placing the offers, while the hotel is able to sell its surplus, unsold rooms without disturbing the pricing structures on other channels. Travelers may short list different star rated hotels and negotiate with each one of the hotel simultaneously.
The model keeps the hotel and traveler in control of the negotiations all through the process and delivers a pleasant shopping experience.

THE FACTS

Hotel rooms are perishable, in that, if not rented the revenue for that day is lost forever. Most hotels, on most days, are left with vacant rooms they'd prefer to rent out at special discounted prices rather than leave them vacant. With the help of sophisticated demand forecasting tools, hotels know weeks in advance the number of empty rooms they expect.

Until Travelsurf.com, hotels did not have an efficient online distribution channel where they could sell-off these surplus unsold rooms to the public directly without adversely affecting their mainstream business. Hence in the past, these highly discounted, 'clearance' inventories were only available to whole sellers.

High distribution costs play a key role in inflating hotel rates. As a result of numerous intermediaries (middle agents) involved in the booking process with each taking a cut of the booking, a reservation could end up costing a hotel as much as 40%+ of the total booking.

Travelsurf addresses these problems by first, bypassing all middle agents in the distribution chain and bringing down the hotel's distribution cost dramatically; second, by providing a fair, even platform for travelers and hotels to negotiate the best price for the surplus inventories.

Last year almost 700 million hotel rooms were left unsold in US alone. In order to sell some of these unsold rooms, hotels need to offer high discounts to generate additional demand. The existing models do not lend themselves well to discounted selling in public, hence users face difficulty finding the best value for their money. Having to visit numerous portals and websites, and their search further made difficult by false promises of best rates and rate guarantees by resellers.

Travelers are expected to give up transparency (knowledge of which hotel they'll be staying at prior to booking) in order to get lower rates.

CURRENT DISTRIBUTION MODELS

At present there are primarily two types of online distribution models...

In the first type, you are able to see the hotel details along with the published prices, and can book a room at the displayed price. (Eg. Expedia, Orbitz, hotel's website, others).

Since rates are exposed to public, this model is not suited for selling hotel's excess rooms at high discounts as it would impact demand and pricing of its salable rooms.

A variation to this model is the 'Flash Sales' model that enables hotels sell their surplus rooms by offering high discounts on the last day. (eg. HotelTonight, others). For the travelers this model provides very limited choice of hotels on the last day and no guarantee they'll even find one. The model is only sustainable in a depressed economy.

The second type, allows travelers to book rooms based on its star rating at a lower price. Travelers do not know which hotel they'll be staying at, and find out after they have made a non-refundable, non-cancellable booking.

In the second model price is used as the primary differentiating criteria among hotels and all hotels within a classification are treated as generic commodities that have no other unique differentiating features. Therefore it falsely assumes that the best "deal" for the traveler is always the cheapest one.

An absolutely flawed assumption!

The fact is that hotel rooms are not commodities and do not compete on price alone. They compete on many fronts including quality of service, brands, service standards, easy access, location, convenience, security and the overall experience delivered.

The model erroneously assumes a fair classification can be accomplished by segregating hotels by classification done by governmental and other authorities (such as star rating). This is a misguided assumption since the existence of certain amenities or the hotel falling under a certain classification does not make two hotels similar.

Example: A traveler may wish to stay at a particular hotel because of the proximity to a particular address. In this case staying at a hotel within a block from this address would be more preferable than at a particular star category hotel. So the subjective "value" to the traveler for a hotel at a distance, even if it's a better star rated hotel may be lower in this particular instance. That does not mean the traveler is not willing to stay at the other hotel but rather he may not be willing to offer the same price he'd be willing to pay for the one closer.

Location of hotel, service reliability, security issues, service standards, brand loyalty cannot be defined by blindly picking a hotel classification and placing a single offer for these "not so similar" hotel rooms. It could result in the traveler ending up with a totally different hotel than what the traveler bargained for.

PERK DETAILS

SUPPORTER $5
Support Travelsurf's new, unique way of booking hotel rooms. Pledge $ 5 and stay in the loop with our updates as we introduce Travelsurf in North America & beyond.
✔ Your name listed on our Travelsurf's donor page.
Delivery date   N/A
ENTHUSIAST $25
Your enthusiasm is infectious! We are counting on your support and encouragement. Stay with us, and enjoy Travelsurf & more!

✔ Your name listed on our Travelsurf's donor page
Delivery date   December 2013

So you always thought you had the creative juices in you! Well, here's your chance to prove it! Design our limited edition, 'give away' Travelsurf T-shirt. We'll put your design up against all other entries on Travelsurf's Facebook page and choose the best one from the Top 3 'likes'. We'll even put your name & signature on your T-shirt design.

Become our project team member & participate in the development of the 1st & only, global patent pending, app. for negotiating best hotel deals. We will send you our pre-release app., Test drive it and give us feedback on improvements. Let's together build the world's best hotel booking app.
✔ You receive 9 [nine] $25 hotel discount vouchers
✔ 1 [one] special 100% cotton superior quality Travelsurf 'Founding Member' Black T-shirt

✔ Chance to enter Travelsurf's "T-shirt Design Contest"
✔ 6 [six] additional 'Designer' T-shirts if your design is chosen in our T-shirt Design Contest
✔ Your name listed on our Travelsurf's donor page
Delivery date   December 2013
TRAVEL CONNOISSEUR $175
Enjoy travelling? Helping travelers make right choices? Plus, earning some extra perks while you are at it? Then this is the right choice for you. We are dedicated to improving the value-for-money for our travellers!, and, what's better than getting 1st hand information on local restaurants, 'hang out' places, 'must see' attractions, from 'the locals'! We are presently developing the ideal travel blogging module to do this. Unfortunately, it is in the stealth phase so we cannot spill the beans until it's beta release late November. As our Travel Connoisseur we will set up your own special blogging board on Travelsurf.com. You may post your travel experiences, perhaps be the restaurant food critic, write about tourism attractions, review hotels, events, etc. We will reward you with special restaurant vouchers, discount coupons, & gift certificates from time to time, for your efforts and contributions.
✔ You receive 12 [twelve] $25 hotel discount vouchers

Be the Founding Member of Travelsurf and enjoy exclusive benefits! Receive Travelsurf's VIP Card that gives life-time 5% discount on every hotel booking made through Travelsurf.com, anywhere in the world (Note: 5% discount is over our best rate guaranteed assurance), plus special promotions exclusively offered from time-to-time for VIP Travelsurfers.

Become the owner of your own niche market hotel booking B2C or B2B portal! we build your 'white label' turnkey booking site. With the Travelsurf negotiating model, you set up your hotels (max. 250 hotels) or simply pick from our hotels on Travelsurf.com, decide on the booking fee % to charge hotels and start promoting your site. We function as the backend provider for your website, host it, maintain it, keep it updated, and even pay for the Internet bandwidth. Best of all, you only pay 5% transaction fee to Travelsurf and a basic annual maintenance fee of $2 per hotel per month. In fact, to get you started, we will waive the 1st year annual maintenance fee. Pay only 10% ($250) of the introductory one-time license and set up fee of $2,500, and the balance after we ‘launch’ your site. Find out more...

Delivery date   December 2013

Sample Travelsurf Discount Voucher


TRAVELSURF ‘DESIGNER’ T-shirt CONTEST

So you always thought you were the creative one in your group... Well, here's your chance to prove it!

Design the layout for our 'limited edition' Travelsurf 'Designer' T-shirt. We'll put your design up against all other entries on Travelsurf facebook page and choose the best one from the top 3 that score the highest 'likes'. We'll even put your designed by: name / signature on it if selected.

It's simple! You pick the color, write the caption, design the graphics and email the attachment of your design to contest@travelsurf.com before 12:00 pm (PST), October 31st 2013. We will upload the 1st set of valid entries on Facebook on October 16th 2013, and continue uploading new entries as they arrive until closing date. We will pick one design from the top 3 designs that score the highest number of ‘likes’ by November 5th 2013.

We will get the T-shirt printed, with your name and/or signature on it, and ship it to all the donors who have contributed $50 or more to this Travelsurf campaign.

As our special thank you, we will send you additional 6 (six) of your ‘Designer’ T-shirts.

General Rules: This contest is Void where prohibited by law. Decision of Travelsurf is final in all contest related matters. To the extent allowed by applicable law, submission of your entry for the contest constitutes your permission for Travelsurf to use your name, any statements made by you regarding this contest, and address (city, state, country only) for advertising and/or publicity purposes worldwide and in all forms of media now known or hereafter developed, in perpetuity, without further compensation except where prohibited by law. Contest entry limited to donors of $50 or higher to Travelsurf's indiegogo campaign

FOUNDING MEMBER T-shirt - 100% COTTON

TRAVELSURF IN THE NEWS

HOW DO WE INTEND TO USE THE PROCEEDS FROM YOUR CONTRIBUTION

Travelsurf is targeting to raise $ 100,000.

18% of the funds will be utilized to complete Travelsurf’s mobile apps, integration and development of social media apps, interfaces to hotel ‘third party’ systems (such as Property Management Systems, Channel Management Systems, etc.) using Open Travel Alliance specifications. (These modules are planned to be completed and released over the course on next 90 days).

80% of the funds raised will be used for marketing and sales - for recruitment of hotels to the Travelsurf Network and toward launching Travelsurf beta version in USA & Canada.

2% of the funds raised will be donated on your behalf to a charitable organization:

GIRLS EDUCATION & WOMEN EMPOWERMENT DONATION

WE HAVE A SITUATION…

Young girls are being pulled out of schools every day in India, not because they lack money for the fees, but because many schools do not provide for girls washrooms…

2% of your funds will be donated for building girls washrooms in schools in Andhra Pradesh, India. You will receive a personal thank you letter from the principal of the school(s).

ABOUT TRAVELSURF

We are a young Indo-US company with our research & development center in India. We have developed a suite of innovative, useful distribution models and systems for the hotel industry and are planning to expand into other segments of the travel market in the future.

We are a dedicated group of hard working, enthusiastic professionals that truly believe in what we have developed. We believe it would not only help the travelers but also help the Travel industry globally. We have beta launched the service in India and are receiving a positive feedback from Travelers and hotels there. We are bringing this new way of booking hotel rooms to North America.

We have signed up around 3,000 hotels through our relationship with a hotel consolidator in United States, Canada, and Europe. We are in the process of signing hotels directly and signing other hotel consolidators so we may bring better prices on surplus inventories and more negotiating power to you. We intend to offer hotel booking function for hotels in U.S. and Canada in December 2013.

We are the 1st and only company globally to introduce a unique negotiating model for sellers to sell-off their excess and distressed inventories and for travelers to find the best value for their money. We have filed for patents on this method of distribution for all perishable and non-perishable products in numerous countries around the world.

Travelsurf as a responsible global corporate citizen is committed to the education of girls in developing countries and the empowerment of women around the world. We plan to support this cause not only during this campaign but also as we grow and introduce Travelsurf across the globe.

www.travelsurf.com
www.travelsurf.com/campaign/entrepreneur.html

ABOUT THE FOUNDER

Jim Burney inventor and founder of Travelsurf has over 35 years of experience in the Lodging and related industries. During this period he has operated and managed hotels in US and Canada, worked as an Independent Hotel Consultant, and as the Senior Hospitality Director for a multi-national computer company servicing the hotel industry.

Jim is a serial entrepreneur (a sucker for punishment!) and has operated his own hotel technology companies since 1985 (too stubborn to retire!). He’s been involved in the design and development of a number of innovative technologies for the travel industry, and has a number of “firsts” to his credit.

He was the first in the industry to introduce in 1986 a Unix based hotel management system running on micro-computers. During the second half of 1980s he drove the sales efforts for his PMS product to become the single most widely used PMS in Western Canada with a user base in 5 countries.

Jim’s previous company Inter-Soft Systems Ltd. was the first to incorporate yield management technologies directly into the hotel management system in 1989/90. In 1994 Jim focused his company’s attention toward online distribution and Internet. In 1995/96 Inter-Soft introduced the first OTA portal for the lodging industry, with comparison shopping and seamless connectivity with its PMS system. Jim has been active in the research, design and development of a number of other technologies including a voice recognition technology based restaurant management system, Internet travel auction system, online travel distribution malls, and most recently the next generation Internet distribution network for Travelsurf.

Jim’s complete profile is available at http://www.linkedin.com/pub/jim-burney/7/36b/7a5

TRAVELSURF ‘DESIGNER’ T-shirt CONTEST
So you always thought you were the creative one in your group... Well, here's your chance to prove it!
Design the layout for our 'limited edition' Travelsurf 'Designer' T-shirt. We'll put your design up against all other entries on Travelsurf facebook page and choose the best one from the top 3 that score the highest 'likes'. We'll even put your designed by: name / signature on it if selected.


It's simple! You pick the color, write the caption, design the graphics and email the attachment of your design to contest@travelsurf.com before 12:00 pm (PST), October 31st 2013. We will upload the 1st set of valid entries on Facebook on October 16th 2013, and continue uploading new entries as they arrive until closing date. We will pick one design from the top 3 designs that score the highest number of ‘likes’ by November 5th 2013.






    We will get the T-shirt printed, with your name and/or signature on it, and ship it to all the donors who have contributed $50 or more to this Travelsurf campaign.
    As our special thank you, we will send you additional 6 (six) of your ‘Designer’ T-shirts.
General Rules: This contest is Void where prohibited by law. Decision of Travelsurf is final in all contest related matters. To the extent allowed by applicable law, submission of your entry for the contest constitutes your permission for Travelsurf to use your name, any statements made by you regarding this contest, and address (city, state, country only) for advertising and/or publicity purposes worldwide and in all forms of media now known or hereafter developed, in perpetuity, without further compensation except where prohibited by law. Contest entry limited to donors of $50 or higher to Travelsurf's indiegogo campaign


FOUNDING MEMBER T-shirt - 100% COTTON



TRAVELSURF IN THE NEWS























HOW DO WE INTEND TO USE THE PROCEEDS FROM YOUR CONTRIBUTION
Travelsurf is targeting to raise $ 100,000. 
18% of the funds will be utilized to complete Travelsurf’s mobile apps, integration and development of social media apps, interfaces to hotel ‘third party’ systems (such as Property Management Systems, Channel Management Systems, etc.) using Open Travel Alliance specifications. (These modules are planned to be completed and released over the course on next 90 days).
80% of the funds raised will be used for marketing and sales - for recruitment of hotels to the Travelsurf Network and toward launching Travelsurf beta version in USA & Canada.
2% of the funds raised will be donated on your behalf to a charitable organization:
GIRLS EDUCATION & WOMEN EMPOWERMENT DONATION



WE HAVE A SITUATION…
Young girls are being pulled out of schools every day in India, not because they lack money for the fees, but because many schools do not provide for girls washrooms…
2% of your funds will be donated for building girls washrooms in schools in Andhra Pradesh, India. You will receive a personal thank you letter from the principal of the school(s).








ABOUT TRAVELSURF
We are a young Indo-US company with our research & development center in India. We have developed a suite of innovative, useful distribution models and systems for the hotel industry and are planning to expand into other segments of the travel market in the future. 
We are a dedicated group of hard working, enthusiastic professionals that truly believe in what we have developed. We believe it would not only help the travelers but also help the Travel industry globally. We have beta launched the service in India and are receiving a positive feedback from Travelers and hotels there. We are bringing this new way of booking hotel rooms to North America.
We have signed up around 3,000 hotels through our relationship with a hotel consolidator in United States, Canada, and Europe. We are in the process of signing hotels directly and signing other hotel consolidators so we may bring better prices on surplus inventories and more negotiating power to you. We intend to offer hotel booking function for hotels in U.S. and Canada in December 2013. 
We are the 1st and only company globally to introduce a unique negotiating model for sellers to sell-off their excess and distressed inventories and for travelers to find the best value for their money. We have filed for patents on this method of distribution for all perishable and non-perishable products in numerous countries around the world.
Travelsurf as a responsible global corporate citizen is committed to the education of girls in developing countries and the empowerment of women around the world. We plan to support this cause not only during this campaign but also as we grow and introduce Travelsurf across the globe.
www.travelsurf.comwww.travelsurf.com/campaign/entrepreneur.html

ABOUT THE FOUNDER
Jim Burney inventor and founder of Travelsurf has over 35 years of experience in the Lodging and related industries. During this period he has operated and managed hotels in US and Canada, worked as an Independent Hotel Consultant, and as the Senior Hospitality Director for a multi-national computer company servicing the hotel industry. 
Jim is a serial entrepreneur (a sucker for punishment!) and has operated his own hotel technology companies since 1985 (too stubborn to retire!). He’s been involved in the design and development of a number of innovative technologies for the travel industry, and has a number of “firsts” to his credit. 
He was the first in the industry to introduce in 1986 a Unix based hotel management system running on micro-computers. During the second half of 1980s he drove the sales efforts for his PMS product to become the single most widely used PMS in Western Canada with a user base in 5 countries.
Jim’s previous company Inter-Soft Systems Ltd. was the first to incorporate yield management technologies directly into the hotel management system in 1989/90. In 1994 Jim focused his company’s attention toward online distribution and Internet. In 1995/96 Inter-Soft introduced the first OTA portal for the lodging industry, with comparison shopping and seamless connectivity with its PMS system.  Jim has been active in the research, design and development of a number of other technologies including a voice recognition technology based restaurant management system, Internet travel auction system, online travel distribution malls, and most recently the next generation Internet distribution network for Travelsurf.
Jim’s complete profile is available at http://www.linkedin.com/pub/jim-burney/7/36b/7a5

story:
I own a shop located in Quakertown, PA we sell Celtic-Mideval-Gothic decor, jewelry, collectibles, swords, anime items and more.

I have many great people that come in. Sometimes to buy and sometimes to just chat. Over the past four years I've come to know a good deal of them quite well. With the economy the way it is some of them or their friends/family are out of work.  I would like to be able to occasionally give them hours to work either at my shop or at other markets/events where we can rent space.

Reaching our goal will allow us to prepay the fees for new events,cover the expenses and invest in new inventory.

In these times of great competition and rising costs we believe that all small businesses must continue to evolve in order to meet these challenges and help the communities where they are located. With your aid we can make this happen.

Those of you that know us from our shop or road shows can attest that we try our best to help our friends as best as we can and are always looking for new ways to help a covention grow or get more exposure for the market where our shop is located.

I know that not everyone will be able to contribute but I ask that you please pass along this link to your friends and family and let them know that the idea of small business is still alive.

All contributors will be placed on the "Wall of Heroes" both on our website and in our shop.

Please take a look at the pictures of our shop.

I thank you in advance for all of your help.

Just an fyi... if our goal is reached you may still contribute. Any add'l funds will continue to further our goals.

 

Please visit our website at www.GRIFFONSCLAW.com

story:
Pues ya quedan cosa de días para que venga la nueva adquisición de la familia Maceiras Yeh!!!!

Estábamos ahorita un poco a mil por hora, preparando los últimos detalles, haciendo compritas para que todo esté listo para la llegada de Ananda y me dije "coño, de repente mi familia quiere hacerle algún regalito al peke y no tiene cómo hacerlo porque estamos lejos".


No hay problema!!! Acabamos de crear esta campaña de financiación colectiva para que, si queréis y podéis, sea más fácil que comprar un billete de Ryanair por internet. Sólo necesitáis 2 minutillos de vuestro tiempo, vuestra tarjeta de crédito a mano y la voluntad de hacerle un regalo al nuevo de la familia.
Por cierto, Ananda simboliza la alegría o felicidad para el Budismo... y eso es lo que queremos compartir con todos y todas...


Nuestra alegría!

story:
Why support MMC and IAVI?

The world needs an AIDS vaccine.

  • Hi, I'm Devchelle2 and 5 years ago I was diagnosed as HIV positive. Instead of crawling into a corner somewhere to die, I wanted to fight back and hopefully help others at the same time. I decided to support research, and the organization I chose is IAVI.
  • International AIDS Vaccine Initiative, or IAVI, operates in 24 countries, and is the largest global non-profit focused solely on the development of an AIDS vaccine as part of a comprehensive response to the AIDS epidemic.
  • Together, we can help stop HIV / AIDS and save lives.


Can we really make a difference?

You better believe it!!

Never underestimate the power of a small group of people to change the world; in truth, it's the only thing that ever has.

  • We all know someone who has HIV or has been touched by this virus. It effects us all one way or another.
  • The money raised by MMC for IAVI supports research that directly impacts the lives of people who need help.

Can't donate?

Some people just can’t donate, and that's fine, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Share this link on social media, spread the word, mirror the videos promoting the event, GET INVOLVED!!

Be part of something bigger than all of us. Be part of changing and saving lives...most likely people you will never meet. Hoping for change is nice; being a part of change is better.

LIVE AUCTION!

Join Youtube's SassiBob and SarahCroce Sunday, March 30th at 3 pm EDT for the chance to bid on an hour-long one-on-two Skype chat!  They're only offering just ONE, so don't miss out on your chance to chat with Youtube's cutest couple!

story:
This project is a sample demonstration of how the wage system can go.

A room 15ft by 20ft has been provided by the hospital ad ministration of Kabale Regional Referral hospital to its workers of salary scale U6- U8 to use for commercial/income generating activities for their (workers) own good. as well as the good of all other workers in Uganda who advocate for the abolition of the wage system. The proceeds will be used as follows: some used to sustain the project and help other workers elsewhere learn from it, for support during strikes and other forms of industrial actions,taking legal actions against bosses/employers who don’t pay and or dehumanize workers as well as contributing to strikes and other forms of industrial actions by our fellow affiliate workers internationally.

It is to serve as canteen for the hospital workers, patients, patients’ attendants, people living in the neighbourhood of the hospital and others as well. So it is a good catchments of clientele.

It will be serving foods and drinks as well as some goods in line with the customers-to-be. In short it is to operate as work managed co-operative. It will also serve as sub center for organizing workers as well as channel of distributing working class educational materials.

Members of the working class are encouraged apart from contributing and sharing the campaign to give us feed back through our email below, social media, and or comment page of the campaign.

What we have.

Charcoal.

Food stuffs:

2 sacks of Irish(Kabale) potatoes

1 sack of beans

10 bunches of bananas

1 sack of sweet potatoes

Man power (working in shifts)

What we need.

DRINKS

10 crates of soda

5 boxes of packed water

1 box of packed juices

1 box of packed milk

Total ……………….. 318,000 (USD 127)

HOUSE HOLD CONSUMABLES

2 boxes of washing soap

2 boxes of powder soap

1 carton of bathing soap

1 sack (100kg) of sugar

1 sack of posho

1 sack(100kg) of rice

1 sack (100kg) G.nuts

1 Carton of tea leaves

1 Carton of coffee sackets

1 box of matchboxes

1 carton of candles

1 carton of toilet paper rolls

10 dozens of exercise books

2 boxes of pencils

2 boxes of ball point pens

Vaseline oil

Total ………………..1,396,000 (USD  559)

FURNITURE:

Table

8 plastic chairs

Cash board

Total…………………….560,000 (USD  224)

UTENSILS

4 saucepans

2 dozens

2 dozens forks

2 dozens of cups

2 dozens of spoons

1 dozen of knives

4 Thermos flasks

4 sugar bowls

2 charcoal stoves

2 serving spoons

2 Jerry cans

1 frying pan

1 frying spoon

1 Bucket

2 Mincers (carbbage cutter)

2 dozen of glasses

Juice (blender)

4 strainers

Total……………………..726,000 (USD 290)

Gross total   3,000,0000/= (USD 1200)

story:
UnaPenda, a non-profit organization based in Toronto, Canada.  It was founded in 2014 but it’s been a dream since a very meaningful trip to Kenya. 

We met in Kenya while on an internship.  We became fast friends once we realized we both have a heart to help others… to save the world.  But one person (or two, or three, or four in this case) can only do so much.  So, we ask for your help.

We saw a need, a dire need during our stay in Ngong Hills, Kenya.  We want to help the kids that don’t have mothers, the kids whose mothers are too sick or bed ridden by HIV to be the moms they need.  There are kids begging for food, there are kids sniffing glue because it gives them a false sense of a full belly, there are kids that are sick and starving, there are kids that go from being well-fed in boarding school to having nothing back at home on school breaks.  We want to give these kids a safe place to go: away from drugs, abuse, prostitution, hunger, the weather, and anything else they may face in their daily lives. 

We are building a boarding house to answer to this need. We already have the title to the land from the hard work of Work of Heart (see Facebook page of this fantastic girl!) together with the students of Fanshawe College's Non-Profit Organization course. This land has the potential to be fully sustainable, growing healthy crops to nurture them, but also to be able to sell in order for the house to thrive on its own once built.

RIght now, we just need to raise enough money for the material and workmanship! A project that we have hired local carpenters and tradesmen to complete; they are on their toes waiting to start! 

The vision of the boarding house is one that again, is sustainable in every aspect from growing of their own food, having a small business selling their crops, sustainable energy solutions developed by local partners, to education & training on health and being independent!  

To help in other ways, please contact us at amyfaria@gmail.com or checkout our Facebook page (UnaPenda)! Website coming soon! 

This boarding house is working together with Living Positive Kenya, the charitable organization that we volunteered at in Kenya that empower women living HIV positive. Please checkout their website at  http://livingpositivekenya.org/ for more information on them and their programs!
story_txt:
UnaPenda, a non-profit organization based in Toronto, Canada.  It was founded in 2014 but it’s been a dream since a
very meaningful trip to Kenya.  
We met in Kenya while on an internship.  We became fast friends once we realized we
both have a heart to help others… to save the world.  But one person (or two, or three, or four in this case) can only
do so much.  So, we ask for your help.

story:
Omni Incorporated:

We are a new company originating in south-western Ontario. What we're trying to achieve is a website that helps the user-me and you-get the results they're looking for quickly and efficiently, without the hassle of scrolling through redundant pages of links and irrelevant information. Our mission is to get you on and off the internet in as little time as possible so you can get on with your day with the knowledge and insight you were looking for.

A good example of this is:
You want to buy a vehicle. You search through different dealerships online and off, and you think you're ready to make a decision. Before you do, you search online for what people say about the vehicle you have in mind. When you search on Google, you get hundreds of pages of links to other websites, some totally irrelevant and just happened to "pop up", and spend hours reading what people have to say on multiple websites. Now, imagine you only had to search one site for that information. A site that when you typed in what you wanted, only relevant reviews and comments came up, not multiple links to every website on earth. And, imagine all you did was scroll through the different reviews, all captured off of the sites you already know and trust, with links underneath each particular review. The time it would save is invaluable. 

Some of the features you can expect from our site will include profile pages where real users can rate content they have read with our star rating system, a place where you can enter your own opinions and reviews on products, places, and things you have experienced personally, and be able to connect to people with the same interests and opinions as you have. The more reviews there are on the internet, the more help it will be to the rest of the world. 

Now, before a website like this can take place, it needs to be built. We at Omni Inc. did some research and consulted with web designers and found that the average price for a website of this magnitude was upwards of $10,000 CAD. So now we need help. We need to come together and raise the money for this site so everyone can enjoy the benefits of a remarkable breakthrough like this.

If everyone who read this decided to donate $5 or $10, this project would be well on its way to success.  All it takes is teamwork.

If you don't have the spare money to donate to our campaign, it's alright. Just spread the word for us and help us get our name out there. We want our name out there for the world to know. We're also on Facebook and Twitter.
Please help us to achieve this goal!

story:
Spare Suite:

"We want to expand more rapidly, so we are crowd funding our next unit."

Better than a first class, five star hotel, Spare Suite's luxury apartments are in Boston's best neighborhoods, and are often preferred by travelers. 

Spare Suite, Inc. is a Boston company, founded and managed by a husband and wife team Richard and Victoria, who have the experience and attention to detail required to succeed in this business. 

While continuing to provide the highest level of accommodation, Spare Suite, Inc. is assembling a virtual hotel, one unit at a time. The goal is to first assemble short term apartment inventory to rival Boston's most successful hotels, and then expand the same model to other major cities.

THE MACHINE:                                                                            5 Stars

People can be cruel when they write reviews. The smallest details and shortfalls are revealed and written in stone, within reviews posted at VRBO, TripAdvisor, HomeAway, Airbnb,  or Google. 

Spare Suite guests, however, rate our apartments as five star, at every travel website where we are listed.  

Five Star reviews are achieved by paying extreme attention to detail, so everything exceeds expectations, every time, regardless of how high.

Spare Suite has developed the perfect model. We have supply lines in place, as well as inventory to service the units, linen handling, unit maintenance, and a cleaning routine that involves multiple levels of cleaning and inspection, designed to achieve higher standards than most 5 star hotels.  
EXPANSION:                                                                                          

Spare Suite, Inc. is ready to grow. We want to add 10 more short term, furnished units in 2014, and then work towards a virtual hotel portfolio that rivals Boston's best luxury hotels.

The cost of building a typical non-luxury, 115 room hotel in the US, featuring 325 square foot bedrooms and bathroom combinations, costs about $22 million. That is more than $190,000 per room and it does not include the contents.

Purchasing nice one bedroom condos in Boston's best neighborhoods cost about $500,000 each, also, with no contents.

Spare Suite can put together an entire apartment, with living room, dining room, kitchen, bathroom, and a king size bedroom for about $18,000, and with higher quality contents using our commercial lease of residential property.

Spare Suite could assemble the same size, 110 room virtual hotel, but with 5 star apartments, instead or tiny rooms, for only $2 million, instead of $22 million.

HOW ?:                                                                                                 
               
We lease these luxury apartments from building owners, or corporate owners, on a commercial lease of residential property, at a fixed price. 

Then we fully appoint the apartment, and give it personality and style. We use high end furniture made of leather and wood, and enforce cleanliness standards that exceed those of first class, five star hotels here in Boston. 

Once the "Spare Suite" is ready, we rent it out short term furnished, for 3 days, a week or a month, depending on what our guests want. 

Currently, Spare Suite, Inc. is 17 months old and has 4 units. All 4 units are profitable and were funded with individual loan notes on a 24 month repayment schedule.

Our lease agreements with property owners allow us to re-evaluate the location every year, so if one location or neighborhood becomes undesirable, or the view changes due to construction, Spare Suite can simply pick up the contents, and move to new location. 

Spare Suite's bookings are strong. The company is profitable and ready to grow.

SO WHY CROWD FUND ?:                                                                   

Until Spare Suite's loan notes are paid off, the profits are used almost exclusively to repay the principal and interest due. Without more funding, no new units can materialize.

The availability of additional credit to expand in order to add new, profitable apartments is incremental. As the company's credit improves, expansion will become more rapid. 

We already have loan commitments for 2 more units in 2014, and we have the capacity to add 10 more units in 2014 when we secure the funding .

Using the Spare Suite business model, adding one luxury apartment at a time, we can set up new locations for only $18,000 each, and achieve higher standards than any hotel in town, yet maintain the same or better levels of profitability. 

Crowd funding a unit will give Spare Suite the edge to expand more rapidly by immediately providing revenue that will fuel growth, rather than being used for repayment of another loan note.          

 

Fund a New Unit & One New Job Follows 

With your contribution, and the addition of this new apartment, you also help to facilitate the creation of a new full time job in Massachusetts.      


This is a new economy.  The Spare Suite model will become the preferred way to stay when visiting the city.  

When you decide to provide funding for this unit, with your own hard earned dollars, you become one of our building blocks, laying the foundation for a strong company, with a bright future.

What We Need & What Perks You Can Get

  • Very simply, we need $18,000 to put apartment #5 in play.
     
    This covers everything from locating the unit, to purchasing the contents,
    moving in, insuring everything, testing it, and getting it listed to start booking.

    • If we EXCEED the goal, all additional funds will go to funding additional units.

    • If for some reason, we FALL SHORT of our funding goal, the funds that were raised will still go to fund the new unit, however, a much higher percentage goes to Indiegogo if we don't reach that goal. 

    • All perks will be honored regardless of how much we raise.

  • We are offering great perks like:

    • Stay as our guest in the newest apartment that you help to fund
        - or use your stay to host your own friends or family
    • Help to name the new unit
    • Have dinner with founders and hosts Richard and Victoria
    • Get a Terry Cloth Bath Robe and Slippers
    • Get a Spare Suite Pen

      and
    • Get recognition in the unit guide book, read by all of our guests
      - Blurb and mention or
      - Full page recognition for you, your company or organization / cause
      - High quality back link at Spare Suite website

      and
    • Get extreme gratitude from Richard & Victoria for your support!


The Impact

Funding this next unit with crowd dollars, and not loan dollars, will give Spare Suite the immediate edge to accelerate at a much higher rate.  

You will be giving us a 2 year boost into the future on our newest location, and you will help to support one of many new, full time jobs that Spare Suite will be able to offer.

Most of us know that by just paying off a little extra principal on your mortgage, you can shave years off of the payment schedule. Similarly, setting up this one crowd funded apartment, free from a 2-year loan payment, will clear the way for rapid forward progress in 2014, including:

-Adding a full time employee
-Adding a second vehicle
-Adding as many new units and locations as possible 
     -we have loan commitments for 2 new units for 2014 already
     -we hope to crowd fund 1 unit with your help

This is an opportunity to grow a great Boston business that will hire local people and pay good wages, with good benefits.

Dedication:


 
Spare Suite, Inc. founders, Richard & Victoria shown here
at Shakespeare in the Park, on the Boston Common 2013.

Husband and wife team, Richard and Victoria are working 7 days a week to ensure the success and long term growth of Spare Suite, Inc.  Individually successful and experienced in property management, maintenance and hospitality, they are convinced that this is what they were meant to do.

The founders are taking no pay, and no dividends, for the first two years in order to ensure the long term success of Spare Suite, Inc.


Experience:

  • Richard and Victoria restored three Victorian, multi-family homes in Boston together, and transformed each apartment into unique and highly desired living spaces.

  • Personally boast 10 years of total tenant satisfaction. 

  • Spare Suite already shows 17 straight months of 5 star reviews, in all locations.

    Spare Suite locations - Back Bay, Fenway, South End, West End
     
      - Carlyle Boston - 1 Bedroom Penthouse on Comm. Ave. Mall 
      - West End One Bed - 1 Bedroom with Balcony on 12th Floor Great Views
      - Canal Street One Bed - 1 Bedroom + Roof Deck Amazing City Views
      - Studio 3 - Studio Furnished Apartment in the South End
     

Other Ways You Can Help 

Maybe you can’t contribute money. That doesn't mean you can’t help! 

- Are you an artist, or do you know an artist? We want coordinated artwork.
- Are you a landlord or building owner in Boston looking to sign a lease?
- Are you a lender interested in up to 7% interest on 18,000 over 24 months?

  • Contact us about donating coordinated artwork for recognition
    - If we approve, exclusively provide the artwork for one entire apartment

    - Get credit for the artwork, and for your donation of the artwork, and 

    - We'll give you a full page, front and back in the unit guide with your Bio
         information about each piece, and contact information as well as 

    - Recognition and a feature at the property website with a back link to 
         the artist's website.

  • Rent to us, or find us a great location

    - If you are in Back Bay, Beacon Hill, the West End, Downtown, Fenway
       or on the Green Line (B) in Allston, and you have a place that could be
       considered a luxury apartment - contact us and we'll have a look.

         - Units should be one bedroom, wood floors, high ceilings, fireplace preferred, 
             and have one or more spectacular elements, like view, historic value,
             roof deck, balcony, parking, amazing lobby, etc.  

          - Commercial lease to sublease must be permitted.
  • Loan money to Spare Suite, Inc. and make 7% on your money.

    - Have money to lend? Spare Suite, Inc. will pay 7% on an $18,000 note
       over 24 months. 

    - Individuals, banks, credit unions, and private lenders, we want to borrow money
       to put at least 10 more units online in 2014.      DUNS: 07-881-6471

story:
Summary

There has been a recent rise in farmer suicides in Maharahstra state of India due to crop failures. One of the reasons for crop failures is inadequate irrigation facilities. Save Indian farmers is working with our partner NGO, called Deendayal Trust, to restore a reservoir and canal in Pathari village of Yavatmal district of Maharashtra, India in the next few months. Around 256 families in this village will benefit from this project as they rely heavily on rain or reservoir water for agriculture and daily use. The farmers form this village will act as labor for this project.

What is the issue, problem or challenge?

In Maharashtra, the cotton farmers have been driven towards committing suicides due to factors like droughts, lack of water conservation, increased cost of crop cultivation, rising pesticide and seed costs and monsoon dependent crop yields, all of which results in increased debts for the farmer. Since farmers rely on the yield as their only source of income, they are unable to sustain their livelihood and feed their families and take drastic steps like ending their lives and sometime their families’ lives as well.

They leave behind widows and young children who face huge challenges in earning a livelihood. There is not much help from the government for these families either. Kelapur region where Pathari village is, has seen 243 farmer suicides since 2002.

How will this project solve the problem?

The canal as well as reservoir is in desperate need of removing silt. Repairing the reservoir and canal will allow it to collect rain water and transfer it to the fields for irrigation.

  • Farmers in Pathari village will be able to cultivate a second crop like soybean or vegetables besides cotton.
  • 170+ acres of agricultural land will get much needed water supply to grow crops which they can sell to earn money and also feed the family.
  • It will increase the water table of the reservoir by about 25%. This region only gets 575 mm. average rainfall per monsoon season, which is not enough to sustain for agricultural needs throughout the year. The reservoir will help with water conservation, so that it lasts throughout the year for agriculture as well as livestock needs.

Potential Long term impact

The reservoir will help improve the quality of life of Pathari farmers. They will be able to utilize their agricultural land more efficiently for cultivation throughout the year and would have lower risk than from single crop cultivation. Families of farmers who have committed suicide will be able to utilize the reservoir water for setting up small businesses like goat grazing, selling dairy and farm-fresh vegetables and other small businesses they can start in their home.

Funding Information

Total Funding Received to Date: $2,000

Remaining Goal to be Funded: $20,000

Total Funding Goal: $22,000

Additional Information and Details

More information about this project can be found at http://www.saveindianfarmers.com/web/pathari-reservoir-project/

The farmers form this village will act as labor for this project.
What is the issue, problem or challenge?In Maharashtra, the cotton farmers have been driven towards committing suicides due to factors like droughts, lack of water conservation, increased cost of crop cultivation, rising pesticide and seed costs and monsoon dependent crop yields, all of which results in increased debts for the farmer. Since farmers rely on the yield as their only source of income, they are unable to sustain their livelihood and feed their families and take drastic steps like ending their lives and sometime their families’ lives as well.They leave behind widows and young children who face huge challenges in earning a livelihood. There is not much help from the government for these families either. Kelapur region where Pathari village is, has seen 243 farmer suicides since 2002.
How will this project solve the problem?The canal as well as reservoir is in desperate need of removing silt. Repairing the reservoir and canal will allow it to collect rain water and transfer it to the fields for irrigation.
Farmers in Pathari village will be able to cultivate a second crop like soybean or vegetables besides cotton.

170+ acres of agricultural land will get much needed water supply to grow crops which they can sell to earn money and also feed the family.
It will increase the water table of the reservoir by about 25%. This region only gets 575 mm. average rainfall per monsoon season, which is not enough to sustain for agricultural needs throughout the year. The reservoir will help with water conservation, so that it lasts throughout the year for agriculture as well as livestock needs.

Potential Long term impactThe reservoir will help improve the quality of life of Pathari farmers. They will be able to utilize their agricultural land more efficiently for cultivation throughout the year and would have lower risk than from single crop cultivation. Families of farmers who have committed suicide will be able to utilize the reservoir water for setting up small businesses like goat grazing, selling dairy and farm-fresh vegetables and other small businesses they can start in their home.
Funding InformationTotal Funding Received to Date: $2,000
Remaining Goal to be Funded: $20,000Total Funding Goal: $22,000Additional Information and DetailsMore information about this project can be found at http://www.saveindianfarmers.com/web/pathari-reservoir-project/

story:
Update: We have made our initial goal, thank you to all of our amazing supporters! If we make $2,500 we will be able to get the equipment to make chocolate in house!

Short Summary

The vision of CafeZAZZO is to offer people the opportunity to spend time in a comfortable location drinking a tasty coffee-based beverage or eating a delicious ice cream.

CafeZAZZO will be the first and only coffee shop of its kind in La Unión, with the hope of giving people excellent service, beverages prepared to order, and a friendly and comfortable atmosphere to pass an afternoon or evening. We will also serve many different flavors of homemade ice cream, using fresh milk from cattle that are pasture-raised right here in La Unión. In addition to the espressos, coffee, and ice cream, we will prepare our own caramel sauce, jams and jellies, extracts, and other ingredients so that we can serve you anything from caramel lattes to chocolate-coffee smoothies to waffle cones topped with homemade sauces.



What I Need & What You Get

To this point, I have invested $4,000 into purchasing equipment and beginning construction; however, I need $1,500 more to finish construction of the service bar, install lighting and electricity, and finish repairing the walls of the building.


If I am able to raise over $1,500, I will use the extra money for additional equipment that will be greatly needed in the shop but that I have not yet been able to purchase. This includes increasing the capacity of my ice cream machine and coffee roaster, as well as installing additional seating.

Currently, I have everything set to be able to make chocolate in CafeZAZZO except for the equipment. If I am able to raise $2,500, I will purchase the equipment to make homemade chocolate from cacao beans harvested here in La Unión.

In return for your support of CafeZAZZO, I am offering a variety of delicious and educational rewards. The details are on the right, but there are two main categories: free treats from the shop and classes to learn how to make coffee or ice cream.


What I Have Done So Far

While in the process of opening CafeZAZZO, I have spent the past year making and selling ice cream. The ice cream has been a big hit here, with many people interested in trying and buying the different types and flavors. Since the ice cream is made with fresh milk and cream, it is of the highest quality. The earnings from ice cream sales have helped me to purchase the machinery for the coffee shop.


Over the past months, I have also purchased all of the machinery necessary for the shop. This includes an espresso machine and grinder, coffee brewing equipment, a coffee roaster, an ice cream maker, a waffle cone maker, and an ice cream freezer. Additionally, I have started repairs and construction on the shop itself.

And finally, I have taken advantage of the time before the shop opens to invent many recipes that I will use in the shop. To this point, I have perfected recipes for:

  • Espresso
  • Cappucinos and lattes
  • Coffee made in a Chemex brewer
  • Ice cream (chocolate, coffee, mint, Reeses, vanilla, blackberry, strawberry, and many more flavors)
  • Ice cream made from homemade soy milk
  • Waffle cones
  • Chocolate covered ice cream bars
  • Fruit smoothies
  • Caramel and chocolate sauce
  • Jams and jellies made from seasonal fruits
  • Natural extracts, such as vanilla and mint

The Impact

La Unión is a small town with big coffee production, since most people here grow coffee for a living. But most people harvest and sell their coffee to be enjoyed in other parts of the world, leaving few opportunities to enjoy a well-prepared coffee. For this reason, I had the idea to create a coffee shop where both people from La Unión and from other parts of the world have the opportunity to enjoy fresh roasted coffee, prepared in house and harvested right here in La Union.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't support CafeZAZZO financially, you can still help! Every mention on Facebook, email to a friend, or conversation that spreads the word will bring me closer to my goal.

Thank you in advance, and I can’t wait to see you walk through the front doors of CafeZAZZO!

-Grisel Lainez

(Translated from Spanish by Patrick Hughes)
