Wharton Date Auction 

As you all know by now, I am participating in the Wharton Date Auction.  If you support me, you are not only helping WIVP (Wharton International Volunteer Program), but you also have the chance to win some awesome prizes!  And you would be in my good graces FO-EV-ER.  I really appreciate it!

Look to the sidebar for the breakdowns and join us on November 21st at Pub so we can embarrass ourselves in front of you.  :)

story:
I am a passionate home made soap maker on my quest to get my small home business off its feet and to renaissance festivals NATIONWIDE!

Nothing is more medieval than a Seawitch Selling Soap!!!

This project to turn my small business into a huge success by traveling all across the country and selling my one of a kind soaps!

Everyone loves soap, but I'll bet you've never seen soap as unique as mine! They're unique in every way and they are good for you too! They are long lasting, smell fantastic, and nothing like you've ever seen!

The Main Goal:

To get my big start, selling my products at the renaissance fairs all across the country!!!

How it all started!

I found my passion for making bath products when I suffered from eczema and asthma. The cost for medicines to treat my symptoms would cost me several hundred a month to purchase, so I looked into natural remedies.

INTRO-the essential oils!

After some research, I started adding tea tree, eucalyptus, and lavender essential oils to my shampoos, conditioners, and lotions. In just a few weeks, my conditions improved to almost nonexistent, and I didn't need my medicines anymore.

This led to me to wonder...what ELSE can I add that is good for me?

Lemongrass, Lavender, Tea Tree, Peppermint....these oils (and MANY others) have become a heavy part of my life. Now I have come to make, my own Artisan soaps, lotions, sugar scrubs, bath bombs, sea salt soaks, perfumes and bubble bath. 

And believe me...they smell as amazing as they look!


Now, I think I've done a pretty good job so far. I've made the product (in my kitchen), designed the labels, got all my packaging, took photos, got the website...now I need the place to sell.

Given their appearance, I was going for a rustic, apothecary look for the packaging. So that, plus my nerdyness...what better place to sell than a renaissance festival?!!!

It's PERFECT! I've got a product that I'm passionate about, with vintage labeling, cool names (Dragon's Blood soap? C'mon, who WOULDN'T want a bar?), and I'm in central Florida...home of entertainment, actors, and tourism. 

I'm a pretty resourceful gal. I saved up every dime I had and went out and bought a 10x10 tent. Then I hand sewed curtains and drapes to it. Grabbed every free table, table cloth, and decoration in my house and off to the fair I went. I took on the persona as 'Calypso the Sea Witch' and sold my products!

My first dry run with a fair was a huge hit!!! I wish to continue this success and keep my small business growing!

My sales were 500% profit from what I payed for the vendor rent!!!!!!!!!!

I know I have something the people love and want! Not to mention, It looks and smells absolutely wonderful!!!

So why do I need money now?

With the newly obtained money, I went out and bought business insurance, patented and copyrighted my product and recipes, had professionally made labels and packaging printed, and the rest went to supplies. Fairs have to be applied for almost a year in advance. This secures you a spot for vending. If I can start traveling now, I can get a head start for 2015 and not to mention, continue to travel to festivals for the remainder of this year. The money donated now will go toward a traveling vehicle and camper (both used) so that I can take my business on the road. 


The vehicle I have now is a 2002 Volkswagon Jetta. It was alright for the first faire, tho It was jam packed all the way to the roof and passengers seat to get to the faire. Now that my business is expanding, that little car just wont do.

My ULTIMATE Goal!

The fairs only come to Florida a few times a year. In order for me to be successful, I have to go to fairs happening around the country. I could be attending one every month as long as I had a means for travel. I've FOUND my passion! I've FOUND what I want to do! I'm the geeky, Calypso, and I wanna sell my beautiful, handmade soaps and products at renaissance fairs everywhere!

And so, I humbly ask for your help in raising the amount of $20,000.

The funds go toward:

- A used truck to haul my crates of supplies nationwide

- A small (very small) used camper in order to continuously make product while I travel on the road. A sanitary place to store product. Also a place to stay during the festivals.

- Essential oils

100% Lavender, lemongrass, patchouli, peppermint, eucalyptus, jasmine, hibiscus, rose, etc...anything that smells good and is good for you!

- Fragrance oils

For those of you who prefer other smells not found in nature and also those of you who do not have fragrance allergies, such as pumpkin, fresh linen, strawberry, bubble gum, seaberry, etc...

-Natural colorants

Blue, red, yellow, white, black...? All of these colors are made with all natural colorants such as annatto seed, turmeric, charcoal, alkanet root, green clay...and many others!

- Vendor fair rental and displays

Fairs come in many shapes and sizes and last from a single weekend, to a month long. Even the prices to rent the space can be from $180 to $2000 a fair! Surprising, eh? 

- Insurance

With every business comes business insurance. The remaining funds will go toward future monthly payments for my soap insurance...and just between us, I'd like to add candles to my insurance sometime in the future as well.

- Gas and Travel

-Tent

My tent will do for now, but its starting to show signs of wear and tear, something I'm doing my best to repair. I'd like to invest on a solid, and sturdy vendors tent to protect my products from weather while the weeks of the fairs are going on. Tents from a company called Panther Primatives can start at $1000 for a 10x10...which is pretty much all I will need anyways. They are made of thick water resistant canvas, and can withstand harsh weather.   

IN RETURN-

You will receive beautifully individually packaged, beautiful hand-made products sent directly to you, FREE of any postal charges! Also my eternal gratitude! Donations of $1000 or more will receive a handmade token from me that, if presented, you will get discounts on your purchase.

ONE LAST THING!

Look me up at the latest fair! Come visit me! I'd love to hug you and thank you in person!


FAQ

Have a question? I welcome any of you to contact me with ANY questions! I love talking to people, and even more, I love talking to people about my soap!

Risks and challenges 

Risks being that with making soap, there's always the risk of being burned. Soap making can be dangerous but understand that I have protective safety goggles, gloves, and face masks to keep me safe. Plus I'm a big girl, a little burn wont bother me.

story:
Hi everyone!

My name is Remus Gavrila and I live in Italy.

I need your contribution to rebuild an antique and gorgeous vineyard. We have 10ha(24ac) of barbaresco grapes that will produce 60-70.000 bottles of Barolo, Barbaresco, Barbera and Arnais DOC-DOCG wine. I have the production site, the enologist, the buyers for the final product and everything else to start it, I need your contribution to cover all the costs.

The great thing about this project is that we will restart using an antique vineyard placed in a pittoresque location, we can decide the label on the wine, visit and bring friends in a wonderful gourmet trip to Italy to see our italian wine production. 

I'm really excited about this, please be part of it! 

We need 100.000 Euros, about $130.000 to start the production. The ROI will be in two years and the profit will be equally shared with all the participants based on the amount invested where law allow us to, or donated in charity where most of the donors wants to be donated. With that profit we can make a difference for many people in need, for many young artists. Please be with me in this great project, a small contribution will have a big effect!

This is a wonderful opportunity not only for the profit, but for the chance to continue an old tradition getting closer to our origins, to our history.  

Thank you all for your interest in this project and please feel free to contact me anytime for further informations.

Remus

story:
What is Subi

Subi is essentially a social space for discovering new experiences by trading in old ones. Unlike any loyalty app, Subi connects you with people like yourself who enjoy indulging in their favorite things-to-do, but at the same time appreciate the notion that variety is the spice of life and are open to trying new things.

Easy as Counting From 1 to 10

Subi does away with the vague point-building system that you find in many loyalty programs where 50,000 points doesn't really mean a lot when you equate the amount to the value of the redeemable reward. Subi is here to enforce radical transparency. 

In this Subi community, every user is entitled to an exclusive reward when the user purchases a service or item within the app after the 10th time.

What makes Subi’s offering unique is based on the number 10. There will be a variety of deals to choose from offered by a selected list of local and online merchants. Our featured Merchants offer specials ranging from: percentage discounts, 2-for-1s or free items in order to bring in new customers like you and also to maintain their relationships with current customers. Here's the sample list of cool things-to-do on Subi

CITY TOURS


RESTAURANTS 


NIGHTCLUBS AND BARS

VACATION GETAWAYS



FITNESS


Still wondering How Subi works? Take a look at this scenario

HOW EXACTLY DOES IT WORK? HERE'S AN EXAMPLE;

WEEK #1

Step 1: Get Tickets to a Concert

Step 2: Book a Car Service to Concert

Step 3: Get Dinner at a fancy Restaurant 

WEEK #4

Step 4: Book a vacation getaway to the Bahamas

WEEK #7

Step 5: Get Tickets to a Museum

WEEK #8

Step 6: Get Lunch at a Diner 

Step 7: Sign up for a Gym Membership

WEEK #10

Step 8: Book a 3 Night Stay at a Resort 

Step 9: Book Car Service from Airport to Resort

Step 10: Get Meals for You + Family 


NOW PICK YOUR REWARDS

Example 1: Book a vacation getaway on Subi for 3 nights at Half-off (50% discount).

Example 2: Get dinner at one of our restaurants and receive 2 complimentary drinks (Free item).

Example 3: Get 2 tickets forprice of 1 for an event (Buy 1 Get 1 Free).

EASILY TRACK YOUR PROGRESS

There’s a built-in meter which keeps a track of your progress from 1 - 10 represented on a scale of 0 - 100% in increments of 10% (See pic below).You’ll be on fire -- figuratively speaking -- in no time and your meter lights up in flames indicating you've reach your 10th goal.

CONCERTS AND SHOWS

Start seeing rewards from doing everyday things you do fast. Redeem your prize and the meter resets to 0%. Start again “clearly” knowing you’ve got ONLY 10 things to do for your next reward. It’s so simple, clear and concise; unlike airline flyer Miles that take years to build 100’s of thousands of points in order to win anything.

SUBI WORKS FOR MERCHANTS 

Subi brings you new customers like "Groupon" with the incentives for current customers on "Foursquare" combined in one fun to use application. Based on popular research, the 2 biggest complaints from Local Merchants like are (1) attracting new customers and (2) retaining current customers. Trust Subi to solve this issue like nothing else before. Develop lasting relationships with your current and future customers in a variety of ways including;

  • Get to know your frequent customers and develop new ones
  • Tracking loyalty points for recent activity.
  • Processing transactions within the app in real-time 
  • Create customizable rewards that benefits both loyal and new visitors. 
  • Reports: number of visits, points earned, rewards redeemed 

Subi caters to a niche market of users who are already in the mindset of building points through loyalty programs. So increase relevant traffic to your venue by backing our project and earn higher placement on our recommendation engine. Register your venue first by choosing one of the merchant-tailored rewards. Your venue will be featured higher on user search results. The amount you pledge today is an early-bird investment that will multiply very fast in measurable revenue.

With a whole slew of valuable rewards, there's something for everyone; check our list of rewards and back us today.


PERKS FOR MOBILE USERS


1. SUPPORT SUBI WITH $10+ 

EARLY BIRD ACCESS: Receive a shout out + an early bird invitation to try out Subi when we launch; use all of Subi's features in its glory.


2. SUPPORT SUBI WITH $25+

COMMUNITY MEMBER: Receive a shout out + early bird access + invitation to join our community-driven feed feedback and support team. Provide feedback and suggestions for making Subi even better; recommend your favorite local business to be featured on our venue listing.


3. SUPPORT SUBI WITH $250

SUBI UBER Level: This level will give you the ability to get rewards twice as fast: in 5 steps. You now receive rewards for every 5th activity + rewards (above) #1 to #3.


4. SUPPORT SUBI WITH $400

SUBI OOWEE Level: This Level gives you the ability to reach rewards after in 3 steps. You now receive a reward for every 3rd completed activity + rewards (above) #1 to #3. 

Example: 1st step -- Book a vacation getaway cruise. 2nd step -- Buy concert tickets. 3rd (Reward) -- Book a 3 night stay at hotel and get 1 extra night Free.


5. SUPPORT SUBI WITH $1,000

SUBI SUPREME Level: This is the ultimate level attainable by a Subi user. You get rewards after completing 1 step + reward (above) #1 to #3 

Example: 1st step -- Book a vacation getaway cruise. 2nd (reward) -- Buy 1 concert ticket and get 2nd ticket Free


PERKS FOR MERCHANTS


1. Pledge $1,150 or more

SPROUT (Merchant) -- 16th to 20th Bracket list. This is an early-bird placement boost for merchants. Get your venue listing placed high in user search results for 3 months (renewable). 

When Subi users conduct a search for a local spot in your city, your venue will be show up within the 16th to 20th bracket on the list. 

For example;

User Searches: "Restaurants in Miami" 

Results: Restaurant (A) #16 

Restaurant (B) #17 

YOUR RESTAURANT (C) #18 

Restaurant (D) #19 

Restaurant (E) #20


2. Pledge $3,500 or more

STARTER (Merchant)-- 11th to 15th Bracket list. This is an early-bird placement boost for merchants. Get your venue listing placed higher in user search results for the 6 months (renewable). 

When Subi users conduct a search for a local spot in your city, your venue will always show up within the 11th to 15th bracket on the list. 

For example; 

User Searches: "Hotels in New York" 

Results: Hotel (A) #11 

YOUR HOTEL (B) #12 

Hotel (C) #13 

Hotel (D) #14 

Hotel (E) #15


3. Pledge $5,000 or More

PREMIUM (Merchant) -- 2nd to 10th Bracket.

This is an early-bird placement boost for merchants. Get your venue listing placed even higher in user search results for 9 months (renewable).

When Subi users conduct a search for a local spot in your city, your venue will always show up within the 2nd to 10th bracket on the list. 

Even Higher placement = Even higher revenue. For example;

User Searches: "Getaways"

Results:  Resort(A)#2

               Resort (B) #3

               Resort (C) #4

               YOUR RESORT (D) #5

               Resort (E) #6

               Resort (F) #7

               Resort (G) #8

               Resort (H) #9

               Resort (I) #10


4. Pledge $10,000 or more

OVERLORD (Merchant) -- 1st Spot

This is an early-bird placement boost for merchants. Get your venue listing placed even higher in user search results for 1 year (renewable).

When Subi users conduct a search for a local spot in your city, your venue will always show up as number #1 on the list. 

User Searches: "Theme Parks in Orlando, Florida"

Results: YOUR THEME PARK #1

Note to Merchants: Pledging any of the amounts above is a huge ROI (Return of investment). Using the Overlord level pledge of $10,000, our projection analysis states that your business would make that amount back within 2 months via revenue generated from payments received by Subi mobile users.



WHY YOU NEED TO SUPPORT SUBI

Subi is bound to revolutionize the way we spend leisure time by giving users the ability to track their activity and redeem rewards from a handful of selected merchants.

Please support us, but only if you fulfill ALL of the following criteria:

A). You're a deal seeker and have used a Groupon (or similar) before. 

B). You enjoy trying new things and sharing your experiences by connecting with others like you.

C).You're a local business owner -- or knows someone -- that is in need of increasing their venue's exposure in order to gain new followers as well as providing incentives for their current customers.

D). You're genuinely looking forward to seeing this project come to life.

If you agree to all things, please help the project succeed by supporting Subi and spreading the word to your friends.

What is SubiSubi is essentially a social space for discovering new experiences by trading in old ones. Unlike any loyalty app, Subi connects you with people like yourself who enjoy indulging in their favorite things-to-do, but at the same time appreciate the notion that variety is the spice of life and are open to trying new things.Easy as Counting From 1 to 10Subi does away with the vague point-building system that you find in many loyalty programs where 50,000 points doesn't really mean a lot when you equate the amount to the value of the redeemable reward. Subi is here to enforce radical transparency. In this Subi community, every user is entitled to an exclusive reward when the user purchases a service or item within the app after the 10th time.What makes Subi’s offering unique is based on the number 10. There will be a variety of deals to choose from offered by a selected list of local and online merchants. Our featured Merchants offer specials ranging from: percentage discounts, 2-for-1s or free items in order to bring in new customers like you and also to maintain their relationships with current customers. Redeem your prize and the meter resets to 0%. Start again “clearly” knowing you’ve got ONLY 10 things to do for your next reward. It’s so simple, clear and concise; unlike airline flyer Miles that take years to build 100’s of thousands of points in order to win anything.SUBI WORKS FOR MERCHANTS Subi brings you new customers like "Groupon" with the incentives for current customers on "Foursquare" combined in one fun to use application. Get to know your frequent customers and develop new ones

Processing transactions within the app in real-time

Reports: number of visits, points earned, rewards redeemed

story:
The Self-Help Hunger Program was started four years ago In North Oakland by Black Panther Aunti Frances Moore with a mission:

  1. To help the folks who were living on the streets,
  2. To provide a safe place to congregate,
  3. To share healthy and nutritious food for our community
  4. To provide a sense that the community cared
We need to honor and care for our community elders!  Driver Plaza is a historic triangular plaza on the border of North Oakland and South Berkeley that once housed a famous North Oakland Night Club known to locals as the "Triangle Club." This spot is now a small public park and plaza, that serves as a rich cultural hotspot for our community elders.

We believe that the positive energy, the drive and the divine inspirtaion we receive that is within us, lead us to pull together as a unified community of Self Help (Each one, Help One). Thus, we endeavor to provide any and all human services that an individual or family may need to, not merely survive, but to thrive.  We don't just feed the homeless, we feed the hungry.  

WE NEED YOUR HELP!

Aunti Frances uses a portion of her SSI check each month to provide hot meals for over 50 people each week rain or shine.  It costs about $2250 each year to keep the program operating, since there are no staff, just community!  We receive no funding from foundations or city agencies, just from you the community.  We use some local and organic ingredients from our friends at Phat Beets Produce!  In addition to the free meals SELF HELP Hunger Program needs help in order to continue providing the following:

  1. Advocacy work for plaza users who are left out of the development of North Oakland in partnership with Berkeley Drop In Center
  2. Free seasonal community lead cultural festivals at Drivers Plaza (Come get down with us on Sept 21st!)
  3. Free legal services for low-income and houseless folks in partnership the East Bay Community Law Center
  4. A free ADA Accessible public restroom
  5. Restorative Justice Community Healing Circles in partnership with the North Oakland Restorative Justice Council to bring new and old residents together to build a more equitable North Oakland

The Plaza users have been under pressure in the last 4 years due to a surge in high-end housing development.  The Plaza is one of a few safe havens for our communtiy elders. 

We want our elders to live a dignified life and so we are working together with all walks of lives to meet the needs of our community. 

All Power to the People,

Aunti Frances and the Self Help Hunger Program

Please share our campaign with your folks over the phone, on the internet, and in the streets!  Come eat with us!  The Self Help Hunger Program is a partner of Creative Energy and Resource Center.

story:
Short Summary

Who I am..

  I built and flew Gyro copters in the 90's. I am using the same construction methods for this project. I am a level 4 Hang glider pilot for 20 years. My present occupation: Professional Military Industrial Contract Painter. I do contract Mil Spec work for local major metal fabricators in the S Florida area, and have experience in all types of fabrications. Also I have been building and designing model aircraft for 31 years.

 I consider myself a minimalist. I believe that anyone should have the ability to get into simple, basic powered flight for the least amount of money, and complexity. I have found hang gliding to be the perfect medium for this concept. 

 I am trying to keep this design as simple as possible so that anyone with reasonable mechanical skills could construct one for a minimal cost from scratch from the plans that will be developed, but also have the option to purchase a simple "kit" of the airframe adaptable to most hang gliders if there is a demand. 

  The "Concept" video above proves that the concept of this "minimal" flying machine is valid. My design will be improved, very light, fold able, and stow able into a small space for storage, or transport to your local field.

  You can view the progress of my design on my blog. http://minimalflight.blogspot.com/

 

What We Need & What You Get

 The funds raised will go towards the purchase of a motor, and a propeller for the final design/construction phase, as I have already invested most of the funds in the construction of the first portion of the project.

 The funds also will be used to pay for the finalized design to be rendered by an engineer into a CAD program for the working plans, along with a structural design analysis to determine any weak spots, and possible improvements that could be made.

  Also, along with the structural analysis I will get a quote for a unit price to be produced from one of my metal fabricators for production. If there is a demand. 

 

The Impact

 It must be stated that any form of hang gliding is an incredible mind freeing experience. Once a person gets past the training, and equipment expense along with the fear of operating in a different enviornment, it can be incredibly rewarding!

  You can make any form of hang gliding, like most adventure sports, as safe or dangerous as you want. The biggest key to safety I have found in my 20 years of hang gliding, is knowing what your limitations are.

  Ways you can make hang gliding safe are to receive instruction from a certified professional and use safe equipment -- professional schools will create as controlled a learning environment as possible.

 Hang gliding is an outdoor sport and the sky is unpredictable -- weather is always a big consideration. The primary safety factors are personal judgment and attitude.

  You must be willing to learn gradually and use good judgment and have an appropriate attitude. If you don’t, then you can get injured or killed; if you do, then you can enjoy this sport until you’re 90

 If all of this is taken into consideration you will be successful in your dream to see the world safely from a perspective that most people will never experience.

 
 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, but want to help:

  Post this campaign to your Blog, or aviation forum to get the word out and make some noise about this project.

Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Grace Community Food Pantry began as an outreach of Grace Tabernacle Ministries International, Inc a non denominational church. It quickly became evident that the need, resourses, and suppport exceeded what could be accomplished simply as an outreach ministry of the church.

Today Grace Community Food Pantry is a not-for-profit organization as desingated under IRS Section 501 C-3. Grace Community Food Pantry is governed and administered by a Board of Directors which includes the Flagler County School Superintendent, The Presidennt of Flagler County Chamber of Commerce and other local businessmen and community leaders. By expanding out orientation as a community-wide organization, we have been able to attract and coordinate the participation and support of key individuals aand organizations in the area with a heart and passion for helping the deititute and unemployed.

 

The numbers of those in need has been growing to we are now serving over 8,000 residennts of Flagler County. This has required us to inctease our donor base. 

Our goal is to help lift people up. To give them a strong footing while they are going through the tough times. 100% of the donatioons made go stickly for the intended use to purchase food. All Food Panrty workers are volunteers. 

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to financial support we can use the following:

Volunteers, can goods, walk in freezer,walk in cooler, golf cart, office supplies and a folk lift.

For more information see our web site www.gcfp.org.

story:
Why I need your help:

I'm going to teach a free, weekly yoga program for parents of special needs kids at an early intervention centre in Melbourne. It's the same centre I first attended with my son (who has autism).

Many of these parents are frazzled. They're:

  • anxious as to what the future holds
  • struggling to cope with meeting their kids needs("Am I doing enough? Will my kid be worse off because I cant afford the thousands of dollars  needed for optimum therapy?")  
  • dealing with their children's behaviour issues (self-regulating meltdowns and tantrums, some of which can be self harmful)
  • and a lot of them are doing it on little money and less sleep (insomnia, for example, is common in kids with autism. Sometimes my seven year old wakes at 2am and doesnt sleep until the next night.).

Imagine trying to parent when your head is constantly bombarded with worry and you're exhausted. Can you imagine how easy it is to 'lose the plot' when your son and daughter is repetitively demanding something and you've been in a state of anxiety for hours? (or, in my case, years!) How can you be in the driving seat when you're too frazzled to drive?

This yoga program is about giving parents some 'me' time and sharing yoga tools to calm the mind, get grounded and oriented and parent, calmly and wisely, from our centre. It's based on the work of David Emerson and Dr Elizabeth Hooper (Overcoming trauma through yoga) and the wonderfule Hala Khouri.

In short, the premise of the program lies in the  the old airline adage: We're putting the oxygen mask on the parents first so they can better care for their kids.

What We Need 

The good news is that we already have yoga mats thanks to the LovEarth pre-loved mat redistribution program.
Now we need to acquire:

  • Yoga blankets (an essential tool in making some asanas /postures safer and more comfortable)
  • Yoga blocks (again, this is for safety and comfort).
  • If at all possible, a few bolsters (but we can live without them if we get ther blankets and blocks).

The program I have planned includes a lot of 'restorative' yoga, so these supporting props are pretty essential. 

The Impact

A little contribution can mean a lot to these carers and the children they look after. As UNICEF's Early Childhood Development(ECD) guidelines point out, "ECD depends on the capacity, support and opportunities for families and the caregivers of children to adequately care and nurture their children."

In helping us help carers to look after themselves, you will be ultimately raising the odds of their children's future. The aim is to use the yoga support program to reach hundreds of parents in the Melbourne area. Eventually I'd like to expand this program - I'm researching and planning a future yoga program for these incredible special needs kids themselves.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share the campaign on Facebook.
  • Donate any spare yoga props you may have!!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

 (P.S. Many thanks to GC Interactive Welnness, for the photo, provided through Flickr.)

Can you imagine how easy it is to 'lose the plot' when your son and daughter is repetitively demanding something and you've been in a state of anxiety for hours? (or, in my case, years!) How can you be in the driving seat when you're too frazzled to drive?
This yoga program is about giving parents some 'me' time and sharing yoga tools to calm the mind, get grounded and oriented and parent, calmly and wisely, from our centre. It's based on the work of David Emerson and Dr Elizabeth Hooper (Overcoming trauma through yoga) and the wonderfule Hala Khouri.
In short, the premise of the program lies in the  the old airline adage: We're putting the oxygen mask on the parents first so they can better care for their kids.


What We Need 
The good news is that we already have yoga mats thanks to the LovEarth pre-loved mat redistribution program. Now we need to acquire:

Yoga blankets (an essential tool in making some asanas /postures safer and more comfortable)
Yoga blocks (again, this is for safety and comfort).
If at all possible, a few bolsters (but we can live without them if we get ther blankets and blocks).

The program I have planned includes a lot of 'restorative' yoga, so these supporting props are pretty essential. 


The Impact
A little contribution can mean a lot to these carers and the children they look after. As UNICEF's Early Childhood Development(ECD) guidelines point out, "ECD depends on the capacity, support and opportunities for families and the caregivers of children to adequately care and nurture their children."
In helping us help carers to look after themselves, you will be ultimately raising the odds of their children's future. The aim is to use the yoga support program to reach hundreds of parents in the Melbourne area. Eventually I'd like to expand this program - I'm researching and planning a future yoga program for these incredible special needs kids themselves.


Other Ways You Can Help

Share the campaign on Facebook.
Donate any spare yoga props you may have!!
Use the Indiegogo share tools!


 (P.S. Many thanks to GC Interactive Welnness, for the photo, provided through Flickr.)

story:
My name is Sophie and I work at the State Library. Since my time at the Library I have met many wonderful people, though there has been one person in particular who has made a rather lasting impression on me.

Max

Max aka Maxy not only sorts and delivers the mail every morning (and afternoon) but always has a moment to stop and brighten up everybody's day. In March 2013 it will mark 40 years since Max first began working at the State Library (starting in 1973).

Max is an extremely lovable character, he is also one of the most selfless and kind hearted people I have ever known. He spends his time when not at the Library raising money for charities, allowing people into his home that have nowhere to stay, making dinner for those less fortunate, visiting nursing homes, driving the incapacitated to appointments, spending time with the disabled and the list goes on and on.

Max's dream has always been to go to Israel and visit family and friends over there. We are looking to raise funds to pay for airfares, transfers, meals and accommodation for approx. 2 weeks to make his wish come true.

If we do not reach the intended target amount the money will still be given to Max to be saved for his retirement.

This would mean the world to Max to know that everyone cared about him and wanted to make his dream come true. I think it is time that he was recognised for his outstanding compassion.

I decided to make this project a reality because Max has spoken to me many, many times about his dream of visiting Israel, what he calls  “the motherland” which is extra special to him as he is an orthodox Jew.  He told me “if god wanted me to go, then he would give me a sign that would allow me to go”. This is the sign.

Warmest wishes

story:
Short Summary

I recently spent some time in Puerto Vallarta and came across this project that is underway for the FIRST ever women's shelter in Banderas Bay.  Domestic abuse is something has touched my life and the lives of many others.  It saddens me that the women in this community have nowhere to turn if they are being abused.  When I got home I could not get this project out of my mind and wanted to do something to help contribute so that this project can be completed.

What We Need

I am trying to raise $1000.00 to donate to help with construction costs. 

The Impact

This shelter will impact the lives of many of the 50-70% of women and children in this community who face domestic and sexual abuse daily.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please help spread the word about this amazing and much needed project. 
 
You can find them on facebook: Banderas Bay Shelter, and learn more about the project at http://www.compassionforthefamily.org/

story:
Short Summary
My name is Mackenzie Kay Marshall-Bartlett and I’m the proud owner of Mackenzie Kay Costuming. Back in September of 2012, with the support of my amazing husband and close friends, I was able to start making my dream a reality.
I started sewing at a young age. As I became more experienced, I truly began to fall in love with the everyday clothing of different time periods. My favorites were Elizabethan and 16th century clothing. As I grow older my appreciation grew for all clothing made before the 20th century and that became my focus. 
In 2012, I was lucky enough to be added to the list of approved costumers for the 33rd annual Great Dickens Christmas Fair in San Francisco. This honor opened my eyes to my true calling in life. I'm ready to branch out and grow my business into something amazing. I want to move my business out of the house and into a space that will allow me to work, to teach and to help the community.
 
What We Need & What You Get
I'm hoping to make $4000 to help to expand Mackenzie Kay Costuming. I've outgrown being a home based business and now need to look for a space that allows me to expand and begin teaching classes, as well as focus on community events by donating my services or reducing prices where possible. It will also allow me to extend my business out to a much more broad audience, not just the Renaissance and other faire communities. The money will also be used for updating and acquiring equipment to support classes, help to secure a proper work space and retrofit it to the needs of the business.
 
The Impact
Your help will allow me to follow a long sought after dream, as well as help my family. After two major knee surgeries and another on the way, it's clear that a "regular" job is not going to work for me. With very long healing time after surgery, a standard job isn’t going to work, making it difficult to help support my family.  
Making Mackenzie Kay Costuming successful will allow me to make a difference in our lives, as well as show my step-daughter that if you really want something and work hard you can make it happen.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
I know that right now times are really tough. I understand that more than anymore. If you can't help out with a financial contribution, PLEASE help get the word out to any and everyone you know. For every fifty or so people that see this, the hope is that one person can help make this possible for me and my family.

story:
Perfect religion that God our Father accepts as pure and faultless is this: to look after widows and orphans in their distress and to keep oneself from being polluted by the world. James 1:27

Dear Friends and Family,

In July I am planning to go to Rwanda, Africa on a missionary trip with True Vineyards Ministries. True Vineyard Ministries helps to meet the fundamental needs of people living in third-world countries that have been affected by HIV or other illnesses. In the 1994 state-sponsored Genocide of the Tutsi and Hutu moderate of Rwanda, more than 1 million men, women, and children were killed in a span of 100 days. During this horrific time, thousands and thousands of women were raped by HIV positive men in an effort to kill off the next generation of the Tutsi population. More than 67% of the surviving women are HIV positive with children who are HIV positive. In 2007, True Vineyard Ministries (TVM) started working in Rwanda. They have now employed 35 of the poorest women in Rwanda, most of who are widows and have children as well as raising children from family members who are no longing living. TVM’s goal is to provide opportunities for these women to become self-sufficient through various programs. The women working for True Vineyard Ministries use the money they earn to care for their families, have medical insurance and send their children to school. They also participate in counseling to help them heal from their traumatic experiences. They are taking part in rebuilding Rwanda!

I am excited to have the opportunity to experience for myself, the hand of God at work, through his people. Ever so humbly, I am writing with the vision of including you in His plan. My need is for financial support and prayer. In order to go to Rwanda this summer, I need to meet a fundraising goal of $5,000.00. I will be spending 2 weeks with True Vineyard Ministries, working side by side with the ladies. This money will pay for airfare, supplies, and all my amenities while working on the site of Rwanda. I’m hoping you will help support me in this exhilarating endeavor with prayers and if possible, a donation. ALL donations made to True Vineyard Ministries and are Tax deductible.

Please visit their website to discover the work True Vineyard Ministries is doing: www.truevinyard.org

Thank you so much.

Always know a little will add up to a lot!!!

With much love and appreciation,

Kristi K. Caskey

story:
I apologize in advance for the lack of creativity in this pitch.

Today, 12/29/12 My family and I have learned that a very dear friend of ours Randy Starry, has suffered a great deal of emotional, physical, and economical pain yesterday, 12/28/12 in a deadly fire in his home in Greenbelt, Maryland.

Randy suffered a broken arm jumping out of the second floor in his home, though the arm will heal, his home is unsalvageable due to the deadly smoke and fire, and his heart forever broken as he lost his mother on this tragic night. 

As his 88 year old mother was rushed out of the house by her nurse, who suffered 3rd degree burns, Randy was still in his bedroom unaware of the situation. His mother, who may rest in peace, fought her way back in to look for her soon, unfortunately by then Randy had already jumped out. It is believed she passed away due to smoke inhalation.

Randy was someone who took my family under his wing when we needed help; He has a huge heart and i want to be able to help him anyway possible. I Would like to raise as much money as possible, for anything and everything.

The money would go to things such as:

  • Medical bills
  • A bed
  • Clothes
  • Lost documents

and a hundred other things we may not take in consideration!
This would be very much appreciated!

Other ways to help:

If you arent able to contribute to this cause with money, please dont turn away.
Share this page with friends, and social media. Get the word out!

 

The news coverage can be seen here:
http://www.wusa9.com/news/article/235495/158/Officials-Investigate-Md-Fire-That-Killed-One-Left-2-Injured-

story:
Hi!

We're Dentistry students at Dalhousie University!

We're participating in an annual stage play called "For The Health Of It" along with other health profession faculties at DAL.

Besides having fun and putting on a great show, a big reason for this event is to raise money for a local charity in Halifax. This year the charity is the Halifax Association of Community Living.

HACL is a grass roots, family-based, charitable organization serving children, youth and adults with intellectual disabilities as well as offering support to their families. Created over 50 years ago, HACL continues to offer individualized early intervention programs for infants and children with special needs, so that they may comfortably integrate into a typical classroom setting. Education for all ages is the main goal of the HACL organization. As dental students, we know the importance of education and we are proud to be supporting this charity!

It takes a lot of work to get through dental school AND put together a great, funny play, but we also want to give as much as we can to the wonderful people at HACL.

We're hoping you'd like to help the Dalhousie Dentistry faculty raise money.

And if you're in the Halifax area and would like to see the show on Nov 24 at the Rebecca Cohn Theatre, please email kt461437@dal.ca for tickets.

Thank you so much!

story:
What is PodFiber and WatchFiber?

PodFiber

PodFiber is a community for PodCasters to connected with their fans and for fans to be able to find more PodCasters that they would enjoy. 

This service is only limited to the PodCasters of fiber arts. Spinning, sewing, knitting, quilting, clothes making etc... If you are a PodCaster in anything fiber related, you are welcome here.

The PodCasters will have the ability to connect to their fans, hold contests, create video or chat sessions with their viewers and much much more. This site will give the PodCasters a support group from other PodCasters. With a PodCasters forum system to help build a support group for PodCasters, we strive to help PodCasters in any way we can.

All users to PodFiber will be able to create events, either virtual or physical to plan meetups either at existing events and expos or, creating your own spanning the globe. Using friends and connections, there will be suggested pod casts based on what you view and what your friends watch.

With the creation of our new Supporters Exchange, we will strive to connect PodCasters with people who want to advertise on PodCasts. This way, potential advertisers can get in contact with podcasters that they like to help support the services that they enjoy.

WatchFiber 

If fully funded, we will also be presenting WatchFiber. With other video and audio hosting services shying away from pod casts and turning down podcasters, there is a growing need for a hosting and streaming service that is geared for you, the podcaster. If fully funded, this will provide the servers necessary to be able to provide not only hosting and streaming, but iTunes integration and viewer analytic statistics as well.

What Will The Funding Be Used For?

PodFiber and WatchFiber will both be free services. To ensure that this service remains free the monies will be used to provide servers for one year. This will give us large enough servers with the bandwidth requirements to be able to hold both platforms.

If we do not meet our goal, only the PodFiber service will be provided. As a unique social network, we will be able to provide all of the requirements for that.

If we are fully funded, WatchFiber will be launched along side of PodFiber to be able to bring both services online.

Thank You

Please, look over our wonderful perks and if you have any questions, please feel free to contact me at admin@podfiber.com

Follow us on Twitter @PodFiber for further updates with our development.

If you order Shirts, please drop a line with your shirt size. 

PodFiber and WatchFiber is owned and operated by DevGlo LLC

story:
Hello Lovelies! I’m Nancy Li, founder of Charity4Couture; a nonprofit organization that takes donated clothes, refurbishes them (such as studding, cutting, sewing, etc.), and then sells them on my website. Best of all, proceeds will be donated directly to St.Jude's Research Hospital and the Hirshberg Foundation.

A little bit about me: I am currently a junior at Chino Hills High School. I have a love for styling clothes and walking dogs. I grew up volunteering around my community and giving back has always been my way of life. I was taught that it was important to do the best I could for my community. This charity integrates my love for fashion and my passion for philanthropy!

It all started when I was in the third grade - my Mom took me to a thrift store and I immediately loved everything there! From the funky jewelry to the unique pieces, I knew no one had this stuff. Ever since, I’ve found timeless pieces at the thrift store you would normally find at a regular store for 10x the price! So I thought I could find really cute clothes, style/modify them, and sell them. I mean, why can’t everyone afford cute stuff while contributing to a great cause?

We're looking to raise $3000 which will cover initial expenses such as materials, fees, marketing, and shipping costs. Any remaining donations from the campaign will be added to the St.Jude's Research Hospital and the Hirshberg Foundation fund.

What you guys get is a bunch of great perks! All the perks on the sidebar are personally handmade by me; they are unique and can be giftwrapped for a special someone. Also, you will feel all warm and fuzzy knowing that you are supporting a great cause! Look to your right for more info :)

*Note: Perks will be similar but not identical to above pictures

 

I started this charity to raise money and benefit St.Jude’s Research Hospital and the Hirshberg Foundation for Pancreatic Cancer Research

And you may ask why I picked these two foundations. Every year, the Let It Be Foundation holds an event called the Dance of Hope. This event is held in order to make money for children with cancer and their families by having groups of dance teams perform and fundraise for them. Dancing for these kids really called attention to the importance of finding cures for cancer, especially in children. 3 out of 10 children will lose their battle with cancer every year and that’s definitely an alarming number! Supporting the research of cancer will hopefully lower that number.

Another charity I chose to donate to is the Hirshberg Foundation for Pancreatic Cancer Research. A friend of mine lost his father figure who basically raised him and I saw the impact that pancreatic cancer has over families. Annually, an estimated 44,030 Americans will be diagnosed with pancreatic cancer and over 37,660 will die from the disease. Also, pancreatic cancer has the highest mortality rate of all major cancers: with 94% of patients dying within five years of diagnosis and only 6% survive more than five years. If we can contribute to the cure or at least fund research, then one of these days pancreatic cancers won’t be so fatal.

  

Additionally, I will be posting a poll on my website annually to determine which charity the proceeds will donated to for the following year.

You can always tell all your friends and family about this charity! What's most important is getting the word out so we can raise the money for these two foundations! You can use the Indiegogo share tool or check out our pages below! I want to thank my brother Richard for kick starting this with me and guiding me through it all. Also to Hector Espinoza for filming, shooting, and editing. Lastly, to those who have donated clothes to the website!

Website: http://charity4couture.com

Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/Charity4Couture

Tumblr: http://charity4couture.tumblr.com

Twitter: http://twitter.com/charity4couture

What you guys get is a bunch of great perks! All the perks on the sidebar are personally handmade by me; they are unique and can be giftwrapped for a special someone. Also, you will feel all warm and fuzzy knowing that you are supporting a great cause! Look to your right for more info :)

*Note: Perks will be similar but not identical to above pictures
 

I started this charity to raise money and benefit St.Jude’s Research Hospital and the Hirshberg Foundation for Pancreatic Cancer Research
And you may ask why I picked these two foundations. Every year, the Let It Be Foundation holds an event called the Dance of Hope. This event is held in order to make money for children with cancer and their families by having groups of dance teams perform and fundraise for them. Dancing for these kids really called attention to the importance of finding cures for cancer, especially in children. 3 out of 10 children will lose their battle with cancer every year and that’s definitely an alarming number! Supporting the research of cancer will hopefully lower that number.
Another charity I chose to donate to is the Hirshberg Foundation for Pancreatic Cancer Research. A friend of mine lost his father figure who basically raised him and I saw the impact that pancreatic cancer has over families. Annually, an estimated 44,030 Americans will be diagnosed with pancreatic cancer and over 37,660 will die from the disease. Also, pancreatic cancer has the highest mortality rate of all major cancers: with 94% of patients dying within five years of diagnosis and only 6% survive more than five years. If we can contribute to the cure or at least fund research, then one of these days pancreatic cancers won’t be so fatal.
  
Additionally, I will be posting a poll on my website annually to determine which charity the proceeds will donated to for the following year.

You can always tell all your friends and family about this charity! What's most important is getting the word out so we can raise the money for these two foundations! You can use the Indiegogo share tool or check out our pages below! I want to thank my brother Richard for kick starting this with me and guiding me through it all. Also to Hector Espinoza for filming, shooting, and editing. Lastly, to those who have donated clothes to the website!
Website: http://charity4couture.com
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/Charity4Couture
Tumblr: http://charity4couture.tumblr.com
Twitter: http://twitter.com/charity4couture

story:
Short Summary

This community garden project at the Hunts Point Recreation Center is a partnership effort between My Healthy Community and Urban Food Snob, both dedicated improving the health of residents in urban communities. Together, we want to empower families by increasing their access to fresh produce. We plan to educate the community on how to plant, grow, and cook fresh fruits and vegetables in a way that is beneficial to their health. Furthermore, young people will be taught fundamental business and entrepreneurial skills, which they will exhibit through a youth-led farmer's market. In addition to selling low-cost produce to community residents, we also plan to create programming around community and school based gardening and cooking classes. 

Read below for information on each organization:

My Healthy Community is a non-profit organization dedicated to the fight against  obesity. Our programs offer fitness & nutrition counseling, sports & recreation, fitness, dance, gardening and cooking classes.  Our goal is to build a healthy community. We will start by going into schools in the South-Bronx and assist them with getting our  youth and their families active and eating right. We will assist schools with starting and sustaining after school sports and recreation programs for the youth and health and wellness programs for adults.

The philosophy of Urban Food Snob is to bring health food to the masses, by delivering items directly to your door. We understand that it can be difficult and confusing to transition to a healthier lifestyle, so we save you time and energy by doing all the work for you.  Every month, Urban Food Snob sends out food boxes in the mail. In each box, customers receive approximately 4-6 health food items for their enjoyment.  Food items can range from whole grains, herbs and seasonings, granola and other snacks, nut butters, chocolates, etc.- all organic, and all in line with a holistic lifestyle. Whatever your health food needs- we will support you in your journey.

What We Need

This is how we will use your donations:

  • Fruit and vegetable seeds and soil
  • Gardening tools, such as shovels, gloves, rakes, and wheelbarrows (to name a few)
  • Community outreach events
  • Painting materials to spruce up the garden
  • Community greenhouse to promote year-round harvesting

The Impact

By contributing to our garden project, you are making a direct impact on the Hunts Point community by:

  • Giving residents access to freshly-grown fruits and vegetables
  • Creating a safe space where children and adults can learn about healthy cooking techniques
  • Starting a ripple effect of health and wellness that can play a role in decreasing the amount of nutrition related illness in Hunts Point, including cancer, Type II diabetes, high blood pressure, and so on.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that everyone may not be able to make a financial contribution, but that doesn’t mean that you can’t help:

  • Get the word out about our campaign by reaching out to family and friends who may be interested in our project
  • Make a supply donation (we will accept gently used gardening tools)
  • Share our story on social media using Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
The Game Wall Project

Welcome to my platform project! A funding platform/publisher for the awesome developers looking to publish/develop the most amazing games. And you can play an active part on it!

The Team

I have been involved in some amazing projects so far, having worked in the area of publishing and business development for major studios such as Disney Online Studios and Jagex Games Studios.


                                       


Why TheGameWall?

TheGameWall will give developers from all world to fund projects and at the same time partner with passionate gamers that would be a very strong asset in the growth and success of each game.

If the platform was live today I would offer you my project in order to be funded.

Anyone can bid to support and will get in return a share for future profits, depending on the bid you can have an active role on the course of the project.

An Example: 

  • We publish ThatGame.com on the platform in need of x amount to be funded.
  • Offer 30% in shares
  • People can bid a minimum of £5.00 that will be converted in a share for the game
  • ThatGame.com raises the fund and is published by TheGameWall
  • End of each month the revenue is shared by the shareholders.

This project have come to live after travelling the world and verify how many amazing games are out there without means to be published. Also some games that used well known platforms have struggled as the link between Studio and Public ends when the game is bought. This way all shareholders take ownership and would be part of the same game that developed the game, participating and having an active saying to it.



We are aiming for £35,000 that will be invested in the following:

  • Platform build specifically for this purpose Funding & Publishing - £ 11,500
  • Invest management license - £ 2,500
  • Legal costs - £2,500
  • Marketing Costs - £ 6,500
  • Equipment - £ 3,000
  • Investment in Indie projects - £ 9,000

I am confident you will love to see this project to go forward, however and in case we don't reach the value we need all the value raised will be invested in the platform.

If we exceed the value and reach £50,000 we will invest the excess in a HUB to support developers:

  • Workshops with major studio developers
  • Connecting Developers and Studio Publishers
  • Resource exchange
  • Cross collaboration between developers
  • Meet your game developers and participate in brain storming session

              

Help us to make the difference

Imagine developers and public/gamers working side by side to create the most exciting and fantastic games where you participate actively! Live is a game! Own it!

And because we believe in this project you will also be part of our team, TheGameWall will be for the public, we will empower the community to brainstorm and help us manage the platform. We want to hear your ideas and apply them.

Together with our experienced team that have launched,published and sold major game heavyweights we believe we can make a difference! 


  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

We depend on you to make this happen! Share with your friends our project!Play games! Own it!

A big thank you for having a look into our project

TheGameWall Team

story:
Summary

My name is Allison and I am a nurse. I graduated nursing school two years and began working. Throughout the years I have been able to take care of patients and make a difference. These patients have made a huge impact on me too and they have taught me a lot. I have been given the amazing opportunity to go to Zambia, Africa this summer. The program I am going with is called Nurses for Africa. I will be in Africa two weeks and will be taking care of patients in a rural village at clinics and at their home. We will be able to give some medications, do nursing assessments, treat some wounds, teach health education, and much more. I have always dreamed to go to Africa and help out those in need, and this is my opportunity to do so. I cannot go to Africa unless I am able to raise money to go on the trip. Any money donated over my goal will be used as donations to the people in the rural villages. I urge you to think and pray about my campaign, and give in any way you are able. I thank you in advance for considering to fund my trip to Africa. I am eager to go to Africa and to be given the opportunity to use my skill of nursing to help those in need.

What We Need & What You Get

 In order to fund my trip I will need $3900. This will include airplane ticket, overnight accommodations, transportation in Africa, supplies for home visits and food. Any money donated over $3900 will be used as donations to the rural village in Africa. If I do not raise the $3900, I will not be able to go to Africa. The funds will essentially get me to Africa and allow me to take care of people in Africa. I will be able to teach women, men, and children about their health. This teaching will include many subjects varying for healthy eating habits, women health including maternity, medications, and many more If you feel moved to help fund my trip, I genuinely appreciate it.  

The Impact

By giving to my trip, you are helping support those less fortunate than yourself. You are helping those that do not have resources for when they are sick. Many of the people I will be helping, need education and supplies in order to get healthy again or to just relieve their symptoms. By helping to fund my trip, you are allowing me to be the hands and feet and be able to make a difference in these peoples lives.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are able to contribute to my campaign, I really appreciate it and will be infinitely grateful. For those who are unable to contribute, I encourage you to share my campaign to your friends and family. I also ask that you use the Indiegogo share tools to let other knows about my trip. I appreciate your time in considering donations for my trip. If you are financially able, I encourage you to donate any amount you are able. I am extremely enthusiastic for my trip to Zambia, Africa and I thank you for allowing me to go by donating to my campaign.

story:
In a region where far too many unhoused people lack basic human needs on the Central Coast of California, Hope’s Village of SLO will be a safe haven where local people who are willing to work hard to improve their lives can live in simple dwellings, utilize their current skills, develop new ones, and contribute to the surrounding community.

Hope's Village will be a low cost, eco-friendly, sustainable community village for unhoused adults. It will have a "common house" including a commercial kitchen, bathrooms and laundry. Imagine a small neighborhood of tiny “Cabins on Wheels,” big gardens, and room enough to develop small businesses!

The villagers will work alongside our team of community volunteers to build the village, and will then be responsible for maintaining their village. Everyone will work, and everyone will participate in weekly meetings of a Village Council so their voices will be heard.

Hope’s Village will provide stable 24-hour housing (with round-the-clock security), an important foundation for personal empowerment. The village will be a safe, supportive, drug-free environment where people can live in dignity and in peace, and contribute to one another’s welfare.

This village will be a model of affordable, socially-beneficial, and eco-friendly housing for our modern society, pioneering an effective alternative to homelessness, and become a template for sustainable design.

Hope’s Village will demonstrate a way of living with a smaller environmental impact in a setting that fosters community participation and a sense of belonging. Shared use of open space and a common house with solar power will allow a relatively small site to support at least 50 people in our first village!

Hope’s Village is more than simply a solution to the housing crisis. In the face of one of the worst droughts in history, peak oil consumption, exponential population growth, loss of farmland, diminishing natural resources, and suburban sprawl, it is a promising and viable option for many - not just our unhoused. 

FUNDING: Presently, we need start-up funds to build the "common house"  which is the first structure we will build at the village to enable us to cook and provide facilities while the cabins are being built. 

SUCCESSES? To date, we have given 25 unhoused veterans on the Central Coast their own RV's (motorhomes, fifth wheels and travel trailers) through our "RV's for Veterans" program. It's just a simple donation from one caring individual to a homeless veteran - no money exchanges hands. Our project is now being started in other parts of the country too!

Other Ways You Can Help

In keeping with the mission and vision of Hope's Village (low cost and sustainable) we are in hot pursuit of a ten acre rural site to be donated or offered as a long-term lease to us, and we are SO CLOSE! It's always good to have a choice, so if you or someone you know has ten acres they'd like to put to very good use (outside SLO City Limits) please let us know! 

AND please help us spread the word about Hope's Village. This is a workable project, and can be started NOW (with a little help from our friends!)

story:
Hello, everyone!

Times have changed, and I am currently in the process of finding a place to move to and then moving to it. Solo. In this move, there is definitely a trial to be had as I unravel and separate my things out.
There are definitely some things I will be lacking going forward, as they were in a collective basket that is no more. I'm winning out on some things through this process, but others I will be missing out on - such as a bed.

This is my attempt to rebuild and be a little better off than I would otherwise be as I step out into the world once more.
I'm raising money to tie up some odds and ends on a number of things, in base practical things, such as fees related to new licenses with the address change, rebuilding of basic kitchen/cleaning/bathroom supplies, etc. Excess funds would be used for odds and ends as I discover their necessity.
I plan on thrifting as much as I can of these items as they're available. Anything going towards sanitation will be bought new.

The full funding is a lofty goal, but it will be used wisely.

story:
SASIL JA

Sasil Ja, meaning clear water in Mayan, pronounced "saw-seal ha" ; is an indigenous Mayan preschool/kindergarten located in southern Yucatan, Mexico in a small town named Dzan. Please help us raise funds to provide food and water to the school for an entire school year. Here is some important information you should know: 
Sasil Ja currently has 86 students, ranging from age 3 - 6. This is considered pre-schooling. (1st year, age 3-4) (2nd year, age 4-5) (3rd year, age 5-6). After the third year of pre-schooling/kindergarten they are promoted to Primary school. 
The facility currently in use is a house rented by the town of Dzan for the children of Sasil Ja. The children are in 3 classrooms, with no air conditioning, fans or clean water to drink. There is one bathroom for 86 students and all faculty. 
Meals are provided to the children at a cost of $6.00 pesos per day. For many of these children this is the only meal that they can eat as theirs. With the traditional family sizes here being very large, sharing a meal and the same plate and bowls of food with siblings is the norm. 
Children are in school from 8AM - 11AM. Due to the heat, classes for these age children are in the mornings. The temperature here in the Yucatan can easily reach 100 degrees by 11AM.  This is why it is so necessary to make sure the children have fresh purified bottled water to drink when they want it.  The ground water here is no longer safe for people to drink. The faculty provides 20liter bottles of water out of pocket when they have the funds to do so. When they can't purchase water, the children must do without until they can reach home. 


This is the goal we need to reach and why. 

We need to raise  $6380.00 
Here are the numbers for the water and food for 3 classrooms and 86 children. Raising funds for 160 days of class....here goes:
Food:
86 students, 9 months, 3 classrooms. 
(1) meal $6.00 pesos
86 students at $6.00 per meal is $516.00 pesos per day. 
$516.00 pesos per day at 160 days of class is $82560.00 pesos for the food
Food total = $82560.00 pesos

Water:
(1) 20 Liter container of water is $12.00 pesos
9 months of class with 32 weeks of school is $432.00 pesos for one classroom for the year. 
3 classrooms for 32 weeks is $1296.00 pesos. 
Water total = $1296.00 pesos

Total for food and water = $ 83856.00 pesos

Converted to USD $ 6379.84 rounding up to $6380.00

I am an American mother of a now 5 year old son attending SASIL Ja kindergarten. We have lived in Dzan Yucatan since October of 2011. The average income for a household is between $80 - $150 pesos per day. (between $6 - 13 USD a day) I see that funding food and water for the Sasil JA school children for a year can make life easier on their parents and multiple siblings. I would like to make the first experiences in education for these kids to not include worrying about the money for food and clean drinking water. Funding for food and water for these 86 children for a school year would make the beginning school years more positive, with less stress.  I hope that after the food and water project is complete for Sasil Ja, that we will be able to complete building the new school  that has been at a standstill for over a year. Funding stopped from The state of Yucatan as the funds for schools were totally depleted. 


First things first. Spread the word and donate what you can. Everyone has a voice, whether it be by email, twitter, Instagram, Facebook, or the old word of mouth, etc. The more people aware of what we are trying to accomplish, the better chance we have of making this a successful project for the kids. So, talk about it to everyone and ask them to spread the word too. Accomplish the vision, donate.

Meals are provided to the children at a cost of $6.00 pesos per day. For many of these children this is the only meal that they can eat as theirs. With the traditional family sizes here being very large, sharing a meal and the same plate and bowls of food with siblings is the norm. 
Children are in school from 8AM - 11AM. Due to the heat, classes for these age children are in the mornings. The temperature here in the Yucatan can easily reach 100 degrees by 11AM.  This is why it is so necessary to make sure the children have fresh purified bottled water to drink when they want it.  The ground water here is no longer safe for people to drink. The faculty provides 20liter bottles of water out of pocket when they have the funds to do so. When they can't purchase water, the children must do without until they can reach home.     This is the goal we need to reach and why. 
We need to raise  $6380.00 

Here are the numbers for the water and food for 3 classrooms and 86 children. Raising funds for 160 days of class....here goes:
Food:
86 students, 9 months, 3 classrooms. 
(1) meal $6.00 pesos
86 students at $6.00 per meal is $516.00 pesos per day. 
$516.00 pesos per day at 160 days of class is $82560.00 pesos for the food
Food total = $82560.00 pesos

Water:
(1) 20 Liter container of water is $12.00 pesos
9 months of class with 32 weeks of school is $432.00 pesos for one classroom for the year. 
3 classrooms for 32 weeks is $1296.00 pesos. 
Water total = $1296.00 pesos

Total for food and water = $ 83856.00 pesos

Converted to USD $ 6379.84 rounding up to $6380.00

I am an American mother of a now 5 year old son attending SASIL Ja kindergarten. We have lived in Dzan Yucatan since October of 2011. The average income for a household is between $80 - $150 pesos per day. (between $6 - 13 USD a day) I see that funding food and water for the Sasil JA school children for a year can make life easier on their parents and multiple siblings. I would like to make the first experiences in education for these kids to not include worrying about the money for food and clean drinking water. Funding for food and water for these 86 children for a school year would make the beginning school years more positive, with less stress.  I hope that after the food and water project is complete for Sasil Ja, that we will be able to complete building the new school  that has been at a standstill for over a year. Funding stopped from The state of Yucatan as the funds for schools were totally depleted. 


First things first. Spread the word and donate what you can. Everyone has a voice, whether it be by email, twitter, Instagram, Facebook, or the old word of mouth, etc. The more people aware of what we are trying to accomplish, the better chance we have of making this a successful project for the kids. So, talk about it to everyone and ask them to spread the word too. Accomplish the vision, donate.

story:
This is me.

Hi there. I'm Sarah, a single mother of a beautiful 5 year old named Owen. I work from home by sewing so I can stay with him. While that seems like a good idea in theory, reality has me working 12 to 14 hour days most of the time. I'm there, though, any time he needs me or wants to pop into my sewing room. We live with my 64 year old disabled mother and 18 year old cousin. We've had custody of my cousin for 4 years now, ever since my uncle died unexpectedly. Her mother was best left out of the picture, so we fought for her and won. She's faced so many challenges in life and survived to tell the tale. We wanted to protect her from any other traumas. I hope we've done that.

When life hands you lemons...

You're supposed to be able to make lemonade from it, right? But what if you don't have the sugar? That's what this last few months have felt like, for sure. The downward spiral started in earnest in March, when my doctor suspected I had gallbladder issues. I'd been feeling absolutely horrible for months, but my then current physician wouldn't really listen to me. I wised up and changed to a new doctor who was a little more concerned with her patients rather than how much money she could roll in within an hour. The very first visit, she found the first signs.

That's when Murphy kicked in. What could go wrong did go wrong. It started with tests being rescheduled, then insurance refusing to cover doctors and hospitals. Once we finally discovered that my gallbladder was very inflamed and I had multiple gallstones, I had to wait to find a new surgeon. And then they called to reschedule. Twice. The longer I waited, the sicker I got, until, 3 months after the original diagnosis, I ended up being rushed to the hospital in an ambulance. I had emergency surgery that day. I wouldn't wish that on anyone. I've never been in so much pain in my life, childbirth included.

At the same time, we were facing another battle. We were homeschooling my cousin, mostly because the local school is on the verge of bankruptcy and she was learning nothing there. We want her to be prepared for her future, not passed along just to get her to the next grade. Because of her dad's premature death, she's been receiving survivors' benefits. We were told that would continue until she graduated or turned 19. We use an accredited school that works under every rule the state of Texas has for homeschooling. June came, and her benefits stopped. We were reeling. Suddenly losing $600 without notice is a blow. If you've ever dealt with the government, you know the hoops and red tape that you have to go through just to talk to someone. We sat on the phone for hours. We went to the somewhat local office numerous times. We were told one thing, which was countered by another. We did everything they told us to, and they still wouldn't reinstate her benefits. This was all going on while I was declining faster and faster. I couldn't work. I could barely move without incredible bouts of pain.

On June 12th, I had my surgery. I was hoping for great things, that I would be back to my normal routine within the week, like the surgeon and nurses kept telling me I would be. The first warning sign was staying in the hospital for a day longer than normal. It's been 6 weeks since the surgery. I'm only just now beginning to get back on my feet. I'm still battling with ever-present pain and intermittent nausea. I've been in the emergency room twice since my surgery. 

The day after I came home from the hospital, we started the fight back up again with Social Security. We were able to breathe a sigh of relief week or so later when the case worker told us it was a go, that we probably wouldn't get June back, but we would get the July payment. It didn't come. We started sitting on the phone again to try to find out what happened. The caseworker never returned our calls. Just yesterday, we were finally able to get through to them. Now we have to bring them receipts proving that we bought the school books, even though we've already brought the actual books into the office for them to copy. These are things that are NOT required by Texas law. We've been over it with a fine toothed comb.

The Last Straw

The straw that broke the camel's back came Sunday, when our landlord knocked on our door with an eviction notice. She's been working with us, and she's been great about it, but we're two notes behind. We pay $600 a month. If we can just get one note in by August 10th, she'll put one note into payments added onto the rent, so we'll owe $700 a month for the next 6 months. Fees from fundraising and Paypal are going to bring that up to $800. It's a lot, but I'm just not sure what else to do at this point. We've been told the benefits will start again, but who knows when. You can't borrow from people without knowing when you can pay it back. Moving right now isn't even an option. I'm physically not able to lift anything over 20 lbs for the next month, at the very least.

What I'm Asking For

I'm not asking for simple donations. I'm asking you to help me work. I do so many different things, it's hard to remember them. I've done graphic work in Photoshop. I've designed products for the Patriot Guard Riders, back when I was managing their store for a few years. I've been sewing for the online public for 10 years. In my costuming and prop making, I've done leatherworking, stencil making, painting, embroidery, pattern drafting, jewelry making, quilting, doll making, sketching, and more. You can find a small amount of my work in my Facebook albums. I've also been working on genealogy, just in case anyone would be interested in that. I've researched ours back to the year 800 A.D.

Above all, thank you for making it this far with me!

story:
Short Summary

The Breaking Ground Poets are a not for profit youth poetry organization that celebrates courageous youth poets in a variety of ways. We are also the group to bring you poets like Andrea Gibson, Buddy Wakefield, Anis Mojgani, Jon Sands, Lauren Zuniga, and others.  Throughout the year events are held at TwentyFiveEight Studios that require seating. To rent and deliver chairs is extremely expensive ($89 each time). As a group with very little funding, we decided to purchase used chairs from a local business closing their doors. Our Director, Katie Wisnosky, graciously paid for the chairs and this fundraiser will be used to reimburse her.  Any additional money raised will be used to purchase extra chairs.

Your Perk!

The Breaking Ground is giving you the once-in-a-lifetime chance to leave your mark on their program and support youth arts in North Eastern Pennsylvania. All donations of $10 or more will be recognized with a hand drawn message on the back of each chair in permanent marker/paint. You can create your own message at checkout or email us with additional details.

    The Impact

    As BGP continues to grow, we find ourselves at a critical turning point in our program and need your help to be able to continue bringing exciting live poetry to the area and recruit more people to our shows. If you believe in the work of The Breaking Ground, we urge you to consider sponsoring a chair. There is a limit of 50 seats!

    By saving money on not renting chairs, we are able to spend more money on helping youth poets and enriching the community through additional programming.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      The Breaking Ground Poets is the only group in this area of its kind. By making a "chair"itable donation now, you are ensuring a financially secure future for our youth and the program. Like our Facebook page to stay up-to-date with future events!
