story:
Heaven has recently gained an angel. Kelli Jo Jordan was reunited with her beautiful sister Joni. She was one of the most beautiful people I know. She was an amazing wife, mother, daughter, aunt, sister and friend. She will be greatly missed by all. 

Here we are asking for any donations. This is to help her beautiful family and boys with funeral expenses, travel for family,  and so much more. There are going to be many things that arise for this family that has lost so much. With Halloween, Thanksgiving and Christmas right around the corner this family is going to need all of the help we can give them. 

I am asking all of you to please donate to help Dave and Sandy Burnett and Jon, Nik and Logan alleviate some of the financial stress.  

All of the money donated here will be given directly to Sandy, Dave and Jon. Please help even if it is a dollar. Anything will do.

Anything and everything will help. 

Thank You all in advance

-Jaime Stimpson

Per Kenzi Burnett

story:
Imagine the legacy you could leave behind for your family and friends, after you've passed.  Much more than photos or pre-recorded home videos, more than pen to paper words...but a chance to talk to you, interact with you, pick your brain, ask the questions, and hear your answers.  A chance for your loved ones to hear your stories and learn more about your life, from your own lips.  A way to say goodbye, with some answers and reassurances, in order to help your loved ones to move on from their loss. 

When someone leaves us, expectedly or unexpectedly, questions often create voids that are impossible to fill. We are often told “Time will heal all”, but does it ever, really? Those questions could be answered and those voids never created.  We cannot beat death, but we can heal the grieving, in a more progressive, healthy way.  We can make this happen with your backing/contributions.


We believe that one of the biggest steps in solving world issues is by making all people more whole.  This company's aim is to change the experience of grieving, by giving people an opportunity to say goodbye in ways never dreamed of before.  We aren't looking to replace traditional funeral services. We believe they are a staple of our cultures. But many do not, or cannot, attend those services. They never get the closure we all so desperately need and deserve.  We are going to redefine how we all deal with losing our most cherished.  Imagine, if you will, being able to speak with your great, great grandfather, or seeing your spouse again.  This is possible, it can be done, the technology is here, and it's a reality for our children and our childrens children. We will redefine the "living" will.  Can you imagine a "living", interactive, family tree?  It all begins with you.  It all begins with step one.


Please share, donate, or get involved. Thank you for contributing!

story:
Short Summary

Making dreams come true is my ultimate goal. All children deserve something special and to feel like they have someone to believe in. Every contribution, no matter how small, will help fund the cost for crafts and materials so that D2D Enchanted Princess Parties can be offered free at local charity events.

I’m young at heart and I love to see children laugh and smile. As a visual arts student and a princess party host for more than three years, I spend my time helping children see the true magic of being a child and help them experience their dreams.

While working as a princess party host, we would often be asked to attend a local charity event or fundraiser. Due to the costs involved, the organizers would often have to cancel as they simply couldn’t afford the fees. It always seemed so sad to have to refuse because of money, especially when the charitable cause was so inspiring and heart-warming.

Recently, I decided I would start offering my own princess parties and attend these charitable events on my own, but unfortunately, I only own one dress that I made myself and I need to make more princess costumes. After being invited to numerous charity events, I quickly found that I didn’t have the money to support this idea and I’m worried that I will have to start declining events.

There are many events in and around my area who would love to have a princess visit for the benefit of the children. If I can raise some money, I can buy the materials needed to make the popular princess costumes and also buy the many crafts and materials that I use to help entertain the children.

What We Need & What You Get

I am aiming to raise $1,500 to enable me to purchase the fabric, materials and craft supplies so that I can provide everything needed to host parties for kids.

Currently, I have a number of bookings, all of which are displayed on my Facebook page. If there’s an opportunity to raise more funds, I can expand my efforts to include many more events that are happening within the Greater Toronto Area, with an opportunity to engage with some of the much larger organizations too.

Photographs, videos and memories will be the reward for parents and donators, but for me, it’s simply seeing a child smile and laugh.


The Impact

Have you ever seen a child who has very little, but for a few minutes is made to feel like the most important person in the world? I have. It’s something you can’t describe to anyone. Every child wants to feel special and happy. With many years of experience working with children as a princess party host and Girl Guide leader, I have had the opportunity to make children smile, laugh and feel happy. It’s a very rewarding experience and one I want to continue experiencing through the work that I enjoy.

Risks & Challenges

Monetary funds are my biggest obstacle at the moment. Rather than purchasing costumes online or in-store, I have the skills to make my own costumes and props, as well as access to a very experienced seamstress who can help me with the more complex costumes. However, the fabrics and materials needed are not cheap and it’s very challenging to purchase everything with very little income to support me.

Awareness and promotions are also a challenge, but I have been slowly working to grow my network through friends and family who are spreading the word. Each time I appear at an event, I use it as an opportunity to promote my availability to appear at other events. I have access to an experienced graphic designer and a photographer who are willing to help with my promotional efforts, but there are materials costs associated with this as well.


Perks

If it is deemed appropriate (based on the event), I would be open to discuss sponsorship opportunities and include promotional materials along with my own. An outline will be further defined if there is interest.

story:
Hippotherapy in Sudan– the Miracle of Healing with Horses for Special Needs Children

There is an estimated 720,000 (2008 Sudan census) children with disabilities in Sudan. Treatments are limited and expensive. Disabilities are still a taboo and those suffering them are often discriminated against. Furthermore, formal education in the country does not provide for children with special needs and families find themselves alone caring for, treating and raising the children all by themselves.

Jane-anne moved to Sudan years ago and rooted herself in the country quickly, founding a family that today goes well beyond her husband Yassin and her 8 children. At the Miracles-Sudan Farm, established at its present location since the year 2000, there are 13 rescued horses, 3 donkeys and a mule!  An average of 60 Sudanese special needs children undergo hippotherapy every week. As most of their families have very limited resources and governmental and private support is particularly limited, therapy is provided for free and with the help of dozens of volunteers.

Miracle-Sudan farm does not only provide a treatment strategy which is internationally recognised as effective in many different contexts and for many disabilities. It gives children and their families hope for a better future, a better quality of life and the dignity that comes from knowing that they are doing their best. The farm is also a place for families to meet and discuss common problems, experiences and solutions and for the children to socialize.

Jane-anne has embarked on the construction of stables for the horses and other animals, as well as a centre that will function as a safe and nurturing environment for these children and their families, a space where they will have an opportunity to grow and develop.

Miracle-Sudan farm needs your support in continuing to provide children with the treatment they so badly need as well as to finalise construction of the centre.

Some examples of what your money will do:

A one and a half hour group therapy session, for an average of 12 children costs on 50 USD

Feeding and additional expenses (vet, farrier, wormers ect) of one horse per month is 250 USD

2,150 USD  will pay for the construction of a kitchen and all its equipment in the centre.

Jane-anne has made plans for income generating activities to complement your generous contributions. Already, funding comes in through lessons to children without disabilities, second hand toys and clothes markets and other initiatives. And with a finalised centre she will be able to generate additional income as it can be rented out for informal education activities and social gatherings.

What is hippotherapy?

Hippotherapy is a physical, occupational or speech therapy treatment strategy that utilises equine movement as part of an integrated treatment program to achieve functional outcomes.  In hippotherapy - which is named after the Greek word for horse, “hippo” - the patient engages in activities on the horse that are enjoyable, challenging and effective.

What are the benefits?

Benefits of hippotherapy include improvements in balance, muscle strength, gait, posture and symmetry, joint mobility, sensory processing and motor planning.  In addition, this therapy is far removed from a clinic or hospital setting and comes with the rich sensory and emotional aspects of the horse and beautiful farm setting.

The story behind the picture

Nada is 14 years old and was born with cerebral palsy. Her parents travel to the farm for hippotheray twice a week. The trip is long and they have to change bus twice. As wheel chairs are not allowed, they take turns in carrying her. The improvements they have seen in Nada make it all worth it!

For more information on hippotherapy and children with disabilities in Sudan:

Professional Association of Therapeutic Horsemanship International PATH- http://www.pathintl.org

American Hippotherapy Association -  http://www.americanhippotherapyassociation.org

UNICEF Analysis of the Situation of Children with Disabilities in Sudan- http://www.unicef.org/sudan/children_7485.html

Physical Therapy in Motion- http://www.physical-therapy-in-motion.com/upload/Evidenced%20Based%20Practice%20%20HPOT%20PDF.pdf
story_txt:
Hippotherapy in Sudan– the Miracle of
Healing with Horses for Special Needs Children

There is an estimated
720,000 (2008 Sudan census) children with disabilities in Sudan. Treatments are
limited and expensive. Disabilities are still a taboo and those suffering them
are often discriminated against. Furthermore, formal education in the country
does not provide for children with special needs and families find themselves
alone caring for, treating and raising the children all by themselves. 
Jane-anne moved to Sudan
years ago and rooted herself in the country quickly, founding a family that
today goes well beyond her husband Yassin and her 8 children. At the
Miracles-Sudan Farm, established at its present location since the year 2000,
there are 13 rescued horses, 3 donkeys and a mule!  An average of 60 Sudanese special needs
children undergo hippotherapy every week. As most of their families have very
limited resources and governmental and private support is particularly
limited, therapy is provided for free and with the help of dozens of
volunteers.
Miracle-Sudan farm does not
only provide a treatment strategy which is internationally recognised as
effective in many different contexts and for many disabilities. It gives
children and their families hope for a better future, a better quality of life
and the dignity that comes from knowing that they are doing their best. The
farm is also a place for families to meet and discuss common problems,
experiences and solutions and for the children to socialize.
Jane-anne has embarked on
the construction of stables for the horses and other animals, as well as a
centre that will function as a safe and nurturing environment for these children
and their families, a space where they will have an opportunity to grow and
develop.
Miracle-Sudan farm needs
your support in continuing to provide children with the treatment they so badly
need as well as to finalise construction of the centre. 

Some examples of what your money will do:
A one and a half hour group therapy session, for an average of
12 children costs on 50 USD
Feeding and additional expenses (vet, farrier, wormers ect) of one
horse per month is 250 USD
2,150 USD  will pay for the construction of a kitchen and all
its equipment in the centre.

Jane-anne has made plans
for income generating activities to complement your generous contributions.
Already, funding comes in through lessons to children without disabilities, second
hand toys and clothes markets and other initiatives. And with a finalised
centre she will be able to generate additional income as it can be rented out
for informal education activities and social gatherings. 
What is hippotherapy?
Hippotherapy is a physical,
occupational or speech therapy treatment strategy that utilises equine movement
as part of an integrated treatment program to achieve functional
outcomes.  In hippotherapy - which is named after the Greek word for
horse, “hippo” - the patient engages in activities on the horse that are
enjoyable, challenging and effective.
What are the benefits?
Benefits of hippotherapy
include improvements in balance, muscle strength, gait, posture and
symmetry, joint mobility, sensory processing and motor planning.  In
addition, this therapy is far removed from a clinic or hospital setting
and comes with the rich sensory and emotional aspects of the horse and
beautiful farm setting.The story behind the pictureNada is 14 years old and was born with
cerebral palsy. Her parents travel to the farm for hippotheray twice a week.
The trip is long and they have to change bus twice. As wheel chairs are not
allowed, they take turns in carrying her. The improvements they have seen in
Nada make it all worth it!
For more information on hippotherapy and children with disabilities in Sudan:
Professional Association of
Therapeutic Horsemanship International PATH- http://www.pathintl.org
American Hippotherapy
Association -  http://www.americanhippotherapyassociation.org
UNICEF Analysis of the
Situation of Children with Disabilities in Sudan- http://www.unicef.org/sudan/children_7485.html
Physical Therapy in Motion-
http://www.physical-therapy-in-motion.com/upload/Evidenced%20Based%20Practice%20%20HPOT%20PDF.pdf

story:
Hi! We want to introduce ourselves. We’re Tom and Donna Cole, co-founders of Pure Heart Ministries International. 

Good News!!! We have just been informed that we have received a matching grant!!! Every dollar given to this campaign will be DOUBLED! Read on to catch the vision.

We have been ministering to the broken hearted since 1989. We helped relationally and sexually broken people through Reconciliation Ministries of Michigan for 10 years, followed by over 7 years as the Pastoral Care Director at the International House of Prayer in Kansas City. We’ve spent the last three and a half years working with Youth With A Mission, training missionaries around the world. Our greatest desire is to see people healed, whole and wildly in love with God. 


It has always been a dream of ours to restore people in a setting of peace and tranquility, surrounded by God’s beautiful creation and life. Our dream was to, one day, own a farm where we could bring in pastors, leaders, missionaries, business leaders and others where they could be restored, refreshed and healed from life’s hurts. We have also desired to train young men and women in restoring broken people AND in how to live sustainably through natural agriculture, raising animals, cheese making and other means of food preservation. We have recently moved to Greenville, South Carolina to begin to see this vision finally come to pass. 

Looking at this realistically we need to raise a lot of money to do this well. We are investing our own savings as well. But we need your help. We need to raise enough money for a down-payment if we’re to secure a farm (and we have one in mind, check out the pictures of the farm in the Gallery above by clicking on the Gallery button) that could become a place of healing, restoration and training. We need to raise at least $40,000.00 if we are to buy the farm (though we’d love to raise more, allowing for a smaller amount of debt). Your gifts, no matter how small or large, will enable many to be healed and even more to be trained. So far we have raised $20,000 and we need to raise $20,000 more!


Will you join with us? You can help in several ways. You can contribute financially. Another way to help is by sharing this with your friends, family and co-workers. Share this on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Google+ and any other social media site you have. We could easily reach this goal if just 1,000 people gave $20.00 or more each. We have a large amount to raise, so gifts of $100.00, $1,000.00 and even $10,000.00 will be needed to see this vision come to pass. So please help us by spreading the word! All gifts given are tax deductible as we are a registered 501(c)3 non-profit organization.

Your gift will help bring healing to broken and burned out leaders. Your gift will also help us to train MANY others in the skills necessary to bring hope and healing to the nations.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact us at tomcole@pureheartseminars.com with any questions. You can also learn more about our ministry and our free resources by visiting our website at www.pureheartseminars.com.

story:
I want to become a Doula. What's a Doula you ask, well a Doula is physical, emotional and informational support for the mother before, during and just after birth. Studies have shown that when Doula's attend birth, labors are shorter with fewer complications, babies are healthier and they breastfeed easier. They are the coach in your corner! I am asking for your help, to realize my dream to help bring babies peacefully into this world, to calm and happy moms.
I applied for a scholarship through birth arts international, and thankfully I was approved for a partial scholarship. I have one month to apply for classes before my scholarship is voided,
The remaining cost to me is 300 dollars, This would cover my certification, I will also need to purchase several books.
Doula's are important!
This is the woman who stands in your corner and fights for your rights to a healthy, happy and well informed birth,
She doesn't bully you into making choices in your birth you are not comfortable with, she fights with you for the choices you want.
She is your coach, your cheerleader, your informant, and your shoulder to lean on, and more often than not, she becomes your friend.
I expect to struggle, with the cost of achieving my dream, the late nights studying, the hard work to get my name out there and be the Doula that mothers want to hire. but "anything worth doing, will not be easy." and this is the most worth while thing I have ever wanted to do. If babies are the future than the mothers who are nurturing that future, are so important, and I want to be the woman who shows them that!
I fully understand the financial burden we all bare, so I do not expect that everyone will be able to help me with this struggle, but I do hope you will share my story. every share gets my story further out there, gets me one step closer to achieving a dream I hold dear, and to being a part of something great.

story:
**UPDATED 4/8/2015**

Wow, I'm in awe of what has happened here.  Thanks for everyone to helped contribute, spread the word, or both.  In less than 3 days, my goal of $7500 has not only been met, it's been exceeded.  and people are still contributing.

I cannot thank everyone enough for all of the help I've received.  It means more to me than anyone could possibly know.  I'm so overwhelmed with emotions at the moment, it's so hard for me to write.  All of the tweets, bumps, blogs, and writings mean so much to me.  Thank you again!

They say only 1 out of 4 drug addicts are able to recover. Only 1 out of 4 addicts are able to pull themselves out of the black hole that is addiction. Only 1 out of 4 addicts find a reason -- any reason -- to stop destroying themselves, and to really start living.

I'm so proud to say I am that 1 out of 4. This upcoming April will mark 6 years of me living a clean and sober lifestyle. These past 6 years have given me a lot of clarity on who I am, and who I want to be. I've been able to progress with my life in ways I never thought possible: I've created and continue to grow my own business out of something I'm truly passionate about. I've formed friendships with people who care about me for who I am now. Best of all, I have a beautiful wife whom I love more than anyone in the world. and we’ve made our home with sweet little rescue pups who make me feel like I can do no wrong.

However, the past cannot be so simply erased. A lot of the choices I made during those dark years still haunt me; as a consequence, I have two possession charges out on the West Coast. These two charges prevent me from being the person I’ve worked so hard to become, and they impact my family and my business.

I have been in contact with an attorney who’s confident we can make a strong case to have these charges dropped. It's going to cost about $7,500 to pursue this. As much as I’ve worked to change my life, and as far as I’ve come, this is the last hurdle keeping me from moving into an even better future without having to constantly look over my shoulder.

For the past six years -- whether it has been working with animal rescues, helping out a friend in need, or dedicating my time and skills to my community – giving has helped me build the foundation for my new life.

Now I’m the one that needs to ask for help. I’m ready to move forward with my life. Whatever you’re able to give me in money now, I’ll find a way to put back into the community.

I’m ready to move on with my life, and if you can help me, even with a small donation, it would mean a lot.

story:
In August of 2014, Mark lost his job. He has had some temporary assignments, but for the most part, has been out of work since. I have been too sick to work and have applied for SSI. I am waiting on a hearing date.

We have been living on our 401K and are about to run out of money and are scared that we will not be able to cover our September rent. We should probably ask for more, but we do not want to be greedy. We have rent, food, electric, credit cards, cell phone (I use it for medical reasons more then anything else), and other bills to pay.

ps - the program would not let me upload a picture.

We also have a kid - and do not want her to be homeless. We are scared - very scared. This is the longest Mark has been out of work. He has always had a steady job. If you could contribute, that would be a whole lot of awesome.

We really cannot afford to give you something for giving us money - but I can give hugs and many thank you shout outs if you live too far for a hug.

Thank you in advance - we really appreciate it.

story:
Why Slow Travel?

We are two Italian women, mother and daughter, with a passion for traveling and a strong ethics for diversity. Being travelers ourselves, we have always privileged small and unknown destinations, unstepped routes, and out of season sceneries, far from the madding crowd. We like to feel and taste one remote location, rather than running through a dozen must-see places. 

Through our lives, we ended up researching the negative effects of mass tourism: the illusion of economic growth, which results in social oppression and the exploitation of local resources to the advantage of few corporate industries; the reciprocal stereotyping and false perceptions created between the nations involved; the trivialization of cultural and traditional values; and last but not least, global pollution.

Meanwhile we kept on traveling around the world in a different way, and we have found out how fulfilling and magic it can be. We call it Slow Travel. A new way of traveling, where time becomes the key to open the doors of a reality you have yet to explore. Easiness is the rhythm of your steps. You want to see less, but deeper. You search the authenticity of the culture you approach. You follow hundred-years old paths. Meet the people, taste their home food, learn their jokes. Sit at the kitchen table of a country grandma, who teaches you her cooking secrets. Join the village celebrations and feasts. Discover the small and hidden jewels of the surroundings, led by local guides who have spent their lifetimes there.

We want to stay away from the predictable routes of mainstream tour packages, to explore instead unusual destinations, unknown even to most Italians. We want to take you where time seems to have stopped centuries ago, wondering through uncontaminated villages and lands. We want to give you the chance to discover and love a still unspoiled nature. We want you to experience the difference between looking at a country through a window glass, and living it from the inside.

In other words, the difference between being a tourist and a traveler…

Our project naturally converges in the Slow Food movement, with which we share principles and values: sustainability and harmony with nature, a commitment the communities and the environment, and awareness of our global responsibility towards the rest of the planet. 


LGBTQ and Women-only

All are welcome to join our trips, which promote diversity of race, faith, sexuality, and gender expressions of all kinds. 

We are proud to offer LGBTQ itineraries, with the desire of sharing and encouraging the discovery of less known tales, places, and figures of Italian queer history and presence.

Partnerning uniquely with LGBTQ positive establishments, we have designed a one-of-a-kind itinerary in the heart of Tuscan Maremma. Following our Slow Travel mandate, we will stay out of big cities and common tourist destinations. We will instead explore ancient and remote villages, taste the superb eno-gastronomic gems of these areas, and learn about some of the untold stories that these lands conceal.

We are also happy to launch women-only tours, leading you through the small streets of tiny medieval towns and remote rural villages of the Tuscan Apennines. You may want to endeavor a culinary experience, tasting the true flavors of home-made Italian cuisine, and mastering its secrets. Or you may enjoy spotting row-deers in the early morning, visiting the lively weekly market of Tuscan villages, or gathering wild herbs and learning how to use them. You are welcome to find your womenly way to Italy….
Following the path of archaic/prehistoric female-based societies, and retracing the steps of historical female writers, poetesses, philosophers, mystics, and scientists, we are excited to lead you through a totally out-of-the-ordinary, time-travel experience. Join us and honor with us the lives and works of female talents sometimes underestimated even today, because of their gender. Discover the forgotten stories and unknown places that have shaped the lives of unique women, and marvel at the precious heritage that they have generously left us with. Sit in the presence of these ancient women’s everlasting mark, feel the power of their strength and determination, untangle the mysteries of their interwoven existences.
Whether you come with your daughters or sisters, friends or lovers, or whether you bring just yourself, this trip is open to women-only and to all who identify on the female spectrum.


The Italian Dream 

We intend to specialize in two types of Slow Travel: Culinary Experiences, and Cultural Trips. 

CULINARY EXPERIENCES - we offer you the unique opportunity to taste the real dishes of Italian cuisine, and to learn its secrets and delicacies attending our cooking classes, held by local, life-long experienced home-cooks. These sessions are space-out by daily walking excursions into the wild and yet unspoiled surrounding nature, and visits to enchanting little villages and and forgotten towns of the gorgeous Tuscan Apennines. We can also visit the nearby  Bordona Organic Cheese Factory, walk along its stables, see how cheese is made and enjoy a unique cheese tasting experience.



CULTURAL TRIPS - Italy is a country with a history thousands years-old, preserving an incredible abundance of rests of the past, archeological remains, and traces of great men and women, scattered all over the territory. Our trips are a way to discover and appreciate some of these precious jewels, including war and peace, art and literature, ancient crafts and herbal mastery itineraries. 


All details are already available on our site: http://theitaliandream-slowtravel.com


Here are just three, brief samples of our Italian Dreams...


Meeting the Senses



One week in the tiny medieval village of Piancaldoli, in the heart of Tuscany. We offer daily excursions, spaced out by our cooking classes, held by local, life-long experienced home-cooks, and  culminating with the yearly enogastronomic and artisan feast Meeting of the Senses. Under the lights of a starry sky, this itinerary will take you through the secret allies of the village in search of the authentic flavors of the regional tradition.

For the veg*ans, we also have a whole week dedicated to the vegetable world. Chasing, gathering, following and discovering all kind of plants and their miraculous properties. First, in The Garden of Herbs of Casola Valsenio, a unique museum where 450 species of herbs are cultivated, and where we can experience and learn the secrets of the millennial art of herbal medicine.

Then, guided by local and passionate experts, we can venture in the wild ourselves in search for spontaneous mushrooms and other edible  veg* goodies.

And finally, Signora Teresa’s fabulous cooking classes, where we can learn how to prepare delicious vegetarian Italian dishes.


Ancient Paths and Extraordinary Women



We start from the archeological site of Monte Bibele, a prehistorical village dating back to the 6th century B.C. Habitations, small streets, a sacred space dedicated to the Mother Goddess and 2 cemeteries are the remaining signs of a community able to peacefully merge both Celtic and Etruscans components, a touching example of ancient  tolerance and equality.

Then we follow the determination of our Roman predecessors, who paved their way towards the South of the Italian peninsula on  a 192 km long line, known as theFlaminia Minor. Some parts of this legendary route are still visible today, and we can literally walk on footsteps over two thousands years old.

The area has also bore witness to several internationally renown figures in the realm of womanhood. We start with Christine de Pizan, born in 1364, who owes her name to Pizzano, a small village on the Tosco-Emiliano Apennine. Christine was a prolific author, who left forty-one surviving poetic works and a number of prose books, most of which are also available in English. She was popular and respected in all Europe and left an influential footprint in the otherwise male-dominated literary field of the time.

Moving around in this territory, a few centuries later we find another woman who reached the peaks of popularity. Born in 1711, Laura Bassi was the first woman in Europe to earn a professorship in physics at the University of Bologna, in her hometown, and she became one of the most estimated scientist of 19th century. Despite the many challenges of the time, she used to travel by carriage along the Tuscan hills for her scientific experiments. Today, a 31 km crater on Venus honors her name.

Last but not least, is Sibilla Aleramo, worldwide known feminist and writer, whose passionate and adventurous life included romances with both men and women. One of her partners was the distinguished poet Dino Campana, born in 1885 inMarradi, a small Tuscan village on the Romagnolo Apennine. We retrace the path of this troubled and deep-felt love, that eventually led the poet to insanity.


War and Peace



During World War II the Italian Apennines have been the stage of the long lasting confrontation between the German army on one side, the American troops on the other, and the partisans in between. The famous Gothic Line crossed the Region from the East to the West coast, touching at some extent almost every town and village of these hills. We offer the opportunity of visiting the battle sites, listing to the survivors’ stories, understanding and honoring the sacrifice of the many who offered their lives for the freedom of others. In a country like Italy where history is one of the main components of most tourist packages, Slow Travel also means encouraging the remembrance and rediscovery of some of its forgotten heroes and heroines.

Our base-location is Palazzuolo sul Senio, on the hills of the Tuscan Apennines. Our itinerary touches the site of Ca’ Malanca, where, in October 1944, two battalions of the famous Garibaldi Brigade partisans confronted the German army in order to brake the Gothic Line and reach the English and Indian forces, a few kilometers away. Although many victims, after three days of  harsh battles, the partisan were finally able to unite with the Liberation Army. Today, on the place of the battle there is a museum, with a rich collection of documents, photographs and objects of the war. A walking excursion following the partisan trail, retraces some of the places of the fierce conflict between German soldiers and Italian rebels.

Another milestone of the tragic events of the Second World War in Italy, is Monte Battaglia (Battle Mount), the destiny of which seems linked to the battlefield since time immemorial: its name is derived from ancient crashes between barbarian clans during the 6th century A.D. However, it is again in September 1944 that the site became theatre of a ferocious battle where the American soldier and the partisans of Garibaldi Brigade confronted side by side against the Germans, and eventually defeated them. More then two thousand men died on that spot.


A must-go destination for our Remembrance Tour is the historical park of Monte Sole, where one of the worst massacres of World War II took place. Between September 29th and October 5th 1944, several SS military units executed almost one thousand civilians, mostly women, elder and children, living in 115 small villages and localities. Most of them have been, since then, abandoned. Monte Sole, with its striking and excruciating emptiness, surrounded by the mute beauty of the Emilian Apennines, has become a sacred pilgrimage to all who believe the importance of remembering the innocent victims of wars’ brutality.
Finally, we do not want to miss another marvel of our territory: the German Military Cemetery at the Futa Pass. Built in 1961 for a German project signed by the architect Dieter Oesterien, the cemetery occupies 12 hectares of land (almost 150.000 square yards), at the altitude of 950 mt. It accommodates the bodies of 30.683 german soldiers and officials. The contrast between the breath-taking view from the top of the hill and the impressive amounts of the graves, opens minds and hearts to the absurdity and the insanity of any war. So much that this remote cemetery and its quiet open-sky gardens have been chosen as stage for numerous Greek tragedy representations and itinerant theater.


Our first destinations



  • Piancaldoli, a tiny Medieval village, strategically located in the heart of Tuscany, at 600 mt of altitude. It is easy to reach and no more then two hours away from some of the most appealing sites of the Region. Remaining outside the radar of large tour operators and mass tourism routes, this little village has preserved the autenticity and mistery of lost ancient times. 
  • Palazzuolo sul Senio was one of the fief of the Florentine Republic, ruled by the Medici family. This little village sits at 400 mt of altitude along the Senio river banks, surrounded by the enchanting Tuscan Apennines. Preserving its unchanged ancient atmosphere, this village is close to many sites of historical and cultural appeal, this is why we have identified this area for our art, science, and literature itineraries.
  • Massa Marittima, a small Medieval town, right in the middle of suggestive Maremma, just half-an-hour away from the beautiful Tuscan coastline. From this key location, we have arranged vibrant itineraries, drifting from the beauty of the natural Maremman landscapes, to the most lively and exciting  spots of local LGBTQ life. This is why we have chosen Massa Marittima as our starting point for our Southern Tuscany itineraries.

What we have achieved so far:

  • Conception and planning
  • Market research
  • Establishing local partners
  • Website and social media
  • Studying alternative itineraries, based on historical and cultural interest



Through this campaign, you can help us:

  • Raising a baseline fund to cover our start-up costs (i.e. business registration costs, insurance, overheads expenses, SEO, etc.)
  • Improving the local economies of small and remote villages, risking otherwise to decline spirally
  • Keeping alive local traditions, recipes, and knowledge
  • Handing down the history, life, and values of forgotten man and women of Italian LGBTQ culture.  
  • Embodying a remembrance that sustains a future of peace and harmony among different people
  • Reaching out to potential Slow Travelers


All funds raised through this campaign will go to the planning and organizing of our first tour, scheduled for July 2015. 

If you cannot contribute financially, please help us spreading  the word or join us in one of our upcoming trips. Every contribution helps! You can easily share this campaign via e-mail, Facebook, Twitter, and Google+ using Indiegogo sharing tools.

We believe that the secret ingredient of life is passion, and we have plenty of passion when it comes to this project. This is not just an exciting way for us to make a creative idea come true - Slow Travel is also something we are deeply committed to. 


What if... 

At first we thought that a niche tour operating start-up such as The Italian Dream would face the risk of not meeting enough demand, especially when standing against the industry colossi. Nevertheless, our market research indicates a high interest in this alternative type of travel, and our trustworthy partnerships on the ground ensure quality and reliability of service in the long-run.

We plan to advertise our unique tours especially through alternative platforms, such as social media and slow-movement related events. We also intend to strengthen our search engine optimization, and avoid as much as possible both online and offline travel agencies. Nevertheless, we believed that the greatest strength of our promotion strategies lies in the word of mouth that will trigger once people will begin discovering what travel can also be all about.
story_txt:
Why Slow Travel?
We are two Italian women, mother and daughter, with a passion for traveling and a strong ethics for diversity. Being travelers ourselves, we have always privileged small and unknown destinations, unstepped routes, and out of season sceneries, far from the madding crowd. We like to feel and taste one remote location, rather than running through a dozen must-see places. 
Through our lives, we ended up researching the negative effects of mass tourism: the illusion of economic growth, which results in social oppression and the exploitation of local resources to the advantage of few corporate industries; the reciprocal stereotyping and false perceptions created between the nations involved; the trivialization of cultural and traditional values; and last but not least, global pollution.
Meanwhile we kept on traveling around the world in a different way, and we have found out how fulfilling and magic it can be. We call it Slow Travel. A new way of traveling, where time becomes the key to open the doors of a reality you have yet to explore. Easiness is the rhythm of your steps. You want to see less, but deeper. You search the authenticity of the culture you approach. You follow hundred-years old paths. Meet the people, taste their home food, learn their jokes. Sit at the kitchen table of a country grandma, who teaches you her cooking secrets. Join the village celebrations and feasts. Discover the small and hidden jewels of the surroundings, led by local guides who have spent their lifetimes there.
We want to stay away from the predictable routes of mainstream tour packages, to explore instead unusual destinations, unknown even to most Italians. We want to take you where time seems to have stopped centuries ago, wondering through uncontaminated villages and lands. We want to give you the chance to discover and love a still unspoiled nature. We want you to experience the difference between looking at a country through a window glass, and living it from the inside.
In other words, the difference between being a tourist and a traveler…
Our project naturally converges in the Slow Food movement, with which we share principles and values: sustainability and harmony with nature, a commitment the communities and the environment, and awareness of our global responsibility towards the rest of the planet. 




LGBTQ and Women-only

All are welcome to join our trips, which promote diversity of race, faith, sexuality, and gender expressions of all kinds. 
We are proud to offer LGBTQ itineraries, with the desire of sharing and encouraging the discovery of less known tales, places, and figures of Italian queer history and presence.
Partnerning uniquely with LGBTQ positive establishments, we have designed a one-of-a-kind itinerary in the heart of Tuscan Maremma. Following our Slow Travel mandate, we will stay out of big cities and common tourist destinations. We will instead explore ancient and remote villages, taste the superb eno-gastronomic gems of these areas, and learn about some of the untold stories that these lands conceal.


We are also happy to launch women-only tours, leading you through the small streets of tiny medieval towns and remote rural villages of the Tuscan Apennines. You may want to endeavor a culinary experience, tasting the true flavors of home-made Italian cuisine, and mastering its secrets. Or you may enjoy spotting row-deers in the early morning, visiting the lively weekly market of Tuscan villages, or gathering wild herbs and learning how to use them. You are welcome to find your womenly way to Italy….
Following the path of archaic/prehistoric female-based societies, and retracing the steps of historical female writers, poetesses, philosophers, mystics, and scientists, we are excited to lead you through a totally out-of-the-ordinary, time-travel experience. Join us and honor with us the lives and works of female talents sometimes underestimated even today, because of their gender. Discover the forgotten stories and unknown places that have shaped the lives of unique women, and marvel at the precious heritage that they have generously left us with. Sit in the presence of these ancient women’s everlasting mark, feel the power of their strength and determination, untangle the mysteries of their interwoven existences.
Whether you come with your daughters or sisters, friends or lovers, or whether you bring just yourself, this trip is open to women-only and to all who identify on the female spectrum.
The Italian Dream 
We intend to specialize in two types of Slow Travel: Culinary Experiences, and Cultural Trips. 
CULINARY EXPERIENCES - we offer you the unique opportunity to taste the real dishes of Italian cuisine, and to learn its secrets and delicacies attending our cooking classes, held by local, life-long experienced home-cooks. These sessions are space-out by daily walking excursions into the wild and yet unspoiled surrounding nature, and visits to enchanting little villages and and forgotten towns of the gorgeous Tuscan Apennines. We can also visit the nearby  Bordona Organic Cheese Factory, walk along its stables, see how cheese is made and enjoy a unique cheese tasting experience.



CULTURAL TRIPS - Italy is a country with a history thousands years-old, preserving an incredible abundance of rests of the past, archeological remains, and traces of great men and women, scattered all over the territory. Our trips are a way to discover and appreciate some of these precious jewels, including war and peace, art and literature, ancient crafts and herbal mastery itineraries. 

All details are already available on our site: http://theitaliandream-slowtravel.com


Here are just three, brief samples of our Italian Dreams...

Meeting the Senses







One week in the tiny medieval village of Piancaldoli, in the heart of Tuscany. We offer daily excursions, spaced out by our cooking classes, held by local, life-long experienced home-cooks, and  culminating with the yearly enogastronomic and artisan feast Meeting of the Senses. Under the lights of a starry sky, this itinerary will take you through the secret allies of the village in search of the authentic flavors of the regional tradition.

For the veg*ans, we also have a whole week dedicated to the vegetable world. Chasing, gathering, following and discovering all kind of plants and their miraculous properties. First, in The Garden of Herbs of Casola Valsenio, a unique museum where 450 species of herbs are cultivated, and where we can experience and learn the secrets of the millennial art of herbal medicine.
Then, guided by local and passionate experts, we can venture in the wild ourselves in search for spontaneous mushrooms and other edible  veg* goodies.
And finally, Signora Teresa’s fabulous cooking classes, where we can learn how to prepare delicious vegetarian Italian dishes.

Ancient Paths and Extraordinary Women






We start from the archeological site of Monte Bibele, a prehistorical village dating back to the 6th century B.C. Habitations, small streets, a sacred space dedicated to the Mother Goddess and 2 cemeteries are the remaining signs of a community able to peacefully merge both Celtic and Etruscans components, a touching example of ancient  tolerance and equality.

Then we follow the determination of our Roman predecessors, who paved their way towards the South of the Italian peninsula on  a 192 km long line, known as theFlaminia Minor. Some parts of this legendary route are still visible today, and we can literally walk on footsteps over two thousands years old.
The area has also bore witness to several internationally renown figures in the realm of womanhood. We start with Christine de Pizan, born in 1364, who owes her name to Pizzano, a small village on the Tosco-Emiliano Apennine. Christine was a prolific author, who left forty-one surviving poetic works and a number of prose books, most of which are also available in English. She was popular and respected in all Europe and left an influential footprint in the otherwise male-dominated literary field of the time.
Moving around in this territory, a few centuries later we find another woman who reached the peaks of popularity. Born in 1711, Laura Bassi was the first woman in Europe to earn a professorship in physics at the University of Bologna, in her hometown, and she became one of the most estimated scientist of 19th century. Despite the many challenges of the time, she used to travel by carriage along the Tuscan hills for her scientific experiments. Today, a 31 km crater on Venus honors her name.
Last but not least, is Sibilla Aleramo, worldwide known feminist and writer, whose passionate and adventurous life included romances with both men and women. One of her partners was the distinguished poet Dino Campana, born in 1885 inMarradi, a small Tuscan village on the Romagnolo Apennine. We retrace the path of this troubled and deep-felt love, that eventually led the poet to insanity.

War and Peace




During World War II the Italian Apennines have been the stage of the long lasting confrontation between the German army on one side, the American troops on the other, and the partisans in between. The famous Gothic Line crossed the Region from the East to the West coast, touching at some extent almost every town and village of these hills. We offer the opportunity of visiting the battle sites, listing to the survivors’ stories, understanding and honoring the sacrifice of the many who offered their lives for the freedom of others. In a country like Italy where history is one of the main components of most tourist packages, Slow Travel also means encouraging the remembrance and rediscovery of some of its forgotten heroes and heroines.


Our base-location is Palazzuolo sul Senio, on the hills of the Tuscan Apennines. Our itinerary touches the site of Ca’ Malanca, where, in October 1944, two battalions of the famous Garibaldi Brigade partisans confronted the German army in order to brake the Gothic Line and reach the English and Indian forces, a few kilometers away. Although many victims, after three days of  harsh battles, the partisan were finally able to unite with the Liberation Army. Today, on the place of the battle there is a museum, with a rich collection of documents, photographs and objects of the war. A walking excursion following the partisan trail, retraces some of the places of the fierce conflict between German soldiers and Italian rebels.
Another milestone of the tragic events of the Second World War in Italy, is Monte Battaglia (Battle Mount), the destiny of which seems linked to the battlefield since time immemorial: its name is derived from ancient crashes between barbarian clans during the 6th century A.D. However, it is again in September 1944 that the site became theatre of a ferocious battle where the American soldier and the partisans of Garibaldi Brigade confronted side by side against the Germans, and eventually defeated them. More then two thousand men died on that spot.



A must-go destination for our Remembrance Tour is the historical park of Monte Sole, where one of the worst massacres of World War II took place. Between September 29th and October 5th 1944, several SS military units executed almost one thousand civilians, mostly women, elder and children, living in 115 small villages and localities. Most of them have been, since then, abandoned. Monte Sole, with its striking and excruciating emptiness, surrounded by the mute beauty of the Emilian Apennines, has become a sacred pilgrimage to all who believe the importance of remembering the innocent victims of wars’ brutality.
Finally, we do not want to miss another marvel of our territory: the German Military Cemetery at the Futa Pass. Built in 1961 for a German project signed by the architect Dieter Oesterien, the cemetery occupies 12 hectares of land (almost 150.000 square yards), at the altitude of 950 mt. It accommodates the bodies of 30.683 german soldiers and officials. The contrast between the breath-taking view from the top of the hill and the impressive amounts of the graves, opens minds and hearts to the absurdity and the insanity of any war. So much that this remote cemetery and its quiet open-sky gardens have been chosen as stage for numerous Greek tragedy representations and itinerant theater.
Our first destinations

Piancaldoli, a tiny Medieval village, strategically located in the heart of Tuscany, at 600 mt of altitude. It is easy to reach and no more then two hours away from some of the most appealing sites of the Region. Remaining outside the radar of large tour operators and mass tourism routes, this little village has preserved the autenticity and mistery of lost ancient times. 

Palazzuolo sul Senio was one of the fief of the Florentine Republic, ruled by the Medici family. This little village sits at 400 mt of altitude along the Senio river banks, surrounded by the enchanting Tuscan Apennines. Preserving its unchanged ancient atmosphere, this village is close to many sites of historical and cultural appeal, this is why we have identified this area for our art, science, and literature itineraries.

Massa Marittima, a small Medieval town, right in the middle of suggestive Maremma, just half-an-hour away from the beautiful Tuscan coastline. From this key location, we have arranged vibrant itineraries, drifting from the beauty of the natural Maremman landscapes, to the most lively and exciting  spots of local LGBTQ life. This is why we have chosen Massa Marittima as our starting point for our Southern Tuscany itineraries.


What we have achieved so far:

Market research
Establishing local partners
Website and social media

Through this campaign, you can help us:


Raising a baseline fund to cover our start-up costs (i.e. business registration costs, insurance, overheads expenses, SEO, etc.)
Improving the local economies of small and remote villages, risking otherwise to decline spirally
Keeping alive local traditions, recipes, and knowledge
Handing down the history, life, and values of forgotten man and women of Italian LGBTQ culture.  
Embodying a remembrance that sustains a future of peace and harmony among different people

story:
Ignore the amount raised- It’s happening! Read ON!

Get in on it now before you're locked out!!

Who are we and why are we doing this?

Our names are CJ & Wendy Bromfield and before you is Puro coffee.  Why do we love it so much?  It tastes amazing and there isn’t a coffee that we’ve had that compares to it! 

We’ve done some pretty incredible things because of what we believe in.  We can start with why we both changed our last name to preserve the legacy of Louis Bromfield.  You can read about it here: http://goo.gl/1zkjrh

We discovered this coffee on a trip and said that it was the most incredible coffee that we’ve ever had.  It has that “something” that’s makes it the best.  That something is called Fairtrade and the flavor comes from the love that’s put into each hand-pick bean. 

Fairtrade means that workers get decent working conditions; farmers get a fair price for their beans which will never fall lower than the market price, and they don’t use forced labor.  It addresses the needs of the farmers and creates a greater economic and environmental sustainability. 

That sounds like a good thing right?  Absolutely!

Aren’t there other Fairtrade coffee companies out there that do this?  Yes, but…

What makes Puro any different than the rest? They’re the ONLY coffee company that gives a percentage of their sales to the World Land Trust to buy and protect at-risk areas of the rainforest. 

How many coffee companies can say that?  None!  To date, Puro has helped purchase and protect over 14,000 acres of rainforest.  In addition to this, they have started programs such as trees4schools, where they empower children by teaching them about planting trees, best agriculture practices and self-sustainability.  You can read about it here: www.trees4schools.org/about.aspx or watch a video here: https://vimeo.com/31084630

If you’re a British expat, frequent traveler to the UK, or well versed in fair-trade coffee you may have heard of Puro.  Below are some places where Puro’s been served:


What are these coffees that we’re going on about?


Fairtrade coffee is grown by small farmers or plantation workers, who are meticulous about their business and highly attentive to their crop. They have grown up with their forefathers teaching them the tricks and trades of the industry enabling them to become agricultural masters. They talk passionately about their beans, their way of life, and their families and their passion and care can be tasted in every cup of Puro.

Organic certification helps to ensure that coffee is grown in the way that nature intended. No artificial fertilizers or chemical agents, crop rotation and weeding by hand. It also encourages the composting of all waste to create organic means of adding nutrients back into the soil.

Shade Grown coffee encourages the preservation of trees native to the area or re-planting of trees that once stood on the land to provide this essential shade. This is great for biodiversity and helps enable growing coffee in harmony with the environment.

For more about their coffee, visit: www.purocoffee.com/us/our-coffee

Ok, back up a bit.  This is Indiegogo, so where’s the pitch? 

When we first had the coffee, we asked “Where can we find the coffee we had at breakfast?”  We were told that you could get it online.  Sounds simple, everything is online these days.  When we got home, we got home and saw this:

Not cool!

We wrote Miko, (the Belgian based company that has been roasting coffee since 1801), and asked what we needed to do to be a US distributor.  We’re shocked that someone didn’t do it first & we found out why pretty quick why it wasn’t done sooner.  Who wants to deal with the Department of Agriculture, Customs and Border Patrol protocols, import brokers and FDA food registered warehouses every time they want coffee?  We do!  Yes, the coffee is that great!

(Come on, where’s the pitch??)

After several weeks of communication between Puro and ourselves, they agreed that we could be their US Distributor... but we’d need to start in Ohio!  

Yes we can get the coffee!  Wait, what??

That’s right, we can begin distribution in Ohio, but we can’t be their only US distributor.  They want people out there reading this to be distributors in their state; therefore we are currently limited to sales in Ohio.  After this campaign is over, you’ll need to work with those agencies to get the coffee.

Before you click back on your browser, read this: They are allowing us to sell their coffee to anyone and everyone, regardless of where they live as part of this campaign!

Anyone, Anywhere!

Why should I contribute if you can’t sell me their coffee to me after this campaign?  Good question!

The majority of the perks in the campaign come with a built in discount of 20% off all future orders!   

Last time, where’s the pitch?

We understand that it’s difficult to take someone’s words about the coffee without actually trying it first.  Unless you’re familiar with the brand, you’d need to sample it first before buying it.  It’s a pretty tough sell.  You can take our word its awesome or you can go online and check out what bloggers have said about it.

To get the word out, we placed a small order and the picture at the top shows you what we ordered.  We know we needed to sample the coffee in order to really sell it.  We took the coffee to family events, private gatherings and at public events.  It went over well, especially at the fairtrade event at our church.  We took many names, email addresses and soon people started to pre-order and give us money to begin our journey.  We put that money aside and continued to talk about the coffee to the businesses that we would visit.  What happened next would change the course of our campaign.

As of 1/21/16, we have arrangements from at least 4 coffee shops to carry the coffee (and some who want to sell it in their coffee shop), a couple of restaurants, one Bed and Breakfast, and a winery.  The pre-orders, coupled with the amount that they have committed to is enough to make it happen!  

To fulfill the orders given to us, we placed an order for a larger delivery (see pictures below).  We even ordered T-shirts to wear when we go around to various businesses.

It’s going to happen, regardless of how much money it shows on Indiegogo!

This is a brand campaign and we are working to get the Fairtrade mission of Puro coffee to the US.  Once this campaign is over with on January 31, 2016, our sales will be limited to Ohio unless you contribute NOW!

You can order with confidence that we will deliver.  Some may think that because we didn’t reach our goal, this campaign will fail.  The opposite is true.  We received 64 bags of coffee and several of them are for pre-orders or orders that have been placed so far.  The rest are up for grabs.  The accounts that we have know that the coffee will arrive sometime in March, with an April delivery date.

Who wants some???

It’s getting expensive to have these shipments sent via air, so we will place a large order at the end of the campaign.  The more we order, the cheaper everything will be since we can save a lot on freight. 

Pitch – Here it is!!

We certainly have enough to give as part of the campaign, but we want everyone in the US to get it. 

The biggest takeaways from this:

1.  Free shipping on perks if you live in the US!

2.  You can get this coffee anywhere, anytime in the US if you place a contribution to our campaign!

3.  A contribution of $5 can get you a discount of 20% off all your orders, regardless of where you live! 

4.  You can also be like Johnny Appleseed, a local legend in Ohio and get more than you started with.  You get $1.50 for every $1.00 you contribute!  We’ll give you a special coupon code to use that will applied to our online store: www.getpropercoffee.com


Giving Back

Starting with this campaign and moving forward, we will donate 2% of our sales back to our community.  Whether it’s an urban garden or a sustainable, environmental initiative, we believe that a company has an obligation to give back the community.                                                                

More than a startup, it’s a chance to save the rainforests

We love the environment, we love the planet we live on, and we love coffee.  This is an opportunity for us to bring a product to the US that people enjoy every day.  Together we can save the rainforests one cup at a time.  

You’ll be the first people in the US to have it before anyone else!

Coffee Options

If you have selected a perk that includes your choice of a coffee blend, you can mention the blend when you make your contribution or we will mail you with your choices / options.  They are: Noble, Fuerte, Organic or Decaf (Note decaf is only available in the 250 gram size). 

Referal Incentive - Get Free Stuff !!!

We know that their coffee is amazing, so we understand that you'll want to keep this to yourself.  However, if you refer 5 people that contribute (to the perk you choose or higher) we'll give you that perk for free!  

How will you fulfill my referral rewards?

Once the campaign is over, Indiegogo will provide us with detailed information on how many perks and what level were purchased through your referrals.  We'll use that information to determine who gets refunded, who gets doubled or both! 

You can use a couple of ways to refer people to the campaign

1. Use the link provided in your purchase confirmation email.

2. Log in to your Indiegogo account and click on the "Link" icon to generate your own unique URL.

Tracking those referrals

Log into your Indiegogo account & click on “My Contributions” in the upper right corner.  On the “Referrals” tab you’ll see who contributed and how much they gave.

Select a perk, spread the word about Puro on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Linkedin… and see what happens! 

In the words of Del Boy from Only Fools and Horses, "He who dares, wins!" 

Show some love for Puro and get some love back!

FAQ

Who does the "20% off all future orders" apply to? - Everyone!  We will give you a unique discount code that will allow you to get 20% off all of your orders, regardless of where you live.  Shipping charges will still apply.

What if you don't get your goal? - We already have the money to begin importing coffee and other items from Puro.  The extra money will help us save on shipping and will result in more product going to your door.

What if my referrals contribute after the goal is reached? - You'll have until the end of the campaign for them to contribute.  For example, you chose the $25.00 perk and 3 of your referrals have donated $25.00 and higher.  The goal is reached and you're 2 people short.  You'll have until the end of the campaign to get 2 other people on board.

Claim a perk and get started now before its too late!

and self-sustainability.  You can read
about it here: www.trees4schools.org/about.aspx or watch a video here: https://vimeo.com/31084630
If you’re a British expat, frequent traveler
to the UK, or well versed in fair-trade coffee you may have heard of Puro.  Below are some places where Puro’s been
served:What are these coffees that we’re going on about?Fairtrade
coffee is grown by small farmers or plantation workers, who are meticulous
about their business and highly attentive to their crop. They have grown up
with their forefathers teaching them the tricks and trades of the industry
enabling them to become agricultural masters. They talk passionately about
their beans, their way of life, and their families and their passion and care
can be tasted in every cup of Puro.
Organic certification
helps to ensure that coffee is grown in the way that nature intended. No
artificial fertilizers or chemical agents, crop rotation and weeding by hand.
It also encourages the composting of all waste to create organic means of
adding nutrients back into the soil.
Shade Grown
coffee encourages the preservation of trees native to the area or re-planting
of trees that once stood on the land to provide this essential shade. This is
great for biodiversity and helps enable growing coffee in harmony with the
environment.For more about their coffee, visit: www.purocoffee.com/us/our-coffee
Ok, back up a bit.  This is Indiegogo, so where’s the pitch? 
When we first had the coffee, we
asked “Where can we find the coffee we had at breakfast?”  We were told that you could get it
online.  Sounds simple, everything is
online these days.  When we got home, we
got home and saw this:Not cool!
We wrote Miko, (the Belgian based company
that has been roasting coffee since 1801), and asked what we needed to do to be
a US distributor.  We’re shocked that
someone didn’t do it first & we found out why pretty quick why it wasn’t done
sooner.  Who wants to deal with the Department
of Agriculture, Customs and Border Patrol protocols, import brokers and FDA food
registered warehouses every time they want coffee?  We do! 
Yes, the coffee is that great!
(Come on, where’s the pitch??)
After several weeks of communication
between Puro and ourselves, they agreed that we could be their US Distributor... but we’d need to start in Ohio!  Yes we can get the coffee!  Wait, what??
That’s right, we can begin
distribution in Ohio, but we can’t be their only US distributor.  They
want people out there reading this to be distributors in their state; therefore we
are currently limited to sales in Ohio.  After
this campaign is over, you’ll need to work with those agencies to get the
coffee.
Before you click back on your
browser, read this: They are allowing us
to sell their coffee to anyone and everyone, regardless of where they live as
part of this campaign!
Anyone, Anywhere!
Why should I contribute if you can’t
sell me their coffee to me after this campaign? 
Good question!
The majority of the perks in the campaign
come with a built in discount of 20% off all future orders! 
 
Last time, where’s the pitch?
We understand that it’s difficult to
take someone’s words about the coffee without actually trying it first.  Unless you’re familiar with the brand, you’d
need to sample it first before buying it. 
It’s a pretty tough sell.  You can
take our word its awesome or you can go online and check out what bloggers have
said about it.
To get the word out, we placed a
small order and the picture at the top shows you what we
ordered.  We know we needed to sample the
coffee in order to really sell it.  We
took the coffee to family events, private gatherings and at public events.  It went over well, especially at the fairtrade
event at our church.  We took many names,
email addresses and soon people started to pre-order and give us money to begin our journey.  We put that money aside and continued to talk
about the coffee to the businesses that we would visit.  What happened next would change the course of
our campaign.
As of 1/21/16, we have arrangements
from at least 4 coffee shops to carry the coffee (and some who want to sell it in their coffee shop), a couple of restaurants, one Bed and Breakfast, and a winery.  The pre-orders, coupled with the amount that they have committed to is enough to make it happen!  
To fulfill the orders given to us, we placed an order for a larger delivery (see pictures below).  We even ordered T-shirts to wear when we go
around to various businesses.It’s going to happen, regardless of
how much money it shows on Indiegogo!
This is a brand campaign and we are
working to get the Fairtrade mission of Puro coffee to the US.  Once
this campaign is over with on January 31, 2016, our sales will be limited to
Ohio unless you contribute NOW!
You can order with confidence that
we will deliver.  Some may think that
because we didn’t reach our goal, this campaign will fail.  The opposite is true.  We received 64 bags of coffee and several of them are for pre-orders or orders that have been placed so far.  The rest are up for grabs.  The accounts that we have know that the
coffee will arrive sometime in March, with an April delivery date.
Who wants some???
It’s getting expensive to have these
shipments sent via air, so we will place a large order at the end of the
campaign.  The more we order, the cheaper
everything will be since we can save a lot on freight. 
Pitch – Here it is!!
We certainly have enough to give as
part of the campaign, but we want everyone in the US to get it.  
The biggest takeaways from this:
1. 
Free shipping on perks if you live
in the US!
2. 
You can get this coffee anywhere,
anytime in the US if you place a contribution to our campaign!
3. 
A contribution of $5 can get you a discount of 20% off all your orders, regardless of where
you live!  
4. 
You can also be like Johnny Appleseed,
a local legend in Ohio and get more than you started with.  You get $1.50 for every $1.00 you contribute!  We’ll give you a special coupon code to use
that will applied to our online store: www.getpropercoffee.com

Giving Back
Starting with this campaign and
moving forward, we will donate 2% of our sales back to our community.  Whether it’s an urban garden or a sustainable,
environmental initiative, we believe that a company has an obligation to give back the
community.                  
                     
                     
 
More than a startup, it’s a chance
to save the rainforests
We love the environment, we love the
planet we live on, and we love coffee.  This is an opportunity for us to
bring a product to the US that people enjoy every day.  Together we can
save the rainforests one cup at a time.  
You’ll be the first people in the US to have it before anyone else!
Coffee Options
If you have selected a perk that
includes your choice of a coffee blend, you can mention the blend when you make
your contribution or we will mail you with your choices / options.  They
are: Noble, Fuerte, Organic or Decaf (Note decaf is only available in the 250 gram
size). 
Referal Incentive - Get Free Stuff
!!!
We know that their coffee is
amazing, so we understand that you'll want to keep this to yourself. 
However, if you refer 5 people that contribute (to the perk you choose or
higher) we'll give you that perk for free!  
How will you fulfill my referral
rewards?
Once the campaign is over, Indiegogo
will provide us with detailed information on how many perks and what level were
purchased through your referrals.  We'll use that information to determine
who gets refunded, who gets doubled or both! 
You can use a couple of ways to
refer people to the campaign
1. Use the link provided in your
purchase confirmation email.
2. Log in to your Indiegogo account
and click on the "Link" icon to generate your own unique URL.
Tracking those referrals
Log into your Indiegogo account
& click on “My Contributions” in the upper right corner.  On the
“Referrals” tab you’ll see who contributed and how much they gave.
Select a perk, spread the word about
Puro on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Linkedin… and see what happens!  
In the words of Del Boy from Only
Fools and Horses, "He who dares, wins!" 
Show some love for
Puro and get some love back!
FAQ
Who does the "20% off all
future orders" apply to? -
Everyone!  We will give you a unique discount code that will allow you to
get 20% off all of your orders, regardless of where you live.  Shipping
charges will still apply.
What if you don't get your goal? - We already have the money to begin importing coffee
and other items from Puro.  The extra
money will help us save on shipping and will result in more product going to
your door.
What if my referrals contribute
after the goal is reached? -
You'll have until the end of the campaign for them to contribute.  For
example, you chose the $25.00 perk and 3 of your referrals have donated $25.00
and higher.  The goal is reached and you're 2 people short.  You'll
have until the end of the campaign to get 2 other people on board.Claim a perk and get started now before its too late!

story:
How it Came to be

After the recent negative attention at Waking Life Espresso, Sarah Winkler, a two and half year employee, found herself leaving a job and many customers she loved.  Unwilling to compromise her morals and accept a severance, Sarah instead has decided to turn this into a positive for herself, her customers, and the community. With the collaborative efforts of two like minded friends, Trade and Lore  Asheville  was founded! 


Along Came Lindsey!

Sarah went to visit Lindsey Pitman of The Daily Press CLT and while sitting down over coffee an idea was formed. Within minutes it had been decided, there was no better way to show gratitude to the community that has surrounded Sarah with support than to open a specialty coffee shop with a focus on empowerment, equality, and an initiative for advocacy.


What we'll do

Though unfortunate, this situation has given the community the opportunity to express its commitment to inclusiveness, equality, and awareness.  Continuing that commitment, Trade and Lore Coffee will provide the same high quality coffee product while also supporting those ideals. We intend to work closely with like-minded local non-profits and businesses, to provide a fair living wage for staff, to source our ingredients locally - using Mountain Air Roasting coffee, local bakers, and purveyors.


Why your support is crucial

In order to get our doors open, we'll will need to need to finish the upfit, purchase equipment locally, prepare the storefront, and hire and train additional staff. We've already secured a majority of our $65,000 budget from local lenders and working second jobs, That leaves $15,000 we are hoping to fund from the community.

We will be posting our progress along the way.  Though there may be bumps in the road, we are committed to this idea and the community it will create.


Other ways you can help

Funds raised in this campaign are crucial, but there's are many ways you can help! Like us on facebook and share this campaign!  Email us directly at tradeandlore@gmail.com with any resources, advice, or supportive words you might have.


Huge Thank You and we look forward to serving you soon!

Sarah, Lindsey, and Brock

story:
Founded in 2008, Queer Burners is to create venues, events and forums to network LGBTQ++ camps and groups with queer Burning Man culture (10 Principles). By working together, we can make our collective burn experiences profound and uniquely meaningful.

  • to create a leadership network allowing members of the community to support and communicate each other; strengthen projects and share resources.
  • to create community programs that that give back and help build enterprise concepts for bettering our world. To x-post, support, network existing programs supporting great ideas already out there.
  • to be the flying buttress when needed and be the extra arms when called upon. To help in lifting projects up when they need and gently help let go when the time is right, but never losing hope by finding support from each other physically or through cheer.
We have taken on projects that range in supporting new projects in the community and starting ones with huge implications. 
  • 2012 to 2015 Queer Burner Leadership summits annually - avg 40 people
  • 2014 paused to 2016 Safe Place for resources for people in distress
  • 2015 to 2016 retreat events - 2015: 90 people & 2016: 150 people
The campaign is to recapture a small amount of $1000 lost in the production of the last Queer Burner Retreat. We collected $15,000 but some unforeseen expenses camp up. 
We need to complete steps into creating a legal entity for the project because with money coming in it needs to go to administrative charges for the legal costs and taxes for a California based corporate entity for 2016. The anticipated expenses of that is less than $1,500.

We will be running a couple fund raisers over the next 6 months to bring in finances for those expenses as well as getting ready for the 2017 Queer Burner Retreat: it will focus on fostering the creation of art in the community. 
To see some of the people on a dynamic list of leadership participants in the Queer Burners Leadership Network check out:
http://queerburners.com/quire-qbln/the-hive-mind-of-queer-burners

Queer Burner Leadership Network on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/240956916002164/
Queer Burners public facing Page:
https://www.facebook.com/gayburners/
Queer Burners public discussion Group:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/250295325089174/
We have regional Queer Burners pages for: Australia, New York City, Atlanta, Southern California, San Francisco and Las Vegas with more to come. 
To see some of our recent video based meetings saved on YouTube:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLnAoxrDCrQDfliec9WBBVr5i59JtLutIJ
