story:
Help us to make traveling easier and cheaper!

WHO WE ARE? We are a group of young people from Bosnia and Herzegovina who are involved in some NGO's in Sarajevo, and who wants to make traveling much easier and much cheaper for students from our country so that they get the same possibility to travel and see the world like their friends from other parts in Europe. We also are enthusiastic believers in the WORK AND TRAVEL program, and we also intend to help young people to earn money while traveling.

WHY ARE WE DO THAT? In the last 25 years our country went through heavy times. In the beginning of the nineties a huge war broke out, and most of the country’s economy broke down. People lose their jobs and later even life’s. Most of today's students were born at the time and didn't have the possibility to grow up as their friends in the rest of Europe. About 80% of the young people in Bosnia and Herzegovina didn't travel abroad or more than 200 kilometers from their home. We want to give same opportunities and we want to help young people to travel Europe and the World as cheap and easy as possible.

HOW DO WE DO THAT? By organizing bigger groups we intend to lower the price as low as possible, and to give the best service for a fair price. Our guideline is clear! We believe that no trip inside Europe need to be more than 199€ (240US$) and this idea will help us to create new products and give more possibilities to our client’s so that they will also be part of our whole planning process.

WHAT IS OUR VISION? Our vision is to start small and grow step by step, so that every year we will have at least 3000 costumers that will participate in our trips and learn the culture of Europe. We also plan to rise the number of young people participate in the Work and Travel program in USA, Australia, Canada and New Zealand. Our goal is that 500 young people from Bosnia and Herzegovina, Serbia and Montenegro use the possibility and travel in this far locations to work, learn and travel.

WHERE WE WILL SPEND THE MONEY THAT WE WILL RAISE? The money that we will raise we will initial use to register our company as an Ltd. And to pay initial costs of starting the company (Rentals, equipment, renovation etc.). We also plan to use 30% of the money for marketing costs, so that our company and our products get visibility and that our popularity can grow.

WHAT ARE WE OFFER YOU? If you support our aim, we will use the possibility to thank you in a special way! We will have a WALL OF SUPPOERTERS’ in our agency where everyone who will donate more than 5 USD get its picture and its name there. Every of our future customers will know who supported this idea and helped us start business! Everyone who donate more than 10 USD will additionally to the wall of supporters also get a personalized postcard from Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina. Everyone who gives more than 50 USD will also additionally get from us a personalized gift package with different local products (jewelry, souvenirs, magnet’s, book’s etc.). Everyone who donate 100 USD or more will get a special gift package with TRADITIONAL HAND MADE and UNIQUE art pieces from Sarajevo. Please while donating indicate your e-mail to: travello.agency@gmail.com and the reference.

THANK YOU for reading this post and we hope that you will decide to help us starting Ur own business and help other people to see the world.

story:
I'm a 26-year-old travel coordinator from Kathmandu, Nepal, who was lucky enough to survive the earthquake with family and home intact. Others were not so lucky. I'm working to provide immediate relief to the many people in Kathmandu who are currently without food and shelter by handing out food, water, and blankets in Dharmasthali, Kathmandu, where many have been displaced. Government aid has been very, very slow to arrive and it's so hard to see my people like this -- hungry and living outside out of fear or because they have nowhere else to go. Larger organizations are helping as well, but they can only do so much and there are thousands of people who still need help. In the meantime, Nepalis have to work together to help each other.

I'd like to do my part in providing immediate assistance through food, water, and blankets. If you'd like to help me in this effort, please consider donating. All funds from this page will go directly to these efforts, and I will update with photos and information along the way. 

I've set the goal for this campaign to be $1000 and ten days, so I can use funds as soon as possible. Anything raised above that will be used for the same purpose 

Thank you!
Rijen Shahi

story:
Butterfly Transition House


This world is not an easy place to live in when you identify as a transgender or transsexual individual. Though the media is making the public more aware and acceptance is more socially prevalent, there is still bias in this world, and general society just doesn’t know how to interact with someone who is transitioning from one gender identity to another. Butterfly Transition House aims to create a place where that difficulty does not exist. The Butterfly Transition House is a location where a transgender or transsexual individual is offered the opportunity to enjoy their transition, from the beginning of their experience to a point where they can be comfortable in public, by providing transition assistance and a comfortable living atmosphere. There are many aspects that would make Butterfly Transition House the optimal place to begin or continue your transition from a male identity to a female identity, ranging from an educated staff to a comfortable living quarters, with life lessons and leisure time in-between.

As a transgender or transsexual individual, you begin life with a gender assigned at birth, but through life experience you come to realize that the gender you were assigned does not align with who you truly are as a person. Many transgender or transsexual individuals go through life adhering to gender roles that pertain to the gender that they have been assigned, and miss out on a lot of the learning experiences that someone of the opposite gender experience through their lives. For example, though a boy may grow long hair through their life to more closely identify with their feminine side, many of them don’t know anything about feminine hairstyles or how to maintain them. This would be one of the many things that a client of Butterfly Transition House would be able to learn about, to ease their transition, and bring them closer to womanhood.

A key feature of this house would be the clientele themselves. Some people may suggest that you spend time with and familiarize yourself with people that are the gender you identify with, but it isn’t really that simple. Even if someone of that gender is open minded, they will never go through many of the experiences a transgender or transsexual individual goes through. Thus it is hard to share your struggles as a transgender or transsexual individual with someone that isn’t transgender or transsexual, simply because they can’t relate, which is understandable.Only approximately one in ten thousand people identify as transgender or transsexual. Because everyone in the house would be going through a similar experience, they would be able to bond, and build new life experiences and friendships that could last a lifetime. Getting so many like minded people in one place could really build a great support system, on top of that which would be offered by the house itself.

Butterfly Transition House is a place where someone could not only begin their physical transition, but their life transition. The house offers education in cooking, fashion, cosmetics, and other aspects of ladyhood. There is likely be 1 to 2 staff members dedicated specifically to these subjects. There is at least one optional group offered in one subject per day. The house isn’t all work and no fun, however. There are various ways to spend the days in leisure, ranging from playing video games, to watching tv or movies, to playing various sports, to lounging by or in the swimming pool. Each client also learns about being independent. The living situation is set up so that there are two clients to each room, that they are responsible for maintaining. Each room is checked twice a week to make sure it is being well kept. Each room also offers amenities ranging from a full length vanity mirror for hair, makeup, and choosing outfits, to a cable ready tv that the clients can share. Though they are able to do their own grocery shopping, each client is responsible for preparing their own food, or sharing food with other clients. This is another aspect that helps build independence. Each client is also responsible for cleaning their own clothing, and there is the shared duty of washing the dishes and trash duty.

Transitioning genders is not an easy thing to do in this world on your own, or even with a support system, as that support system might not have the necessary facilities to accommodate this period in someone’s life to make it as comfortable as possible. Because the transgender or transsexual population is gaining more exposure through the media, there are not only more people aware of transgender or transsexual individuals, but more individuals that identify as transgender or transsexual themselves, looking for answers about how to begin their transition. There is a niche market available with a growing clientele due to this fact. Butterfly Transition House fills this position, and is a project that establishes itself at the ground floor of what is sure to be an ever expanding industry.

What We Need

Setup


  The main facility for this venture will be the house itself. I am most interested in acquiring a motel or apartment complex that has a pool and room for social interaction. The city we will be located in depends on pricing of premises we are interested in and how liberal the city itself is. Does the city have an active and accepting lgbt population? I am also interested in the social life of the city. Are there places where the girls can go out once they feel comfortable? We should also look for a location that is in close approximation to somewhere that the girls can get essentials like food; ideally in reasonable walking distance, though we should offer transportation at times and for specific circumstances.

  The management systems shouldn’t be too difficult or complex. A pc on location with an external hard drive for information backup should suffice. The house manager should be able to do simple maintenance on the web page and basic record keeping. All financial matters should be handled by a financial manager.

  We will also need to set up relations with professionals in the medical fields, those being specifically a therapist and endocrinologist. If insurance covers certain aspects, we may also be able to have a house therapist on staff. I do not know much about how much medical insurance will cover and for what, but if we move forward, we can do more research into this area. It may prove to be a large part of how housing expenses can be covered, in a manor similar to those that are in intensive outpatient treatment at halfway houses.

Initial Investments

  Property- Motel Property -        between $375,000 and $750,000

  Renovations-   between $10,000 and $20,000 (depending on status of property)

Electronics- TV’s, Computers, Internet, Cable, Phone -     $8,500  

  Furniture- Couches, Dressers, Beds, Furnishings, etc -     $10,000

  Webpage Design-               $1,500

  Marketing and Advertising- Google AdWords and Community Interaction  $1,000

Personnel first paychecks-

Manager -            $2,800

Finance Manager -           $6,000

Educator -               $300

Utilities-                   $400

  Insurance-                  $1,000


Estimated Total =             between $420,800 and $795,800

If we don't meet our goal or raise enough to open a facility, a large portion of the money would be donated to charities and individuals who are in need of funding for transition.

    What Qualifies Me?

    I am a transgender woman who has not been able to begin transition myself for multiple reasons. One of the main reasons is that I haven't had a place where I could feel comfortable beginning this life changing adventure. I know what someone in my position would like to have available, and I plan to provide that.


    Thank you for taking the time to read this, and feel free to contact me with any questions, concerns, or support. If you do contribute, thank you.


    I can be contacted at butterflytransitionhouse@gmail.com
story_txt:
Butterfly Transition House
This world is not an easy place to live in when you identify as a transgender or transsexual individual. Though the media is making the public more aware and acceptance is more socially prevalent, there is still bias in this world, and general society just doesn’t know how to interact with someone who is transitioning from one gender identity to another. Butterfly Transition House aims to create a place where that difficulty does not exist. The Butterfly Transition House is a location where a transgender or transsexual individual is offered the opportunity to enjoy their transition, from the beginning of their experience to a point where they can be comfortable in public, by providing transition assistance and a comfortable living atmosphere. There are many aspects that would make Butterfly Transition House the optimal place to begin or continue your transition from a male identity to a female identity, ranging from an educated staff to a comfortable living quarters, with life lessons and leisure time in-between. 
As a transgender or transsexual individual, you begin life with a gender assigned at birth, but through life experience you come to realize that the gender you were assigned does not align with who you truly are as a person. Many transgender or transsexual individuals go through life adhering to gender roles that pertain to the gender that they have been assigned, and miss out on a lot of the learning experiences that someone of the opposite gender experience through their lives. For example, though a boy may grow long hair through their life to more closely identify with their feminine side, many of them don’t know anything about feminine hairstyles or how to maintain them. This would be one of the many things that a client of Butterfly Transition House would be able to learn about, to ease their transition, and bring them closer to womanhood. 
A key feature of this house would be the clientele themselves. Some people may suggest that you spend time with and familiarize yourself with people that are the gender you identify with, but it isn’t really that simple. Even if someone of that gender is open minded, they will never go through many of the experiences a transgender or transsexual individual goes through. Thus it is hard to share your struggles as a transgender or transsexual individual with someone that isn’t transgender or transsexual, simply because they can’t relate, which is understandable.Only approximately one in ten thousand people identify as transgender or transsexual. Because everyone in the house would be going through a similar experience, they would be able to bond, and build new life experiences and friendships that could last a lifetime. Getting so many like minded people in one place could really build a great support system, on top of that which would be offered by the house itself.
Butterfly Transition House is a place where someone could not only begin their physical transition, but their life transition. The house offers education in cooking, fashion, cosmetics, and other aspects of ladyhood. There is likely be 1 to 2 staff members dedicated specifically to these subjects. There is at least one optional group offered in one subject per day. The house isn’t all work and no fun, however. There are various ways to spend the days in leisure, ranging from playing video games, to watching tv or movies, to playing various sports, to lounging by or in the swimming pool. Each client also learns about being independent. The living situation is set up so that there are two clients to each room, that they are responsible for maintaining. Each room is checked twice a week to make sure it is being well kept. Each room also offers amenities ranging from a full length vanity mirror for hair, makeup, and choosing outfits, to a cable ready tv that the clients can share. Though they are able to do their own grocery shopping, each client is responsible for preparing their own food, or sharing food with other clients. This is another aspect that helps build independence. Each client is also responsible for cleaning their own clothing, and there is the shared duty of washing the dishes and trash duty. 
Transitioning genders is not an easy thing to do in this world on your own, or even with a support system, as that support system might not have the necessary facilities to accommodate this period in someone’s life to make it as comfortable as possible. Because the transgender or transsexual population is gaining more exposure through the media, there are not only more people aware of transgender or transsexual individuals, but more individuals that identify as transgender or transsexual themselves, looking for answers about how to begin their transition. There is a niche market available with a growing clientele due to this fact. Butterfly Transition House fills this position, and is a project that establishes itself at the ground floor of what is sure to be an ever expanding industry. 
   What We Need

Setup
  The main facility for this venture will be the house itself. I am most interested in acquiring a motel or apartment complex that has a pool and room for social interaction. The city we will be located in depends on pricing of premises we are interested in and how liberal the city itself is. Does the city have an active and accepting lgbt population? I am also interested in the social life of the city. Are there places where the girls can go out once they feel comfortable? We should also look for a location that is in close approximation to somewhere that the girls can get essentials like food; ideally in reasonable walking distance, though we should offer transportation at times and for specific circumstances. 
  The management systems shouldn’t be too difficult or complex. A pc on location with an external hard drive for information backup should suffice. The house manager should be able to do simple maintenance on the web page and basic record keeping. All financial matters should be handled by a financial manager.  We will also need to set up relations with professionals in the medical fields, those being specifically a therapist and endocrinologist. If insurance covers certain aspects, we may also be able to have a house therapist on staff. I do not know much about how much medical insurance will cover and for what, but if we move forward, we can do more research into this area. It may prove to be a large part of how housing expenses can be covered, in a manor similar to those that are in intensive outpatient treatment at halfway houses. 
Initial Investments
  Property- Motel Property -         between $375,000 and $750,000
  Renovations-   between $10,000 and $20,000 (depending on status of property)
Electronics- TV’s, Computers, Internet, Cable, Phone -      $8,500  
  Furniture- Couches, Dressers, Beds, Furnishings, etc -      $10,000
  Webpage Design-                $1,500
  Marketing and Advertising- Google AdWords and Community Interaction  $1,000
Personnel first paychecks- 
Manager -             $2,800
Finance Manager -            $6,000
Educator -                 $300 
Utilities-                    $400
  Insurance-                   $1,000
Estimated Total =              between $420,800 and $795,800If we don't meet our goal or raise enough to open a facility, a large portion of the money would be donated to charities and individuals who are in need of funding for transition.   What Qualifies Me?
I am a transgender woman who has not been able to begin transition myself for multiple reasons. One of the main reasons is that I haven't had a place where I could feel comfortable beginning this life changing adventure. I know what someone in my position would like to have available, and I plan to provide that.

Thank you for taking the time to read this, and feel free to contact me with any questions, concerns, or support. If you do contribute, thank you.

I can be contacted at butterflytransitionhouse@gmail.com

story:
OUR STORY: 

Let's face it, unless you're a frat boy, you probably like to enjoy your beer and like most normal people, you like your beer ice-cold. We have set out to make sure that nobody ever has to endure another drop of warm beer in their lifetime with the creation of the KRYO° HOPSULATOR™. This is just the beginning of our product line and you can help support our start in the high-tech drinkware industry by contributing to this very campaign - be a part of something big!

Note: No, we don't have a gimmicky video showing you how fantastic your life would be with our product (although your quality of life will be drastically improved) - the cost alone would be close to what we are trying to raise and if we had that money we wouldn't be releasing this campaign in the first place. What we do have is a fantastic team of talented individuals that will make sure you not only get an awesome product but that you get it on time. Thank you for your support and being part of the KRYO° Movement. 


WHAT IS THE KRYO° HOPSULATOR™?

Great question! The HOPSULATOR™ is a 16oz, stainless-steel, double wall, vacuum-insulated, can-insulator. Don't know what any of that means? Let me explain. 

The stainless steel inner wall prevents heat transfer by radiation. In our can-insulator, there is a small space between the inner stainless wall and the outer stainless wall that is vacuum sealed with a bottom piece that is attached inside a vacuum chamber. The goal is to get the vacuum-chamber as empty as possible - without atoms, conduction and convection cannot take place. This vacuum prevents heat transfer from the outside-in and vice-versa by convection, this means there will be zero condensation and almost no temperature change to the outer wall of the stainless making it easy to carry ice-cold drinks. 




BENEFITS OF THE HOPSULATOR™: 

  • It's Awesome: It's awesome, it will make you look awesome, your friends will envy you, your significant other will never leave your side, world domination will be just a blink away..... (these may be slightly exaggerated, but our HOPSULATOR™ is totally awesome). 
  • Vacuum-Insulation: Keeps your beverage cold for up to 4 hours on a 90 degree day. 
  • Universal: Fits almost all 16oz cans. This includes almost all 16oz craft-beer cans, 16oz beer cans, 16oz energy drink cans, and 16oz soda cans. 
  • Durable: Built with kitchen grade, 18 gauge stainless steel and powder coated to prevent the outside from scratching from daily use. 
  • Sleek: Our product was designed with you in mind. You will be the envy of all your friends when showing off your new HOPSULATOR™.
  • Lifetime-Warranty: We stand behind our products. If for any reason your product is defective (from natural causes) we will replace it. This does not mean that if you and your frat bros try to play cricket with our products that we will be forgiving (although that would be cool to witness). 

WILL THIS FIT MY FAVORITE DRINK? 

Almost all 16oz cans use the same generic dimensions worldwide. We created a list below of the cans that we know it will fit. If you don't see your favorite drink on here, don't assume it doesn't fit, it just means we haven't tested it. Even if it doesn't fit your favorite drink, you can regift it to someone that will use it and automatically gain a lifetime supply of brownie-points. 

FITS (Alphabetical Order): 

  • All 16 oz craft beer cans
  • Almost all 16oz Energy Drinks (Monster Energy)
  • Belhaven 16 oz cans
  • Bud Light 16 oz cans
  • Bud Light Lime-a-rita/Straw-Ber-Rita/Man-Go-Rita/Lemon-Ade-Rita 16 oz cans
  • Budweiser 16 oz cans
  • Busch 16 oz cans
  • Coors Light 16 oz cans
  • Dos Equis 16 oz cans
  • Guinness 16 oz cans
  • Icehouse 16 oz cans
  • King Cobra 16 oz cans
  • Labatt 16 oz cans
  • Michelob Ultra 16 oz cans
  • Miller Light 16 oz cans
  • Murphy's 16 oz cans
  • Natty 16 oz cans
  • PBR 16 oz cans
  • Red Stripe 16 oz cans
  • Redd's Apple 16 oz cans
  • Schofferhoffer 16 oz cans
  • Shock Top 16 oz cans
  • Steel Reserve 16 oz cans
  • Stella Artois 16 oz cans
  • Stiegl 16 oz cans
  • StrongBow 16 oz cans
  • Warsteiner 16 oz cans
  • Youngs 16 oz cans

DOESN'T FIT: 

  • Heineken 16 oz cans

WHAT DO WE NEED THE MONEY FOR? 

We already have our design finished as well as our mould. We need your help in order to reach the production phase, which will only take 4 weeks from the time this campaign ends. You will not be waiting for years to get your products, we have already successfully launched other items and this will be no different. 

RELEASE TIMELINE: 


RISKS AND CHALLENGES: 

There are almost always delays in projects, usually in the original design stages. We are past that stage and we are using the same technology in other products that we carry so we are certain that our product will be produced without hiccups. We are very familiar with the design and manufacturing process that is required to create a product of this nature and we have long-standing relationships with our factories and are confident they will pull-through on time and without any issues.

story:
Short Summary

Pondaseta Brewing Co. consists of brewers and owners Kaleb West and Trever Martin. About 10 years ago we each started exploring homebrewing and the craft beer scene. After much learning, many mistakes and a lot of "taste testing", this hobby soon became a passion. After living away from the Texas Panhandle for the past 13 years, we decided to come home to Canyon, Texas and make our brewery dreams come true. We have been planning and working hard to perfect our recipes for the past year and can't wait to bring our beer to the Texas Panhandle!

Our goal with this campaign is to raise funds to help pay for a beer canning line. Having this equipment will allow us to can and package our beers in-house. We are confident this will increase our distribution to craft beer lovers and help our brewery make a statement in Amarillo's growing craft beer scene. 

Our contributors will help us achieve the ability to build our brand further than we could by only selling pours in our taproom. Having our canned beer available "to-go" at our brewery will broaden and strengthen our clientele and spread the Pondaseta name across the region. And when we're ready to distribute to package stores, restaurants, and convenience stores, the in-house canning line will make that a possible. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • With this campaign we are set to raise $20,000. This will give us the funds to order the "Yampa Canning Line" from Twin Monkeys, a company located in Aurora, Colorado. This line will allow us to package around 18 cans per minute with one operator.                 
  • We think you will love our perks! We will offer unique can pint glasses, t-shirts, hoodies, and caps with our Pondaseta logo. These items will be exclusive to this campaign and not sold in the brewery. Other awesome perks include personalized brewers shirts with your name, brewing in-house with us, and even naming our stainless tanks where all the brewery visitors can see! We will also display the names of all contributors in the brewery.  
  • All contributors will be invited to a special "Sneak Peak" at the brewery prior to opening.
  • Some Perks include a small shipping charge. We're happy to send your items anywhere in the U.S. If you would rather pick your items up from us in Amarillo, we'll include a free growler fill token in place of the shipping.
  • We need YOU to help us reach our goal. But just in case we don't, that's OK. We will apply the funds we do raise towards the canning line and go ahead and order that bad boy!

 

The Impact

Canning beer is not a new concept and is definitely becoming the preferred method of packaging in the craft beer community. In cans, beer stays fresher longer by protecting the beer from light, is easier to transport commercially and distribute, and the aluminum is nearly infinitely recyclable. Many parks and recreation areas do not allow glass containers, so with craft beer in cans you can take it nearly anywhere. Wouldn't it be awesome to take some Pondaseta Premium to the lake, or a sixer of I-40 IPA camping? We think so!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are very excited for everyone to be a part of our brewery and this campaign. We could not be successful without you. We know not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. Spread the word about Pondaseta to your family, friends, and everyone you can. Share the Indiegogo link, on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and anyway you can. Good news travels fast!

story:
PLEASE NOTE: We have changed our target figure to £5000.
SUMMARY
Proper Job is a community run, not for profit, recycling centre based in Chagford, Devon. They need to raise 5k for a purpose built vehicle with a customised logo. This new van is necessary to enable them to carry on providing a service through out rural Devon, as their old van has to be recycled itself! This important service keeps large items of household waste away from the landfill.  It will also be used to deliver home made organic compost and has the potential to be used by local people as a community vehicle.

At Proper Job, recyclable items are broken down to their component parts and recycled separately. Reusable items are given a second lease of life - they are kept away from landfill by being offered for sale in an Aladdin’s cave of pre-loved treasures at a fraction of their original cost. Our customers not only save money, they help save the environment!  Without a new van, a lot of these easily reusable or recyclable items could end up in landfill.  With a new van, Proper Job would aim to double the collections they are currently able to do.  There is a growing network of community driven projects, some just composting, some just doing reuse, others involved in growing and selling local produce and many more, but there are none quite like Proper Job.  In fact, for many organisations, Proper Job stands as a beacon to show how it can be done.

It all started in Chagford in 1993 when a group of allotment holders launched a community composting project.  They wanted to recycle green waste and create a local recycling facility for other items.  All were committed to principles of recycling and environmental sustainability. The rural skip service was being filled up with many reusable/recyclable and compostable items and the nearest recycling centre was 15 miles away. The group started their activities around these skips that came to the village each month by taking out or diverting all the green waste. 

Proper Job Limited was set up in 1995, describing itself as “a community business committed to principles of sustainability and helping to create jobs”.   This was included in a broader development plan, which encompassed a holistic vision embracing the concept of healthy community achieved through the principles of community involvement and participation, with recycling as a central feature. 

WHAT THEY NEED

They need 5k to buy a second  hand  modified vehicle with a customised logo.  A second hand Nissan Cabstar will cost just over £3000 and with modifications including a box and tail lift it will cost just over £5000    

A box conversion is necessary so that when deliveries and cardboard are transported, they don't get wet and damaged, and a tail lift is essential for transporting heavy goods such as Rayburns.

Proper Job relies on people using their recycling services and shopping at the resource centre for most of its income.  With a sign-written van, the good work they do would be far more visible to the wider community.

PERKS

There are some great rewards on offer in return for donating money to Proper Job, including Vouchers, Artisan Bread Making Courses, Compost Making Workshops, Cheese Making Tuition and much more still to come! 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

With any form of crowd funding, there is always the risk that the target won't be achieved.  Over the years, the amount of money available to support recycling organisations such as ours has got smaller and smaller and so Proper Job has become adept at fundraising for small amounts here and there.  However, the current van won't last more than a few months so the money for a replacement is needed now.  

THE IMPACT

In such a rural area, many people rely on Proper Job because council run facilities are over 15 miles away. We are also a source of great value, second hand clothes, furniture, bric a brac, etc.  Proper Job is part of a growing network of community driven projects. Taken globally these grassroots community projects make up the largest movement in the world working for positive change and Proper Job is a small beacon of hope against the giant multinationals of the planet. It is vital that projects like Proper Job are kept alive and that we are all conscious about how much of our waste is ending up in landfill. 

In 2013 we successfully stopped over 100 tonnes of waste from ending up in landfill, not to mention the enormous amount of clothes, shoes, tools and bric a brac we sold. As a country, we generate about 177 million tonnes of waste every year in England alone. This is a poor use of resources and costs businesses and households money. It also causes environmental damage - for example, much of the waste sent to landfill produces methane, a powerful greenhouse gas. The government states that they want to move towards a ‘zero waste economy’. This doesn’t actually mean that there would be no waste at all, but in a society where resources were fully valued, financially and environmentally, people would reduce the amount of new items they bought, and would reuse and recycle as much as possible.  Things would be thrown away only as a last resort. ­­ Please help Proper Job to do our bit to achieve that aim in our beautiful corner of Dartmoor.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Please share Proper Job's crowd funding video on your networks and spread the word about the good work they do.

If you are able to donate a reward we can offer as a reward for donating money, for example a workshop or experience, please contact Alison Sallis on recycling@proper-job.org

We are always looking for volunteers at Proper Job so if you are unable to donate you could come and give us some of you valuable time. 

From the bottom of our hearts, we thank you!
story_txt:
PLEASE NOTE: We have changed our target figure to £5000.
SUMMARY

Proper Job is a community run, not for profit, recycling centre based in Chagford, Devon. They need to raise 5k for a purpose built vehicle with a customised logo. This new van is necessary to enable them to carry on providing a service through out rural Devon, as their old van has to be recycled itself! This important service keeps large items of household waste away from the landfill.  It will also be used to deliver home made organic compost and has the potential to be used by local people as a community vehicle.

At Proper Job, recyclable items are broken down to their component parts and recycled separately. Reusable items are given a second lease of life - they are kept away from landfill by being offered for sale in an Aladdin’s cave of pre-loved treasures at a fraction of their original cost. Our customers not only save money, they help save the environment!  Without a new van, a lot of these easily reusable or recyclable items could end up in landfill.  With a new van, Proper Job would aim to double the collections they are currently able to do.  There is a growing network of community driven projects, some just composting, some just doing reuse, others involved in growing and selling local produce and many more, but there are none quite like Proper Job.  In fact, for many organisations, Proper Job stands as a beacon to show how it can be done.
It all started in Chagford in 1993 when a group of allotment holders launched a community composting project.  They wanted to recycle green waste and create a local recycling facility for other items.  All were committed to principles of recycling and environmental sustainability. The rural skip service was being filled up with many reusable/recyclable and compostable items and the nearest recycling centre was 15 miles away. The group started their activities around these skips that came to the village each month by taking out or diverting all the green waste. 
Proper Job Limited was set up in 1995, describing itself as “a community business committed to principles of sustainability and helping to create jobs”.   This was included in a broader development plan, which encompassed a holistic vision embracing the concept of healthy community achieved through the principles of community involvement and participation, with recycling as a central feature. 

WHAT THEY NEED
They need 5k to buy a second  hand  modified vehicle with a customised logo.  A second hand Nissan Cabstar will cost just over £3000 and with modifications including a box and tail lift it will cost just over £5000    
A box conversion is necessary so that when deliveries and cardboard are transported, they don't get wet and damaged, and a tail lift is essential for transporting heavy goods such as Rayburns.
Proper Job relies on people using their recycling services and shopping at the resource centre for most of its income.  With a sign-written van, the good work they do would be far more visible to the wider community.
PERKS
There are some great rewards on offer in return for donating money to Proper Job, including Vouchers, Artisan Bread Making Courses, Compost Making Workshops, Cheese Making Tuition and much more still to come! 
RISKS AND CHALLENGES
With any form of crowd funding, there is always the risk that the target won't be achieved.  Over the years, the amount of money available to support recycling organisations such as ours has got smaller and smaller and so Proper Job has become adept at fundraising for small amounts here and there.  However, the current van won't last more than a few months so the money for a replacement is needed now.  
THE IMPACT
In such a rural area, many people rely on Proper Job because council run facilities are over 15 miles away. We are also a source of great value, second hand clothes, furniture, bric a brac, etc.  Proper Job is part of a growing network of community driven projects. Taken globally these grassroots community projects make up the largest movement in the world working for positive change and Proper Job is a small beacon of hope against the giant multinationals of the planet. It is vital that projects like Proper Job are kept alive and that we are all conscious about how much of our waste is ending up in landfill. 
In 2013 we successfully stopped over 100 tonnes of waste from ending up in landfill, not to mention the enormous amount of clothes, shoes, tools and bric a brac we sold. As a country, we generate about 177 million tonnes of waste every year in England alone. This is a poor use of resources and costs businesses and households money. It also causes environmental damage - for example, much of the waste sent to landfill produces methane, a powerful greenhouse gas. The government states that they want to move towards a ‘zero waste economy’. This doesn’t actually mean that there would be no waste at all, but in a society where resources were fully valued, financially and environmentally, people would reduce the amount of new items they bought, and would reuse and recycle as much as possible.  Things would be thrown away only as a last resort. ­­ Please help Proper Job to do our bit to achieve that aim in our beautiful corner of Dartmoor.
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Please share Proper Job's crowd funding video on your networks and spread the word about the good work they do.
If you are able to donate a reward we can offer as a reward for donating money, for example a workshop or experience, please contact Alison Sallis on recycling@proper-job.org
We are always looking for volunteers at Proper Job so if you are unable to donate you could come and give us some of you valuable time. 
From the bottom of our hearts, we thank you!

story:
Share! 

Visit: www.veggieevolution.com


ORGANIC DELICIOUS HEALTHY SNACKS


A BETTER WORLD

We want to make it easy for people to eat better with our Veggie Evolution Crisps. In our busy, on-the-go society, fast food and unhealthy snacks have become the norms.  Eating this way has contributed to a host of health problems such as diabetes, obesity, and high-blood pressure. Scientific studies have proven that a healthy diet can prevent these health problems and promote well-being. We want to be a part of the solution by sharing our healthy and tasty treat that is easy to snack on and enjoy.

WHAT IS VEGGIE EVOLUTION?

We created a mix of organic vegetables deliciously seasoned and dried to a crispy crunchy texture. Certified organic, nut-free, low-fat, and gluten-free! Veggie Evolution is made from actual slices of vegetables; it's not a processed fried snack like most on the market. It's a delicious natural snack that also fulfills daily vegetable intake recommendations.

Look at the photos below to see how many vegetables are in one bag of Veggie Evolution!

One whole pound of fresh veggies!

Look at all that Kale!!


Now, click on one of the perks  and stock up on this tasty treat.  Enjoy getting your recommended daily dose of veggies, feel good about what you're eating, and share with others.

PURPOSE OF CAMPAIGN

Our mission is to help the world eat more veggies. The purpose of this campaign is to introduce more people to our tasty snack.  We want to get at least 750 new people to try Veggie Evolution this summer. So please pick a perk and help us change the way people eat!

Creating a bag of Veggie Evolution snacks from 100% organic vegetables is costly. The simple economic truth is that if we sell more bags of Veggie Evolution, we will succeed not only in having more people eat healthy snacks; we can also produce our delicious products at lower cost.  As the number of bags we make and sell increases, each one costs less to produce.  The result? More people eating Veggie Evolution at lower prices. As our costs decrease, we pass these savings on to you, our wonderful customers!

Summary of how we will use the contributions: 

1. Buy ingredients to make and sell Veggie Crisps to you, our donors.

2. Use additional funds to buy ingredients in larger quantities (more $ up front) but at a lower cost per bag. This will enable us to pass on the savings to our customers as we grow. 

3. Use funds to make Veggie Crisps to donate to the Hunger Coalition, our local food bank.

NUTRIENT DENSE !

You are what you eat! Unfortunately, you don’t always have the time to create a well-balanced meal that includes the daily recommended amount of vegetables.  We wanted to be able to eat our vegetables- even when we were in a hurry.  We want to see the world eat healthier but changing habits of a snacking society is difficult.  So, why not join the craze and start eating more veggies!

Check out some of our nutrition panels!

     

(click to view larger image)

THE STORY OF VEGGIE EVOLUTION

"Since childhood, I have loved to experiment with food. Growing up in the resort town of Sun Valley, Idaho, gave me space to be creative. I preferred to create something new rather than follow someone else's recipe. As a teenager, I was lucky enough to have a friend that taught me about the important relationship between nutrition and good health. Later, as a parent, I worked hard to create the healthiest, most nutrient dense foods, in hopes of having a positive impact on my child's health.

I developed my 'Ketchum Kale Chips' during the summer of 2011. Farmer's Market customers loved them, so I expanded into stores. Then I came up with a vegetable medley I called 'Veggie Evolution'. Both types of snacks are a healthy and delicious alternative to fried potato chips.

This all started because I wanted to show people that snacking can be both healthy and great tasting.  I also had a desire to be able to use the business as a way to share profits with worthy non-profit groups.

My dream is becoming a reality, both showing more people that eating vegetables can be convenient and fun and to give back to groups like The Hunger Coalition, Owl House Preschool and the Flourish Foundation.

Thank you to my loyal customers for keeping me very inspired, always giving me feedback, and helping me remember to keep it fun!"

-Sheila (CEO & Founder)

IN THE NEWS

-TYTANIUM IDEAS INC.

-Healthy. Fit. Fab...Moms & Beyond

-foodbusinessnews.net

-angelsandintuition.org

-examiner.com

-JustLuxe

-Zion's Bank

-bedeliciouslyhealthy.com

-Mountain Express

-Healthy Kids Ideas Exchange 

-thequeenstable.blogspot.com

-Linhart PR

WHAT OUR FANS ARE SAYING

Mary Jo of Idaho wrote:

Hello,
I purchased my first bag of your Kale chips today at our Pilgrims market in Coeur d'Alene... I just love this product. I have seen other kale chips on the market, looked at the ingredients and put them back..yours are the real deal! Great ingredients... great taste. I have always wanted to eat kale, but until eating your chips, I just could not stand the taste of it. The nutritional benefits of kale are impressive and now I can enjoy them. Thanks Sheila for being a top-notch food entrepreneur.. by making a food that you would eat yourself, you stand out from 99% of the rest.
Best to you,
Mary Jo

Kelly of Colorado wrote:

Hello,
I wanted to tell you how much of a fan I am of your products. The Veggie Evolution Chips I had for the first time last night blew me away. The flavors are incredible and the way you achieve the depth of flavor with so few ingredients is impressive.
Keep up the tasty work.
-Kelly

Brenda of Montana wrote:

Sheila,
When I saw kale chips from Hailey, I immediately bought them out of gratitude for that special place. They were delicious. Now I am a true patron. I buy them all the time. I even special order them so I know I can eat them when I need to. I eat about one small bag of "Almost Naked" every day. I applaud your entrepreneur spirit. Wish I could do the same. Best wishes on the journey ahead.
Respectfully,
Brenda

Gary of Idaho wrote:

Sheila,
I tried your Ketchum Kale Chips from the Boise Co-op and found them excellent. I tried competing brands as well, but I liked the taste of yours and the lower levels of fats, etc., relative to some of the others. (I also like supporting locals such as your firm.)
Thanks!
Gary

Arlene of Colorado wrote:

Hi,
I saw your Veggie Evolution products at the Pearl Street Whole Foods in Boulder today for the first time. Although I've been disappointed by kale chips and similar products in the past (I now usually make my own), I decided to pick up a couple bags (barbecue and lemon parmesan). We had the barbecue flavor with our lunch, and I have to say "Wow!" -- these were the tastiest veggie chips we've ever had. Better still, they are one of the few organic offerings, and they are low on the glycemic scale. I'm sold. We liked them so much I am tempted to drive back to WFM (on a busy Friday afternoon, that's saying something) to get more before anyone else buys them up. I will definitely be supporting your products.
best wishes,
Arlene

TIMELINE


PLEASE SHARE OUR MESSAGE

We hope you'll join us and we are thankful for your pledges! In addition to pledging, sharing this page in social media is also very valuable to us!

Take a look at our website http://www.veggieevolution.com


Share our INDIEGOGO Campaign on Facebook or Twitter use any of the Share Tools(under our video) to share our campaign with your network.

For every 3 people you refer to our page AND contribute, we'll send you a complimentary bag of Veggie Evolution . 

Don't worry about tracking who contributes and who doesn't - as long as you use the Indiegogo Share Tools and are logged in, we do the tracking for you!!

story:
Overview

Thanks for checking out our project!  We’ve invented a product that firefighters tell us will save lives, and you can help get it into their hands! 

Every year, firefighters are injured or killed because they can’t find their way out of smoky buildings. We’re committed to this product because we don’t want a single firefighter to perish because he or she became disoriented in a rescue situation and ran out of oxygen. This no longer has to happen; firefighters don't have to die while trying to save people like you and me...you can help make the difference! Over the last few years we have met with Search & Rescue teams and firefighter focus groups around the country, soliciting their input on design and function, to help us develop the best possible search tool. The "Tracer Line" is the result of that collaboration.  The Tracer Line is truly created by firefighters, for firefighters. 

The Tracer Line has now been demoed and beta tested by hundreds of firefighters across the U.S. with outstanding feedback.  We have a highly respected manufacturer ready to assemble and produce the Tracer Line in the United States.  We’re ready to go!  We just need your help.  Let’s help our firefighters get out, alive!

What is it?

The Tracer Line is a retractable search line that will help firefighters find their way out of smoke-filled buildings quickly and efficiently.  The unit attaches to the rescuer's belt, is hands-free, can prop open entry doors without a chock, and provides the firefighter a physical attachment to the outside that will exit with him as s/he goes.  The line is made of a revolutionary material that is 1/3 as thick as traditional rope lines, making it much smaller and lighter while still being extremely strong and heat-resistant. As it is retractable, it doesn't tangle behind the user and can be used immediately again and again.

                            

What method do firefighters currently use? 

The traditional method of searching is to carry in a rope bag, tie off one end, and play out the line as the building is entered. When the search is complete, the firefighter follows the line back out of the smoke to safety. While this standard process has been used for many years, it has some inherent problems. Rope bags are bulky, and managing them requires the use of at least one hand.  As a rescuer retreats back out of a building, the line loops behind him/her and may become tangled on furniture or debris.  A rope bag is only good for one search area because it takes too long to repack. Due to these drawbacks, many firefighters don't use their rope bags, which puts their lives at risk, unnecessarily.  In these situations, time is a matter of life or death. 

So, how do these two tools compare?

How do you know the Tracer Line will be successful?

The Tracer Line was designed with the input of over one hundred firefighters who participated in focus groups sessions from the early prototype stage to the finished product stage.  It addresses all the limitations posed by older rope bags that have caused firefighters to leave them on the rig in the past…firefighters will use the Tracer Line and it will save lives!  The Tracer Line has been demoed and beta tested by hundreds of firefighters across the U.S. with outstanding feedback.  We’re ready to go!

The Numbers

We need $900,000 to begin manufacturing this product. Due to the critical life-saving nature of the product, only top quality materials will be used, and the process will ensure stringent safety and liability testing.

What's in it for me?

First, you’ll be helping get this life-saving tool into the hands of those who need it.  Second, there are many cool items up for grabs that we think you’ll enjoy!  You could even be one of the first to get the Tracer Line for the firefighters in your community!  Check out the Perk Gallery below:

       

      

               

  
Can you show me more about how the Tracer Line works?

Absolutely!  Click on the 'Gallery' tab at the top of this page to view our firefighter  training video and pictures of the Tracer Line in action.

What are the risks and challenges involved with this project?

Many of the risks and challenges have already been addressed and resolved. We have gone through a multitude of prototypes and design changes to get this right and to produce what the Fire Industry has asked of us. We have researched the National Fire Protection Agency standards on equipment and requirements needed to withstand the harsh environment in which the product will be used.  We have a team of fire experts working alongside us. Product liability policies are in place. And, we have a highly respected manufacturer ready to assemble and produce the Tracer Line in the United States.

How can I help?

  • First, donate to this project!  Every dollar matters and your gift could help save someone’s life.

  • Second, share the information!  Tell your friends, and spread the word on social media.

  • And third, stay connected!  Like us on Facebook and keep up with the exciting updates throughout the campaign! 

Click on the ‘Comments’ tab at the top of the page to let us know why you are supporting this project or why the getting the Tracer Line to our firefighters excites you.  We may share your comments as an encouragement to our firefighters and community!

Thank you for supporting this important project, and thank you for helping them get out alive!



Bonus Questions

How soon can we get a Tracer Line?

Tracer Lines will be in full production approximately 6 months after Rescue Products completes fund raising.  Assuming this campaign is successful, we would expect to ship units in May 2015.

If you don’t raise enough, what will you do?

We will use the funds we do raise to begin limited production while continuing to raise funds to establish a volume manufacturing line.  We intend to get this to market to make a difference!

Do you have a patent?

The Tracer Line is fully patented in the United States, China, and the EU.

What other uses exist for the Tracer Line?

Besides the initial implementation with your local fire department, the Tracer Line has drawn significant interest for firefighting and search & rescue with the military and from cruise lines.  There is clearly a solid fit for all maritime vessels.  In addition, there are numerous other applications being considered for the Tracer Line, such as spelunking and cave diving.

matters and your gift could help save someone’s life.
Second,
share the information!  Tell your
friends, and spread the word on social media.
And
third, stay connected!  Like us on
Facebook and keep up with the exciting updates throughout the campaign!  



Click on the ‘Comments’
tab at the top of the
page to let us know why you are supporting this project or why the getting
the Tracer Line to our firefighters excites you.  We may share your comments as an
encouragement to our firefighters and community!









Thank you for supporting
this important project, and thank you for helping them get out alive!



Bonus Questions
How soon can we get a
Tracer Line?
Tracer Lines will be in full
production approximately 6 months after Rescue Products completes fund
raising.  Assuming this campaign is
successful, we would expect to ship units in May 2015.
If you don’t raise enough, what will you do?
We will use the funds we do raise
to begin limited production while continuing to raise funds to establish a
volume manufacturing line.  We intend to
get this to market to make a difference!
Do you have a patent?
The Tracer Line is fully patented
in the United States, China, and the EU.
What other uses exist for the Tracer Line?
Besides the initial implementation
with your local fire department, the Tracer Line has drawn significant interest
for firefighting and search & rescue with the military and from cruise
lines.  There is clearly a solid fit for
all maritime vessels.  In addition, there
are numerous other applications being considered for the Tracer Line, such as
spelunking and cave diving.

story:
Welcome to the Caring And Sharing Card Club Campaign.

My name is John and I am a Correctional Officer that started a card program where the inmates draw holiday cards and the cards are distributed to Veterans, the elderly and children in nursing homes and hospitals.  I pay for the cost of supplies and copies, because there is no money in the budget for this program. This is a not-for-profit program.

I started wondering, what can be done to help other people. Not only put a smile on their face, but actually help them.  On March 1, 2015  we will embark on a new adventure called Caring And Sharing Card Club.  When joining the card club you will receive 3 greeting cards every month for $7.99.  Each card comes with a beautiful envelope lined with gold foil to make a great impression.  Money will be donated equally to 26 different charities.  

The charities include:  Unicef (worldwide relief) - Juvenile Diabetes - Alzheimer's Disease - Multiple Sclerosis - Muscular Dystrophy - United Way - National Autism Association - Ronald McDonald House - St.Judes Children's Research Hospital - March of Dimes - Save The Children - Shield of Honor Foundation - Wounded Warrior Project - American Cancer Society - A.L.S. (Lou Gehrig's Disease) - American Red Cross - Special Olympics  - American Heart Association - National Humane Association - Goodwill - Poverty U.S.A. - Salvation Army - Care (Worldwide Relief) -Parkinson Disease - Shriner's International.

We've come to indiegogo to help fund equipment and to setup this business as a non-profit.  With each membership you help and care for people less fortunate than ourselves.  The more members the more that is donated, the more people helped.

story:
Have you ever dreamed of opening your own business, selling items you have made yourself, or being your own boss?


Women all over Western North Carolina (WNC) have those very same dreams and aspirations. You can help these women turn their dreams into a reality by supporting the Appalachian Women Entrepreneurs (AWE) Indiegogo campaign. AWE is working very hard here in WNC to make those dreams a reality, but this program can use a little help and that is where you come in!

By donating to this campaign you are supporting a program that empowers women entrepreneurs by helping them develop the skills needed to overcome the economic challenges present in rural Appalachia, a region that for decades has faced slow economic growth, diminishing industry, and high incidences of poverty.

Let’s change this together!

- Linda LaBelle, Entrepreneurship Program Manager, HandMade in America


"HandMade in America has been instrumental in moving me from a limited operation to a professional small business. I have gained expertise in business planning, product pricing, implementing actionable ideas, marketing (both brick/mortar and social media), and record keeping. They have also sponsored workshops which provided me a wide range of additional opportunities... HandMade: the gift that keeps on giving!”

- Mary Carol Koester, Artist, owner of Azalea Bindery, and AWE participant


Your Donation

At each contribution level, your donation goes directly to open doors and help these female entrepreneurs and artists in rural WNC grow as strong, effective businesswomen. For every $60 we raise, HandMade can sponsor one of these dedicated entrepreneurs for a year. This includes: educational materials and supplies, meetings and conferences, individualized mentoring, support and networking opportunities, and so much more. By teaching them to become knowledgeable, innovative, and strategic entrepreneurs, we give them the confidence and tools they need for success!


About Us

HandMade in America is a unique non-profit whose mission is to to grow economies through craft and creative placemaking. This means we work hard to enrich and strengthen rural communities in Western North Carolina through an arts/culture and asset-based approach.  

HandMade in America works on several fronts to achieve this goal, which includes fostering entrepreneurial and business skills among local artists, partnering with small towns in the region to help revitalize their communities, and educating the public on the advantages of buying local and supporting the area's proud tradition of craft. 

The Appalachian Women Entrepreneurs (AWE) program provides Western North Carolina's women entrepreneurs with individualized mentoring and support to help start or grow their businesses, access resources, reach new markets, and enrich the communities where they reside. While primarily aimed to meet the unique needs of women craft artists, all female entrepreneurs in WNC are welcome and encouraged. Educational topics include training in social media outreach and marketing, accounting, taxes, computer skills, and other specialized areas tailored to fit their needs!

Additionally, each year HandMade in America holds an annual AWE conference to bring together these entrepreneurs from across the region.  At this day-long event, participants learn valuable business and marketing skills from an array of guest speakers and industry experts while building strong connections with other members of the craft and business communities.

story:
Hi, we are Gary Delaney and Dale Clarke,

In June last year the local village hall and play park was taken down to make way for a new community centre and play park. The village was led to believe the new play park was going to be erected along with the new community centre which was completed in November. Due to budget issue's with the community centre, the play park was put on hold which caused a lot of controversy within the community as the play park should of been the priority.

The local council have now been given a grant to start the play park, but it is not big enough to complete to the specifications of the plans.

After listening and reading of people criticising and complaining about the local council, Dale and I decided something needed to be done, so we have organised a fund raising event to help out.

We have massed together an Army of budding volunteers to take part in not one, but four challenges designed to promote fitness within the community. Each of the challenges is aimed to test people of different levels of ability, with the aim of raising money to help complete the play park.

Beach to the Beeches is taking place on Saturday the 6th of September 2014. The event comprises of an 80 mile cycle from Sheringham, a 60 mile cycle from Hunstanton, a marathon starting in Stoke Ferry and a half marathon starting in Lakenheath. The route from Sheringham joins the route from Hunstanton at Gayton, passing through Stoke Ferry where the Marathon will start and Lakenheath where the Half Marathon will start, with the finish line at the Beeches community centre.

The 80 mile cycle, 60 mile cycle and marathon will start at 10am with the challenge of completing their journey in 4-5 hours. The half marathon will start at 12pm with the challenge of completing in 2-3. Hopefully everybody will cross the finish line at the same time.

All the money we raise will go towards completing the kids play park

story:
In Memory Of Darrell Kidd We'd Like To Dedicate A Lakeside Picnic Table on Okanagan Lake.

Every night Darrell (Jel)  and his wife Marilyn Kidd and Dogs Sasha & Woofy walked the Okanagan Lakeshore boardwalk. Along the way they would stop to enjoy the beautiful scenery, sitting on the park benches that overlook the lake. 

Darrell's last wish was to have a bench donated in his honor for people of all ages to enjoy for years to come along the lakeside. We have found the perfect picnic table right on the beach that can be dedicated to our dad/husband/brother/friend. 

We Found The Perfect Picnic Table (wheelchair access)

For years the entire Kidd family would travel from where ever they might be living at that time to Penticton for Peachfest. Each year they would always stay at a quaint little motel called the Crown Motel that is located on Lakeshore Drive. We, the family, would love to have the chance to dedicate the picnic table across from the Crown Motel with Darrell's spirit and love for the lakeside - Aye!

    Help Make His Dream Come True

    Your donation to help make Darrell (Jel's) request happen, is greatly appreciated and can be enjoyed by you and your family for year's to come.  Please follow the donation instructions on this page, payment options are by credit card or Paypal. We also understand not everyone has a lot of money to help out with donations, but even small donations can help. If you can't donate money, we would appreciate your help by sharing this with others that knew Darrell,

    Once we have the picnic table engraved, we will set a date to hold a celebration of Darrell (Jel's) life in Penticton and to thank all those who so kindly donated to his dream!

story:
About Theatre 1901

Theatre 1901 is an Orlando based production company which specializes in Broadway and Urban Stage Plays. The mission of THEATRE 1901 is to inspire, enrich, entertain, educate and empower our community with diverse theatrical productions through exceptional theatrical arts in an exclusive yet welcoming setting. We train and support the next generation of theatre artists, and we celebrate the essential power of the theatre to illuminate our common humanity. 

We are seeking funds for our "Year of The Arts" campaign. This will allow us to continue to bring Broadway to our community, plan for our tour and employ experienced and skilled locals with a passion for the Arts. 

Our target market is segmented into families who aren't able to visit New York City to see a show on Broadway. In 2016, we will produce shows like "The Wiz Musical " "Beauty and The Beast" "DreamGirls: The Musical" "Mamma Mia!" and many more. Our goal is to bring excellent and affordable shows to Central Florida.


Our Driving Force 

A couple of years ago we auditioned a young girl. She was spunky and full of energy and talent! This young girl was born and raised in New York but had never been exposed to professional theatre until the day of our auditions. She told us how much she loved to act and sing but when asked if she had ever been to a show on Broadway  she answered "no." She then proceeded to tell us a story about the day she asked her mother if they can go see a show in the city. She said "Firmly, my mom said no and that we didn't have the money." She said it felt as if her mothers words unknowingly caused her dreams to shatter right before her eyes! Imagine a 7 or 8 year old girl asking for something that was financially unattainable for a low to middle class family.

 In 2015, we had the opportunity to produce "DREAMGIRLS: The Musical" and not only was this young girl able to watch her first Off-Broadway production she was also given the opportunity to be a supporting role in the production as well! We are firm believers that nothing in life is impossible! To be a company that has the knowledge and influence to create life-changing opportunities for not only actors and actresses but for directors, musicians, and theatre lovers all around is something we are extremely proud of! Much like this young girl, many have obtained the opportunity to experience theatre the 1901 way! Our driving force are children and adults that have a heart like this young girl did for theatre. 

Ways You Can Help

  • Donate toward our Goal of 35,499 and recieve a Perk! 
  • Talk about it! Once you've donated tell a friend
  • Use Indiegogo share tools and find us on our Social Media networks to help spread the word.

Did You Know? 

$3.00 of every perk and ticket sold will be donated to the Ronald McDonald House Charities in their efforts to build their Third Building in Central Florida. 

Not only do your proceeds help us in our efforts to keep the Arts alive in our community but they will also help families in need during their toughest times.

Ronald McDonald House Charities has taken a unique approach to helping families in need! Their Houses are home to many families dealing with an ill child. 

Ronald McDonald House Charities Mission: 

To provide a home away from home for families with children receiving treatment at hospitals and medical facilities in Orlando.



DONATE TODAY!

story:
The only idea that could suppress climate change.

By playing a small part you will have the opportunity to change the world, no picketing, no rioting is required, other than financing a rewarding challenge.

Project Objective

The project objective is very simple. Finance is required to patent in the United States, Europe, and other jurisdictions a revolutionary invention that is truly a life change event in itself.

Catch 22

European, and for most parts of the world public disclosure of an invention constitutes invalidity to patent the invention in the first place, therefore no disclosure in given here.

Acquiring Patents

By acquiring patents in multiple jurisdictions, inventor will then disclose to parties of interest the invention.  First the US jurisdiction, then Europe, and if funding permits other countries.

Marketing

Once patenting process, filling, acquiring filling receipts for patent application then disclosure commences. The inventor then will disclose to organizations the invention. More than likely parties of interest will want interest of some kind because their need is greater than the inventor's.

Disclosure to backers

Once patent applications receipts are obtain backers will be notify about the invention. A website with a countdown clock will be sent to backers, and entities who can make use of it.

Inventor reason

The main reason is for the interest of Polar Bear's and all species of the planet, including those in the oceans. Various organizations around the planet are fighting a loosing battle in trying to protect endanger, threaten, and vulnerable species, but they are loosing the battle.

Credit: USFWS, Photo: Susanne Miller


Our climate

We already know that the temperature of our planet is changing and no one is immune. Climate models, graphs made by scientists show how it has become apparent.  The public graph made by the US Government NOAA exemplifies this fact.

NOAA Climate Dashboard - Climate Projection


Birds have no lawyers

Recently, found out about this organization that is a true believer for birds, they made a report about more than 300+ birds are in the brink of going the way of the dinosaurs. Unfortunately, it is a horrendous battle nowadays every organization needs money, event the ones with all the good intentions.

What if money was the last thing they would need. You never know, maybe by using this invention the last thing we'll have to worry about is over population of every specie of bird.

Credit: USFWS,  Photo: Maslowski, Steve


Not a Save the Whale's Campaign

Remember this is not an invention for birds, or polar bears, but not until it is put in place, the fruits of our labor will come slowly or gradually. If this request is funded, and a patent or patents given, then will the parties of interest will more than likely want to make use of the invention.

Credit: USFWS, Photo: Aaron Maizlish


NOW THE CHALLENGE

The inventor will seek patent protection through a process known as Patent Acceleration from The United States Patent Office  (http://www.uspto.gov/patents/process/file/accelerated/index.jsp) a Petition to make Special is a request by an inventor or representative as a request to accelerate the patent application only under certain conditions. They involve the age of the inventor(s), if the invention merits accelerated review.

When merits, and required application documents, fees, processing is accepted for review The United States Patent Office will give the application special attention.The challenge is to obtain a patent in 12 months, the sooner the better. Under these provisions, the application then therefore has the opportunity to apply for foreign patents.

Once, then a patent in the European Patent Office, and the World Intellectual Property Organization is then filed. Under WIPO an applicant can then apply to several countries.



Secrecy

Secrecy is paramount, no information of what one has, or explain what it is devote by the patent offices. Soon after, under application rules the application is then publish to the world to see. Only under publication will then the patent details are known.

The Marketing

Marketing lets people know what's out there before they can navigate the maze that each patent database is. Marketing will then be conducted through a website with video, pictures, and details.


If a party becomes interested then everything is done through lawyers, for example, licensing. Companies already exist that would wish they make use of the invention. This invention may not be for sale, unless for the real grand prize.

That's It!

that each patent database is. Marketing will then be conducted through a
 website with video, pictures, and details.




If a party becomes interested then everything is done through 
lawyers, for example, licensing. Companies already exist that would wish
 they make use of the invention. This invention may not be for sale, 
unless for the real grand prize.
That's It!

story:
Short Summary

Hello Everyone! We are a grass roots, non-profit organization, called Portage Aquatic Tourism and Hospitality Board, or PATH for short. We are based in a small town of roughly 13,000 people located in the heart of Canada. We are a passionate people who are dedicated to trying to re-energize our community from the inside out by utilizing one of our brightest diamonds of our city. 

We currently have a 4 km in area lake / slough that is located in the heart of our community that at one time was a vibrant and active lake for not only our community but all surrounding communities to take advantage of. Now due to under maintenance and years of "sitting and watching", that jewel has started to rust and turn into nothing more than a weed and mosquito breeding ground. 

Our goal is to completely overhaul this lake and turn it back into something that is not only a major tourist site, but is also a pristine example of a environmental, economic, and socially beneficial model for others to follow. Again we stress that this CAN become not only a beautiful treasure for millions of people to see and use, but also a major economic driver for our communities. 

Just imagine a location that has a beautiful swimming, fishing, and boating lake. A island that has parks, a golf course, a camping grounds, a horse back riding trail, a lake front boardwalk for artists to display there art to passing walkers,concession stands for anyone who wants a quick bite to eat, as well as many more attractions to do and see.

This is how we dream, and this is what we see. We are asking for your help to make this become a reality, and to help communities become something more.

Thank You!

What We Need & What You Get

This funding gives us enough for phase 1. We are working directly with municipal, provincial, and federal governments to help make this project a reality. So this funding is to pay for a proper setup of the organization. The administration of the project as it will be a major multiple year undertaking. The funding of environmental, and engineering studies. The proposed purchase of equipment for proper aeration of the lake, and the ecological study for the possibility of aquatic life. 

Phase 2 - This will be the rendering of plans and overviews through multi-media of the proposed project to the public and the private sectors. The goal is to unite a multitude of organizations and individuals into a cohesive group of dedicated and passionate people who want to see this project succeed.

Phase 3 - The implementation of project "Helping us grow". This is the start of the removal of sediment and debris from the lake, as well as setting up a eco-friendly and self sustaining aeration and power system to the purification of the lake. 

Phase 4 - To introduce proper engineered design for lake bottom and surrounding shore lines to help introduce proper "flow" to lake, as well as limit or completely eliminate the shore line erosion.

Phase 5 - Work with local and surrounding businesses to build and maintain proper walk ways and "boardwalks" for potential tourists and well wishers. 

Phase 6 - Finalize and maintain project through organizational maintenance through PATH.

What YOU get at the end of all of this? 

YOU get the chance to actually see your money not only working to better the lives of others, but imagine being able to step into a crystal clear lake that YOU help revive.

Imagine being able to go on a horse back ride through a breath taking park that YOU help fund.

Imagine being able to catch a spectacular looking fish from a cool, crisp lake that you helped put there. Imagine!

The Impact

The impact of this project is pretty self explanatory. It helps not only you, but your neighbors, your family, and your future. Because if you can help us, just imagine what we can do to help you!
