story:
Who Are We?

The 219th Brain Surgeons are a cosplay for charity group that raises funds for charities while having fun dressing up in costumes. While we usually dress in Resident Evil Umbrella Corporation based outfits, our fearless leader will be donning a My Little Pony costume (courtesy of our partner in crime on this event, Three Muses Inspired Clothing) for 1 day during Collective Con held May 8-10. The wonderful charity that has agreed to deal with us and take your money is Horses For Heroes.


What Are We Doing Here?

The backstory behind our little challenge is that it started as a series of small practical jokes at a recent convention our members attended. Our group lead is not a big fan of the series My Little Pony and this was used in some good natured fun. As we do with many things, someone brought up the idea of fully dressing him up in a MLP costume and using it as a fundraiser. We like fundraisers so out went the feelers to see if this was a feasible idea and who would be the benefactor. One of our local costume makers loved the idea and decided to partner with us to create the costume.


Just what pony will we be dressing our leader up in? Well, that’s up to all of you! What we have decided to do is let you, the people of the world, vote on the pony. Each vote is a $1 donation to Horses For Heroes. All $25 donations include a bonus vote. Who will win? Well, I’m pretty sure Horses For Heroes is the real winner, but which pony wins is up to you!


Who Will Your Contribution Benefit?

Horses For Heroes - NM Cowboy Up!


Cowboy Up! is a unique horsemanship, wellness and skill-set restructuring program based in Santa Fe, NM free to ALL Operation Iraqi Freedom & Operation Enduring Freedom-Afghanistan, Operation New Dawn veterans and active military, (both men and women), especially those who have sustained PTSD, combat trauma, or physical injuries during their time serving our country.


From day one veterans are hands on with our horses beginning with groundwork and progressing to riding, as well as participating in other aspects of ranch life, including working cattle and more importantly  experiencing the camaraderie with cowboys who are  veterans themselves. 


Sharing our experience, our strengths, and hopes  we give veterans a new and vital mission where they  can recuperate, recreate, and reintegrate into their communities. We believe that Horsemanship is Leadership and and by assisting veterans through the way of the horse  and cowboy culture, we are able to support their  journey, integrating mind, body and spirit.   


We are honored to be endorsed by the New Mexico Cattle Growers Association and their member ranches, Working Ranch Cowboys Association, (WRCA) and NM Department of Veterans' Services.

story:
Dear Friends,

This summer I am joining a youth-led organization in Maasailand, Kenya called Maasai Youth Outreach Organization (M.A.Y.O.O.) to volunteer in their community orphanage, primary schools, and their rescue center for victims of Female Genital Mutilation and child marriage. FGM and child marriage are major issues that affect vulnerable girls across Africa, and M.A.Y.O.O. provides a safe haven for girls who are victims of this practice or subjected to becoming a victim. Many of the students who attend the Oloshooibor and Illnargooj primary schools have lost one parent or both, and come from families that need much support. M.A.Y.O.O. helps to ensure that these students receive the primary education they deserve, despite lack of economic opportunity. M.A.Y.O.O also works on other issues of significance such as strengthening community preservation, addressing HIV/AIDS, and widow care. Specifically located in the Illnargooj region of Maasailand, M.A.Y.O.O. was founded by 24-year old Jonathan, who turned his childhood experience of being an orphan, and living with street kids, into an opportunity to ensure that children of his community are equipped with the tools necessary to lead a successful, enriching life, no matter the circumstances. 

This organization has become extremely important to me because children's rights and youth development in sub-saharan Africa are my passion and primary academic focus. Besides this organization being in line with my interests, I am inspired by M.A.Y.O.O and Jonathan's work in raising the voice of a people who are largely unheard and under-represented in global discourse. Jonathan represents the voice of Maasai youth who are trying to elevate and help their community. Female Genital Mutilation, child marriage, lack of education, lack of food security, and the spread of infectious are just some of the issues M.A.Y.O.O. is tackling with great determination, but very few resources. Any bit would go a long way, and would impact the lives of a wonderful community. Join me in helping M.A.Y.O.O. strengthen their efforts and achieve more goals.

Read all about Jonathan and M.A.Y.O.O. on their website

What your donations will go towards:

(as broken down by M.A.Y.O.O.)

Education

  • 1 Primary School uniform: 25 USD
  • 1 Pair of shoes: 15 USD
  • Clothing for 1 child for 1 year: 70 USD (A child will only need school uniform set a year, but due to the terrain will need 3 pairs of shoes a year)
  • 1 term of Secondary School: 180 USD
  • 3 terms (one year): 540 USD

Water

  • 1 Borehole- 680,000ksh (about 8,000 USD)
This includes:
  • A generator to pump water from the borehole;
  • A tank to host water 8000 litres

Ground research

  • Drilling cost

Health

  • Child Vaccination can cost- 5,600ksh (65 USD)
  • 1 sheep to raise and sell later- 4,000ksh (47 USD)
  • 1 cow cost - 18,000ksh (210 USD)

Other costs:

  • Beds and food for the Victims of FGM/Child Marriage Rescue Center

Pictured: Children of the community's primary schools who are orphans or have lost one parent  

Pictured: M.A.Y.O.O. founder Jonathan with young students of Oloshooibor Primary School

Pictured: Illnargooj Primary School

Other Ways You Can Help:

Please spread this campaign around to your friends, family and network! Help spread the word!!

story:
Stop Acid Attacks' is a campaign against acid violence in India where more than one third of such incidents are caused by spurned lovers. About half of these victims are young women and students. In a country where victims of such attacks are afraid to face the world for more than one reason, Rupa embodies monumental inspiration.

I am Kyra Agarwal, a 17 year old student from the American Embassy School, New Delhi. The 'Empower Campaign' emerged in the summer of 2014 after I volunteered with 'Stop Acid Attacks' and worked closely with Rupa. My deepest desire is to enable Rupa to actualize her dreams. I came up with the idea of a pepper spray to not just raise funds for Rupa, but also to empower women to protect themselves. Through this campaign, I hope to raise awareness against acid attacks and also to highlight the struggle and the extremely difficult rehabilitation process amongst acid attack survivors. Few people know and understand the physical challenges and the slow torturous emotional healing that can span through a lifetime for a survivor. I hope the 'Empower Campaign' will urge society to honor and support them for their courage and determination. 

Claim Your Perk and Support Acid Attack Fighter Rupa 

You can donate money towards the distribution of pepper sprays to women at a school/college, institution workplace of your choice, or we can select one for you. The minimum quantity for an online purchase is 50 pieces. Show your caring and pick up this pepper spray for only Rs. 350 : buy it for yourself, gift it to a friend or relative, or simply donate it to an institution (school or workplace). 

Help me help Rupa! “If You Will Then We Can.”


You  Can Also Donate towards our Other Projects Too

1 Support Shero's Hangout Run By Acid Fighter- bit.ly/sheros

2. Chhanv Boutique- An Acid Attack Fighter's Dream - bit.ly/saaboutique

story:
INTRODUCTION

Hi this is Rebekah Pruchnic and Patrick McCormick. We are asking for crowdfunding donations towards an RV to travel in for our Quantum Road Trips in the amount of $100,000 for the RV, plus an additional $200,000 for the mobile virtual broadcast global uplink studio that it will house. All funding which exceeds those amounts will go towards our $10 million 'spill-over campaign' for start-up capital whereby we begin creating large-scale production studio designed to create a film studio which will make spiritual-thriller movies, telling important messages to humanity for its ascension.

WHAT ARE QUANTUM ROAD TRIPS?

Our Quantum Road Trips consist of traveling to various cities in North America. They involve live Broadcasts, Retreats, Profound Healing Experiences, and various Energy Therapies being taught in different locations. This includes doing energy work to lift the heavy density which has collected in certain cities, to lighten them. This also includes group and private sessions. All of this includes very high Divine energy. Currently we are traveling and doing a series of live broadcasts in local areas of the US, called the The Greater Work Series.

WHAT IS IN STORE WITH HUMANITY?

Why the need for collective and personal energy work? Humanity is about to take a huge leap forward in consciousness, and many lightworkers have been seeded with high frequencies of light to aid humanity in this process. Our normal (carbon-based) bodies are about to undergo a huge metamorphosis. It is necessary to prepare for the hugh infusions of light energy now entering our world from the cosmos. We are activating the Light Workers so that they can fulfill their roles in holding these higher frequencies for humanity, to stabilize its evolution into a higher dimension.

WHO ARE WE, AND WHAT HAPPENS?

We both have amazing backrounds in working with Quantum Energy. These result in intuitive, mystical, psychic, teaching, channeling, multidimensional and healing gifts that unfold during these events. As Kartron, an inter-dimensional from the realms of essence, transmits through Patrick McCormick, and Sole, a Dominion Solar Angel transmits through Rebekah Pruchnic, various Inter-dimensional, Angelic and Light Beings assist in amplifying the light energies they bring through to Earth. It is quite an experience that can change lives forever.

HOW CAN THIS HAPPEN?

Some of these life-altering processes are called Cellular Memory Healing and the 'Soul Touch' used by Rebekah and Sole', and the God Gate, Pillar of Transformation and the Still Point created by Kartron to simplify the divine energy in our lives, and many more. Cellular memory healing removes energy blockages, which are very common as we navigate through life. Common causes of energy blockages are physical and emotional trauma, illness, surgery, suppressed feelings, starvation, fear, stress and karma. Stored energy blocks can create disease.

WHAT IS CELLULAR MEMORY?

Cellular memory healing clears and heals many imprints, such as guilt, distrust, heartache and betrayal, fear, struggle, resentment, and many others. Just ONE session can clear issues that one could spend years and years trying to resolve in traditional therapy. It clears trapped energy out of the organs and gets the issues out of your tissues. It also works with the “Soul Star” which is an energy center above the head that contains much information and the entire blueprint for our Soul's Mission. When these areas are blocked we can have life setbacks, be unclear about our purpose, and even have physical illness result. It also restructures the DNA from a 2-strand to 12-strand.

SOUL TOUCH – AN ANGEL'S GIFT

Using the Cellular Memory process as a foundation, Soul Touch takes it to inter dimensional levels across time, activating the 13-strand DNA helix. This becomes the Foundation Template for our Crystalline Light Bodies, which will be necesssary if we are to stay on planet earth in the near future. The reason for this is that as our planet ascends to higher dimensions, it will hold a much higher frequency of light. The old structure is Carbon based, the new one will be Crystalline which will enable a human body to hold these higher light frequencies and also enables one to have much better health due to more light and life force in the DNA and cells.

WHY DO WE DO THIS?

Like many on this planet, it is our Destiny to Change the World. So many people are burdened with life's challenges, keeping them busy. Fulfilling one's Purpose is one of the boldest paths we can take. It is the bravest who dare to live their Destiny. That is why we were created. It is the essence which fills the Soul, gives Nourishment to the Spirit, and Purpose to the Path.

If you could make a difference in the world, making someone's life better, would you? We are preparing a vehicle to help millions of people improve their lives, enlighten their paths, and raise the quality of life for the many who choose it. This is not just a dream, it is a reality. That is what you do by supporting our campaign; you are the change you want to see in the world.

In addition, your support of our campaign, helping us to achieve the RV-Mobile Broadcast Studio travel life mobilizes our Quantum Road Tour into magnificent proportions, which enables us to give an event in your city. The Live Broadcast technology in our virtual studios can be set up anywhere we may set up a tech connection, linking up to the world.

Do you have a dream? Are you ready to live it? Are you ready to have us broadcast it out to the world?

That is what you support by supporting us; a chance to change the world.

WHY THIS WORK MUST CONTINUE

So we find it very very important to continue on with this work, which is our purpose for being here at this time. It has changed many many lives and helped many with various health issues, spiritual issues, and soothes and heals many traumas. After just one session a person can expect to feel very peaceful, lighter, and have an overall sense of well being and heavenly bliss. Many report being able to connect to their guardian angels, guides, Ascended masters such as Jesus, St. Germain and Mother Mary, and have a profound reconnection with the Divine. Most feel inspired and many report feeling a Profound sense of Love and Freedom, as this work is very powerful. So we are asking for your most generous and heartfelt donations with this Campaign, and to do so will help many to touch Heaven.

Thank You, Rebekah and Patrick.

SOUL
TOUCH – AN ANGEL'S GIFT

Using
the Cellular Memory process as a foundation, Soul Touch takes it to
inter dimensional levels across time, activating the 13-strand DNA
helix. This becomes the Foundation Template for our Crystalline Light
Bodies, which will be necesssary if we are to stay on planet earth in
the near future. The reason for this is that as our planet ascends to
higher dimensions, it will hold a much higher frequency of light. 
The old structure is Carbon based, the new one will be Crystalline
which will enable a human body to hold these higher light frequencies
and also enables one to have much better health due to more light and
life force in the DNA and cells.  


WHY
DO WE DO THIS?

Like
many on this planet, it is our Destiny to Change the World. So many
people are burdened with life's challenges, keeping them busy.
Fulfilling one's Purpose is one of the boldest paths we can take. It
is the bravest who dare to live their Destiny. That is why we were
created. It is the essence which fills the Soul, gives Nourishment to
the Spirit, and Purpose to the Path.

If
you could make a difference in the world, making someone's life
better, would you? We are preparing a vehicle to help millions of
people improve their lives, enlighten their paths, and raise the
quality of life for the many who choose it. This is not just a dream,
it is a reality. That is what you do by supporting our campaign; you
are the change you want to see in the world.

In
addition, your support of our campaign, helping us to achieve the
RV-Mobile Broadcast Studio travel life mobilizes our Quantum Road
Tour into magnificent proportions, which enables us to give an event
in your city. The Live Broadcast technology in our virtual studios
can be set up anywhere we may set up a tech connection, linking up to
the world.

Do
you have a dream? Are you ready to live it? Are you ready to have us
broadcast it out to the world?
That
is what you support by supporting us; a chance to change the world.

WHY
THIS WORK MUST CONTINUE

So
we find it very very important to continue on with this work, which
is our purpose for being here at this time.  It has changed many many
lives and helped many with various health issues, spiritual issues,
and soothes and heals many traumas.  After just one session a person
can expect to feel very peaceful, lighter, and have an overall sense
of well being and heavenly bliss. Many report being able to connect
to their guardian angels, guides, Ascended masters such as Jesus, St.
Germain and Mother Mary, and have a profound reconnection with the
Divine. Most feel inspired and many report feeling a Profound sense
of Love and Freedom, as this work is very powerful. So we are asking
for your most generous and heartfelt donations with this Campaign,
and to do so will help many to touch Heaven.Thank You, Rebekah and Patrick.

story:
An American Mill for American Fiber!

Making Wonderful Woolen Fibers Exceptional!

2015 is the Year of the Sheep, and we are taking it very seriously. So seriously that we have committed to an lofty goal - a woolen fiber mill that creates 100% American made woolen and fiber products from American produced woolen fibers.

Our Woolen Fibers include Alpaca, Angora, Buffalo, Cashmere, Llama, Mohair, Sheep, Silk & Yak.

We also are developing product mixes using plant based fibers which include cotton, flax, & hemp.

It started two years ago, when some of us who live in a remote county of Washington State had a dream of having our very own Fiber Mill that would produce beautiful products from the animals we raise and provide employment for the residents.

We started planning, taking classes, educating ourselves and taking the first steps towards our goal. We found a building to use, purchased some machinery, collected half a ton of fleece (some of it rescued from a landfill!), graded and sorted it and have it ready for milling.

Now we need your help. We need $55,000 to complete the purchase of our building. You can contribute by being a backer of Eco Fiber Mill, Inc.

Why should you do this?

Because...

  • Eco Fiber Mill, Inc. is a for profit business and will be run as such. Your contribution will make you a backer in a progressive, sustainable, environmentally responsible business.
  • Eco Fiber Mill, Inc. has already secured contracts to produce wool products- we just need to get our building and start milling!
  • Eco Fiber Mill, Inc. will restore pride in American made wool products such as yarn, socks, sweaters, blankets and more.
  • The Certified Sorting process uses all parts of the fleece- nothing is wasted. The various grades of fiber are used to their best advantage, resulting in high quality products in every category.
  • The fiber is not treated with harsh chemicals as are most imported fiber products.
  • The mill is located in a rural agricultural area, and will be a place for many small fiber producers to sell their fleeces, providing much needed income for family farms.
  • Eco Fiber Mill, Inc. will provide jobs in an area that has high unemployment. It will be a boost for the local economy.

Eco Fiber Mill, Inc. has strong support from the local community including the Chamber of Commerce and many prominent citizens. They are all rooting for us and waiting for the news that we have raised the $55,000. We don’t want to disappoint them.

Help us now by becoming an initial backer! The deadline is approaching quickly, so don’t delay.

An Earth Friendly Fiber Mill by Farmers -- Creating Eco Fiber Products for the next generation of Fiber Artists & Crafters.

Once we fund the Washington Mill we have been asked to assist Missouri and Georgia in doing the same! So you see your belief in us and backing us will become perpetual in effect by delivering more than one mill to make American Produced Fiber into American Made Products. We are now officially approved for Government contract tendering and need to get this mill finished so we can begin to deliver American made products for our military!

http://www.ecofibermill.com/


About the North American Wool Cooperative:

http://www.woolco-op.org/

story:
The Town Kitchen connects low-income Oakland youth aged 16-24 with local chefs and artisans to plan, prepare, build, box and deliver curbside lunch to companies and individuals in the Oakland and San Francisco Bay area.

Our Community Lunchbox highlights our community through food. Every menu is designed by a guest chef, created by our youth workforce, and partnered with local artisan food businesses. It includes a locally-sourced main course, dessert, and an eight ounce drink. Companies and individuals will order from a rotating monthly menu.

We strive to create a community where low-income Oakland and San Francisco Bay Area youth can shine. A community where we will introduce youth to talented chefs & start-up entrepreneurs. In the next three years, we plan to provide fair-wage jobs and entrepreneurial training to 43 low-income Bay Area youth.


A Commercial Kitchen, A Second Home for our Youth

For us, a kitchen represents so many things -- passion, teamwork, sustenance, growth, and empowerment.  The right kitchen will allow us to lease a 2000 square foot kitchen where 10 youth will work alongside Bay Area superstar chefs to execute up to 600 lunchboxes a day.

Of the $40K we’re raising, we will allocate $15K to kitchen supplies and equipment, enabling our youth to prep delicious meals:


A few highlights from our amazing list of rewards and perks:

Our Delicious Community Lunchbox!

At a discounted rate of $10 for the length of this campaign (regular price $13).

The Town Kitchen Tote


The Town Kitchen (Perfect) Mug

Canvas Utility Apron (actual!)


Hand-crafted Leather Knife Roll (actual!)



A dinner party led by some of these fine folks


Youth are the core of The Town Kitchen. We will educate and train local low-income Oakland youth in food preparation, food entrepreneurship, and food justice. They'll also take part in The Town Kitchen decision making and have equity in our business!

Hiring high-potential youth makes them less likely to be incarcerated and more likely to graduate from college. This is crucial because California has the highest number of incarcerated youth in the U.S. (11,532). California also has the second lowest percentage of youth (25 or older) completing a bachelor’s degree: 18.2%.

Benefiting the Local Economy

Employing youth is also better for our local economy. For every $1 invested in youth skills, $10 goes back into our local economy!

We are humbled to work closely with three amazing partners: Institute for Sustainable Economic, Educational, and Environmental Design (also known as I-SEEED), Youth Seed, and Impact Hub Oakland. I-SEEED is helping us create a curriculum for our youth that will give them college credits at San Francisco State University and other colleges, Youth Seed supports us with an engaging youth entrepreneurship program model, and Impact Hub Oakland is our amazing co-working space.

We are also thrilled to work with talented San Francisco Bay Area chefs and artisans like Chef Jefferson Sevilla, formerly with Google’s San Francisco office and SpoonRocket, along with local artisan businesses such as Divine Chai, Sugar Knife Sweets, and Kika’s Treats.


We’d be eternally grateful if you can share our campaign via your social networks (e.g., Facebook, and Twitter), email, morse code, telegraph, or any other way you can think of!

         

Win a spot in The Town Kitchen Recipe Book!

Share your favorite (most impressive) recipe on Twitter, Facebook or Instagram - with #TheTownKitchen - and you could land a spot in the official Town Kitchen Recipe Book! Our executive chef will select the top shared recipes throughout the month and our talented youth artists will illustrate them into a one-of-a-kind recipe book available online (and as a reward on this page!). 

Sabrina Mutukisna: Sabrina's previous gig was the California Teacher Pathway, her go-to dance move is the "Roger Rabbit", and her last meal would be her aunt's crab curry.

JP Hailer: JP's previous gig was Director of Operations for Growth Sector, her go-to dance move is The Funky Charleston, and her last meal would have to be a bean burrito and rice from Casa Reynoso in Tempe, AZ.

Jefferson Sevilla: Jefferson (Cheferson) previously worked at Google, his go-to dance move is the "Bernie Lean", and his last meal would be a hot, steaming bowl of authentic Japanese ramen.

Jenn Gross: Jenn previously worked for the San Mateo County Health System, her go-to dance move is the "Running Man", and her last meal would include her mom's noodle kugel and carrot cake.

Linda Yang: Linda's previous gig was Operations and Recruiting at AeroFS. Her go-to dance move is salsa steps and her last meal would be homemade dumplings by her family.

Katie Matsushima: Katie’s previous gig was Glass Guide at Google, her go-to dance move is the hand shuffle, and her last meal would have to be hamachi sashimi and steak hibachi at her family's restaurant.


Contact Us

If you have any questions, comments, ideas for perks, or just want to say hello, please contact Sabrina Mutukisna here: sabrina@thetownkitchen.org.

story:
How Open Arms came to be….


112,000

That’s a HUGE number.  It’s even BIGGER when you realize that 112, 000 is the number of children in the United States that have NO family to call their own.

No mom…

No dad...

Kids who don’t know where they’re going to be for their next birthdays...

Kids who don’t have anyone to show up for the school play or their soccer games...

Kids just like yours and mine.

For over 25 years, I've worked to help connect these kids... the kids who need families... with loving people who are willing to make room in their hearts and homes for one (or 2 or 3) more.

Babies, kids with medical problems, brothers and sisters who can’t live together in foster care, teenagers who are terrified to truly be ON THEIR OWN once the foster care system turns them loose at 18 years old.

Our goal with Open Arms Adoptions is to create a safe environment for everyone involved in the adoption process.

A place where women can come to talk about what they want for their babies—the type of family they are hoping for, their fears about adoption and the type of life they want for their baby.  A place with NO pressure, with counselors who can just focus on them.

A place where people longing to have children—or more children—in their home can come to get honest answers and help in finding the children that are meant to be theirs.

MOST IMPORTANTLY… we want to create an agency that truly works for what’s BEST FOR KIDS!

To make this a reality, we need YOUR HELP.  Our goal of $10,000 will just help us get off the ground.  This will help us put social workers, attorneys and all of the other people that birth parents and adoptive families need in place.  It will help with all of our licensing, insurance and other important “details” that have to be in place before we can even start working with kids. 

A typical adoption usually takes six months or more. Even at the biggest, most well-funded adoption agencies a typical social worker may complete less than 10 adoptions per year. My goal is to place at least six children by the end of 2015 and to place 12 next year. Your donation will give me the funds I need to help expecting birthmothers and adoptive families now as we work to complete families through adoption.

THANK YOU!!

story:
The Cause

After traveling for a year abroad, we're ending our travels by hiking amongst the worlds greatest giants, the Himalayas. We'll be volunteering in small village communities and schools along the way with hopes of helping to create a positive change and contribute to the people we meet. You can help too. With even a small contribution, these communities will see great change and improvements. 

All proceeds will go to Hope Alliance, an Australian non-profit that has partnered with a small village in Nepal. Read more about their specific projects or how to sponsor a child here:  http://hopealliance.org.au
Why help? We'd like this hike to be about more than just our experience, but about an effort by our own community to help another. We'll be volunteering our time to help however we can: teaching, building infrastructure, health, and other community services. Their needs are basic. Some Nepali villages have to walk two hours to get fresh water. Every penny you choose to give will go straight to causes like this. Where pencils and paint are a true gift. Mortar and bricks, a treasured commodity. 
Follow our blog for more updates on our adventure. 
www.millerwanderlust.tumblr.com
Love,
Josh & Taemi

Other Ways You Can Help

As travelers, we understand that sometimes you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Volunteer your time in your own community. You'll be surprised by how many people are in need near you.
